author: JY
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2018
review_content: TubShroom does work, but it does not work better than other products on the market.  Like all hair catching devices some hair does get through into the pipes.  The video advertising shows ALL the hair being caught, but that is not 100% accurate.  My wife has long hair and with this product I still have to use a drain cleaner from time to time, and use a hair pull-out tool to remove hair that went straight by the TubShroom.  I stopped using it, because over time mold started to grow on it.  I could bleach it to remove the mold, but I opted to go back to one of these for $5.00 which works just as good.(https://www.amazon.com/Danco-Bathroom-Strainer-Microban-10306/dp/B004L04X5S/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&qid=1515778106&sr=8-4&keywords=tub+drain+hair+catcher).  If the TubShroom was $5.00 the price would be right, but for $13.00 buy two of the other ones.
title: WORKS OKAY, BUT NOT 100% AS ADVERTISED

author: sasamo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2016
review_content: No seriously - this is amazing. I have long hair and recently had a baby. It's a wonder I still have any hair based on the clumps I see falling out on a regular basis. This means the poor tub drain is getting clogged every time we turn around, and we're spending ridiculous amounts of time with that spiky stick thing you shove down there and then pull out over and over. I figured if this even worked to catch half of my hair then it would be worth its salt. Holy moly. When they say it catches every hair they aren't kidding. We clean it off about twice A WEEK! And when they say it's easy to clean, they are right again. A swipe with toilet paper and the hair blob comes right off to be flushed down the toilet. I've already told so many people about this product because I love it so much. Fantastic!!!
title: BEST INVENTION EVER!

author: Steve
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2018
review_content: Did not work at all for my bathtub. Inserted as instructed. Water backed up and the Tubshroom floats out of the drain almost instantly. I suppose I could try to rig it so it fastens to the drain somehow but that seems like a headache
title: Didn’t stay put

author: Zerubba U Levi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2017
review_content: The TubShroom is a life changer. To market this simply as a revolutionary bathtub strainer is to degrade the perfection of TubShroom.  People often describe their life split into ages, from childhood to college, from marriage to the birth of their children, career growth to retirement. I see my life divided into two distinct periods centered on one singular event: the gloomy, pestilent dark ages before TubShroom, and all the glorious, magnificence days thereafter. No amount of glowing, favorable adjectives will ever do justice to the magnificence of the TubShroom. These are but feeble, limiting words, which by their very nature, cannot capture the richness, splendor and transcendent power that is the TubShroom. In the search for truth, the world’s greatest mathematicians, physicists, and philosophers have all skirted around the wisdom of the TubShroom. In its form perhaps lies the Theory of Everything, a unification of the quantum world with gravitation.  The Freemasons, the Illuminati, all secret societies cherish and hold the principles of the TubShroom to the highest honor. The foundational design of the TubShroom  seemingly violates the Second Law of Thermodynamics, and causes time to stand still. The TubShroom is embodied enlightenment disguised as a humble implement to avoid bathtub clogs.
title: TubShroom is GOD

author: Kael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019
review_content: My tub/shower drain stopper broke and was going to cost $200-600 to replace as the entire drain and pipe connections had to be removed and replaced.  That was not in my budget and I searched for an alternative to the black hole that had become my drain.This inexpensive little TubShroom drain protector and hair catcher dropped right down into the 'black hole', stayed in place, looked nice (white against my white tub/shower) and works great!  The water drains out (no pooling and creating a small lake in my tub as I shower, with the hair caught around Tubshroom.  After showering, I remove  the Tubshroom (it just lifts right out), pull off the hair and toss is in the wastebasket, and drop the Tubshroom back into the drain hole.I haven't had any hair clogs since using the Tubshroom and the little guy can be easily cleaned and freshened up.  It Works!  For those of you who are wondering, NO the Tubshroom is not a cork - you cannot take a bath with it in place.  It will NOT keep the tub from draining.
title: Hey, It Works!

author: Jeff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
review_content: Needed a drain screener since my gf has long hair and she started showering at my place more. This popped up as 'REVOLUTIONARY' and seemed to have good reviews and claimed it was easy to clean. This thing is TERRIBLE. it is by no means easy to clean, in fact it is very difficult to clean and EXTREMELY gross. Her hair wraps around it, gets  some skin and soap scum in there and turns into a bonded sticky mess. Also some hair goes into the holes and means I have to sit there for 5 minutes with toilet paper trying to pull all this crap off it. So not worth it, just get a tried and true basket. And these complaints were after 2 weeks of use. not like it was months. (2 weeks of her showering here sometimes). ITS ABSOLUTE GARBAGE, it is a lie about fixing a problem that never exited. Straight in the trash for me.
title: Not easy to clean and clogs easy

author: Evan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2018
review_content: I just tried a basic plastic snake on my drain today and discovered all kinds of hair and gunk that has gotten past the Tub Shroom, I am very disappointed. The idea of the hair being out of sight isn't necessarily a good one, maybe it is for some people, but for my girlfriend and I, it just enabled us to forget to empty it. Then once cold water builds up around your feet at the start of your next shower, you realize it's full. Then you have to empty it while the shower is already running, potentially washing more hair down the drain while you pull it out to empty it. I don't know if that was the cause of all the gunk I found, or the Shroom just doesn't work, but either way - I'm going back to my old screw-on shower hair catcher. I also noticed the force of the tub faucet would often knock the Tub Shroom up and to an angle, probably allowing hair to be washed past it as well. I wanted to like this product but it just didn't work out well for us. Good luck with your decision.
title: Not all it's cracked up to be...

author: S.K.M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2017
review_content: I shed so much hair and it has always been an issue when it comes to showering! I used to try to catch the hairs before it went to the drain in which I would later have to clean once clogged, and now I encourage and move them towards the drain and my TubShroom! It truly is amazing and the silicone material allows it to not rust like the old metal tub sink screens. It makes cleaning so much easier and I am amazed every time. It even caught my dogs hair and he has short thin hairs!!! Highly highly recommend this to every home. If you found this review helpful, please let me know!! Thank you and hopefully you too can enjoy a Tubshroom. I'm planning on buying one for every sink in the house since they also have it for sinks as well as tubs!!!
title: TubShoom makes my life easier

author: Hannah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2018
review_content: Doesnt really work as advertised. My drain is the standard size but it fit in a way that slowed down the water. So anytime I use it I end up standing in water while I shower- the whole reason I bought this was to AVOiD having a slow drain. Would not recommend
title: Doesnt work as advertised

author: M. Giraldo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2019
review_content: Water accumulated in the tub during a shower because the product doesn’t let the tub drain. See picture. It slows draining so much that it takes 10 min to drain the tub after a 5 min shower....  That is not a good product
title: Slows draining to a crawl, not worth it

author: James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2018
review_content: We have been using the TubShroom since November 2017 and haven't had a clog since then.Our drain uses an old rubber style stopper so we have an open drain when the stopper isn't in use. The TubShroom only works if you have an open drain. If you have an attached metal stopper, then you will need to remove the stopper. Most just unscrew from the drain.Most drains have a metal cross across the hole just a few inches or less from the service. This stops large items from going down the drain but also helps secure the stoppers in place. When we use the TubShroom that metal cross only allows the the Tubshroom only to go down about halfway.Because of this water flows easily around the device and hair and other debris collect on the TubShroom. If your drain does not have this metal cross Only install the device halfway. This will keep your drain flowing freely.I would suggest cleaning the TubShroom after each use or at least once a day. It does collect a lot of hair. Its easier to clean out with only a day or so of use.If your drain doesn't have a stopper and you are constantly getting clogs due to hair and other debris I would suggest picking one of these guys up. They work well and I suggest this product to anyone that has a tub drain issues.
title: It Actually Works!

author: Treesa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
review_content: I tried the tubshroom today for the first time. I used it while washing my hair in the shower. Within a minute of turning the shower on, the tub was filling with water faster than it was going down the drain. At first I thought it was because the holes in the trap are kind of small and as hair gets stuck, it might slow the draining process.After my shower, I had the wait for the water to drain out. Mind you, the water was up to my ankles by the time my shower was over. I didn’t leave the water on the entire time of my shower which I thought would help, it did not. When I went to take the shroom out, I noticed it didn’t catch much hair at all and there were strands I could physically pull out of the drain. I’m positive I had more hair go down the drain than I was able to catch.I do not recommend this product.
title: Did not work

author: CSantoya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2019
review_content: I bought it for two reasons:1) I don't like standing in water while I'm showering. This happens when the "T" shaped part of our drain collects hair. I then have to use needle nose pliers to pull it out (disgusting). Once I've cleaned it, the drain keeps up with the shower flow & I'm not standing in any dirty water.2) I hate using needle nose pliers to pull the disgusting hairball from the drain.The advertisement of this product made it look like it was exactly what I needed to solve these two problems. However, as soon as I installed it, the tiny holes weren't big enough to allow the water to drain as fast as the shower was spraying. So in essence I was replacing the hairball with a silicone blockage instead. This happened while the shroom was brand new and I was using clear water to test it.PROS: Soft durable silicone, easy to clean, inexpensiveCON: Holes are too small to allow water to drain freely
title: Threw it away within a week!

author: C. Walther
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2018
review_content: The TubShroom is supposed to be placed so approximately 1/2 inch is above the top of the drain to facilitate draining.  It kept going down into the drain to where its top edge was flush with the top of the drain.  In that position, the TubShroom won’t let the water drain out very well and the water would stay a long time in the tub.  Unable to use.
title: Bathtub drains s l o w l y when using it.

author: Pat K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2020
review_content: We just recently cleaned out our bathtub drain because it was draining slow.  Wow what a lot of hair.  Anyways, I always see this advertised and thought, why not try it.Pros:  It does catch the hair that goes down the tub.  It's easy to clean, although it's yucky with the hair, conditioner and what ever else was used.Cons: It sticks up about a full 1" to  1 1/2" from the drain.  It's a older tub but didn't realize it would stick out that much.  Pushing it into the drain, the bottom rubber gets bent in all weird ways and it starts leaning to the right/left of the drain, although it is in there.  So there may be a little gap where hair can still go through.Great idea and was planning on getting it for the sink, but I think I'll find something else for that.  I wish it was a bit shorter for the older types of tub/drains.  I did measure it and it seems to be the right size opening, but I think mine is one size on the opening and then starts to get a bit smaller, plus there is a bar there that prevents this from pushing in more.I'm a bit torn between the giving it a 3/4 star because overall it does what it was intended and a great idea, but just not the right size/style for my tub.  I guess things can't all be universal, but I wish it would fit a bit better and not look too weird (leaning to the side) of my tub drain.
title: May stick out a lot depending on your tub drain.

author: steven meadows
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2018
review_content: This product would've been a great idea if it would've fit my drain properly. I removed the stopper to place the tubshroom in it's place, but there are a couple of metal protrusions that keep the shroom from seating properly. The metal protrusions are part of the drain structure and the stopper assembly. I could make the shroom seat properly by cutting the shroom to allow for the metal tabs to bypass the sides, which would destroy the integrity of the product's purpose, to stop hair from going down the drain. Other than that, it is a good concept, but does not fulfill my needs because it is not as universal as led to believe.
title: Not completely universal

author: alisha b.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
review_content: Let me start off by saying I'm pretty sure the piping in my roommates house is bad to begin with. The shower drain would get clogged every month or two. I would use products like liquid plumbr that would help but the problem would come back in about 1-3 months. I bought this product in Sept. 2018. It worked great for about 6 months. It caught all the human and cat hair from going down the drain. It also catches a lot of soap scum and at times can slow down water drainage because of this. Doesn't happen with all soaps, but certain soaps and shampoos kind of get stuck in the holes and cause water to drain slower. I noticed back around May/June of this year, my drain started clogging up/draining slowly again. I think it's because all of the disgusting black build up that is on the inside of all the holes and the entire bottom of the TubShroom. I think this has slowed water drainage enough for me to notice a puddle while I'm showering. As time has went on, the build up has gotten worse. I would clean this every week  why is it getting so black everywhere? There is no way to clean off this black grime, I've tried, and it's disgusting. I think i'll be replacing this with a metal hair strainer instead. While it works for a time, the amount of time it takes to clean this thing in order to avoid build up isn't worth it in the end. It is that reason that I would not recommend this product. This product is only good if you are planning on throwing it away in a few months to a year, but not good for long-term use due to the grime build up.
title: Works, but hard to clean

author: wackerman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2019
review_content: Put this in the shower, and the first shower quickly realized it does not allow proper drainage while taking a shower. Totally gross to stand the entire shower in a puddle of water full of all the stuff you just washed off. Not to mention how gross that is for your shower curtain. No hair was collected- it was brand new. Took it out immediately after the first use. There just aren’t enough holes to allow clean, fresh water to drain out normally.
title: Doesn’t allow proper drainage brand new

author: InPinkClover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2018
review_content: We've had these in our showers for about 2 years now. I think they will last pretty much forever and do catch a lot of hair. We have to clean ours every other shower. I don't think we shed anymore than anyone else and we all have very short hair.My biggest issue with this, and why I will only give it 2 stars is that it's hard to clean and you cannot completely clean it easily.While that say to let the hair dry before taking it off, that isn't always an option.  Still, taking wet hair off the outside works okay.  Kinda gross, but okay.  lol  The major issue is getting the hair & gunk from the INSIDE.  No matter what we have tried, there is stuff stuck up at the top, on the inside that we cannot remove.  THAT is gross.I'm here looking for something easier to clean.  I just wish I hadn't spent over $20 to find out these don't work as well as you would think, with all the positive reviews (did anyone wait to review until they had these for a long while, or did you just review right after you bought it?).
title: Cannot Completely Clean

author: Mirage Kai
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2017
review_content: I have had the Tub Shroom for a little while and I feel I have had enough uses with it to write a objective review. There are far more pro's than con's and if I could I would have given this product a 4.5.Pros:~ IT LITERALLY CATCHES EVERYTHING. It grabs all hair including cat hair, dog hair and body hair.~ We use it both in the hand sink and the tub. Works flawlessly to catch facial hair.~ It's really easy to clean. A simple wipe with some paper towel or toilet paper and it's clean. Occasionally I do wash it with soap as it gets slimy and gunky.Cons:~ Perhaps it's my drain size being too small or me pushing the tub shroom in too deep, but since the tub shroom fits so snuggly in the drain the water pools around my ankles. It's not just a small amount either it literally goes up past my ankles if I take a 30 min shower. It's something I can live with but my boyfriend hates it.~ Because of the water pooling there is a lot of soap scum that is left from the water draining through the tub shroom; all around both the tub and the shower curtain. This means more running water after I leave the shower to rinse off the tub.Other notable mentions is that I have had to clean it in the middle of bathing the dog and cat simply because it gets so clogged up.I would post a picture but no one wants to see that nastiness. All in all I am really please with it and I would definitely but it again. Hope this helped!
title: More Pro's than Con's. Great Product!

author: AZ 50 woman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
review_content: I was really excited - at first. Every day we pulled out the mushroom, fought with the design to get all the hair unwound/untangled, rinsed and replaced in the drain. After approx. 3 months of use, it turned black (originally lime green) and could not be sanitized. My only thought is it must not be able to be left in the drain 24/7. That kind of defeats the reason I purchased it. Super sad because I really wanted it to work. BTW I have long hair (past mid back).
title: Went in trash after 3 months

author: Chi-burbian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018
review_content: i've seen similar reviews about the same issue(s). Overall, this product is great at doing what it says, catching hair in the tub. However, it backs up so frequently that we have standing water happen about twice a week. While we can quickly get the hair off of it to fix the water back-up problem, my "green" tub-shroom has quickly turned more like a darkish black/forest-green/mold color in the holes themselves. I have sat and banged it against the tub, ran it under the tub faucet, hit it with the power stream from the hand-held shower head, just about everything, and those mold rings in the holes themselves cling as powerfully as ever. Because those are IN the drain, it's not a huge deal or eye-sore, it's just the knowledge and frustration that they are there and cause it to back-up so much faster. I think I will run it through a dishwasher cycle in the top-rack and see what happens.
title: Great at catching hair, not great at being cleaned

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019
review_content: I'm able to soak my feet with every shower now!  The tubshroom provides enough material to prevent proper flow to and through the drain so you don't have to choose between a shower or a bath.I received the package on the same night the recycling goes out to the curb.  Based upon all the great reviews I didn't think I'd be returning it and got rid of the original packaging.  By the time the next morning's showers turned into showerbaths the packaging was gone.The one-star rating is mostly for making my husband right when he told me it'd be a waste of money!  😣
title: Works like a drain plug with high pressure/flow showers

author: maisweets
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
review_content: I hardly write negative reviews but I’m on the fence with this product. It’s a great product & does exactly what it says it does. But i honesty can say i’d pay $14 again for another one when I can get a cheap couple-dollar metal hair strainer from Home Depot. I’m not sure how long this rubber will last either vs I know a metal strainer will last a lot longer. It does catch my hair & it’s totally cool how they thought to make this product. It can move a bit to the side if you accidentally hit it. On the positive this strainer does catch lots of hair while still allowing the water to flow freely so you don’t have to take the hair out of the strainer for a few days if you want. For me one shower & it’s about 1/3 full of hair. It’s easy to remove & install. The hair is also pretty easy to take out (some pulling is required). Overall I wouldn’t buy this again unless you’re looking for a strainer that catches hair with free flowing water & don’t mind the price.
title: Good concept but not for this price

author: Dogs Rock
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2019
review_content: Had been using a screen type strainer for a couple years, kept the drain from clogging. Switched to this, it clearly caught SOME hair, but after a couple weeks, had to plunge the drain. This went into the trash and the metal screen strainer went back on. No more problems.It's EASY to clean, but if it allows too much hair to get by, it's not effective. The metal screen strainer is just more difficult to clean and has to be cleaned after every shower someone takes, but it works.
title: Didn't work well

author: KP85
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2017
review_content: Original Review March 16, 2017: Our family includes a long haired girl, big hairy guy, and large dog, so hair in the drain just happens. I got one of these hoping it would help prevent the drain from clogging. We've been using it for about a week so far, although it was easy to install, I'm not entirely sure that it works any better than our standard drain cover. I seem to have to clean it at the same rate and remove a similar amount of hair. We have not had the issues of water pooling like others have, but we don't use heavy body wash or hair products.One of the things I really don't like about this device is that in order to install it I had to remove the chrome drain cover and in our tub there is no hardware underneath, so the gray silicone just sits on top of a grungy looking unfinished metal drain (see pictures but forgive the dirty tub). I know this is more an issue of tub installation, but there honestly is no reason that the area under the drain cover would be aesthetically pleasing, so all of the product pictures are a bit misleading. Unless you have a stopper plug on your tub, there is a good chance what is under the standard drain cover isn't too nice to look at. Our bathroom was renovated and a new tub was installed less than 2 years ago.If anyone knows where I can buy a cover for the ring in either chrome or brushed silver color, or white plastic or gray silicone to match my tub or TubShroom, please advise.Update May 4, 2017: This think gets gunky and nasty over time and will also stain/discolor. Also, when I remove it from the tub there is hair/gunk clinging onto the little metal cross piece in the drain. I like to think that it is still helping more yuck from getting down the drain, but I'm not really sure. It's easy enough to clean but we need to wipe it down a few times a week and then clean it thoroughly (stretching out all the holes to get the gunk unstuck) on a weekly basis. We have definitely experienced water backup, but not when the TubShroom is clean, so I think that's more of an issue with how much gunk is getting caught and less of a device flaw.Super big thanks to dweezil who figured out what that part of the tub is called - it's a tub strainer body! I'm going to have my partner look into them and see if we can install one to make our tub look prettier with this installed. I will update if we can get this to work.
title: Meh

author: LA DIY
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2018
review_content: No one knows more about draining things than I do...Okay?To be perfectly honest, my hair (like some of my other things) has been going down the drain for years, even though many many people tell me that it looks fantastic...and it's 100% real. That, I can tell you.Even though this comes from China, and even though they have been taking advantage of us in many many ways, I love the way it catches all the little brown guys right at the boarder. This thing is like a big beautiful wall right where you need it. It could save billions and billions of dollars over many many years...truly.My home bathroom is golden, the same color as my hair (which I comb over to the RIGHT) which makes it blend in perfectly.  Unfortunately, the new dump I'm staying in is all white and I can't change the bathrooms because there was never any collusion. I can tell you that the incredible men and women who designed this stopper make us all winners, no matter the color of our bathrooms. They're terrific people. The best people.I love looking down in the shower and seeing the little mushroom shape. The drain protector looks nice too and it's white. I almost got the orange one to match, but I think the white one has more power. It's extremely unbelievably tremendous. Believe me.PS Lock Hair Up! Lock Hair Up!
title: A lot of people are saying...

author: Ally
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
review_content: This didn't work at all for us. I had long hair and my husband had longish for a man hair. Pretty quickly into my first shower, the tub wouldn't drain and everything got scummy and slippery, and when I pulled it out, assuming it was full, it hadn't caught anything on the "spool" part of it like shown in the pictures on the packaging. There were a few hairs (mine) and soap scum on top, which is I guess why it clogged. I didn't find even that as easy as I would have expected to clean off of it--the silicon kind of held on to it. My two dollar metal mesh strainer does a better job. I like the look, it fit nicely in my tub drain and sat well, and I love the concept, it just didn't work to actually do its job and catch hair (there wasn't a ton in the tub, so I'm assuming it went right past it?) and it clogged within moments, not allowing any water flow. I wouldn't buy again.
title: Didn't work at all for me

author: Foureyedgrrl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2018
review_content: I have used this product for a few weeks, in an older style bathtub that is from around 1950.  I have long hair, but I catch most of it with a comb.  This catcher definitely seems to catch the rest.  I am the only one who uses this shower, and I clean it weekly. It is gross to do, but really easy.Cons-Doesn't fit an older style drain well (drain is too small), and often looks off-center, like a drunken mushroom.Color-reminds me of urinal cakes in men's bathrooms.  Neutral or grey would be far better, or even blue or green.  It's not pretty in white, even with a white tub.  Doubt it will stay white for long.Shape- not great for older homes, really should have a different sized basePros-Does not interfere with water draining efficiently when showeringCatches it ALL (possibly too much... Soap scum slime, lint bits and every bit of hair ever)Easy to clean, if you stay on top of it.  I'm guessing that a family using it daily, would need to clean it daily)
title: Not aesthetic for older homes, catches everything

author: Dr. SG
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2018
review_content: Before using the Tubshroom, I used a flat hair catcher on my tub / shower drain and cleaning it was gross. This one really does the job nicely. When you lift it from the drain, the hair (absent gunk since only hair remains) is caught by the lip. Hence, you can easily remove hair with a tissue. Also since there is plenty of little drainage holes, it doesn't get moldy compared to a flat hair catcher that covers the top of the drain. The material is soft and easily pliable, thus, fits drain and catches all hair. Well worth the cost compared to hiring a professional drain cleaner.
title: Easy to clean

author: Crawford
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           I've been using this over a month now. I clean it before every shower. I've been trying to let my hair grow out, but I hate baths and I hate water building up in the shower and I hate the idea of hair floating around my feet. This worked okay (not great because it always seemed to clog quickly and then relied on top holes to drain which still meant some level of water in the shower) until today. It was totally clean when I started my shower and I brush my hair really good before getting in (I have thick hair, but it's still not all ponytail length yet, so not THAT long!). Anyway, per usual, the interior cylinder clogged, but then the top clogged too and my feet were entirely covered in water (and I stand up on the higher end when showering). Then it took forever to drain. Using the OEM drain cover, I could (didn't like to do it) grab my hair with my big toe, pull it away for 20-40 seconds and quickly get the shower drained out, but with the Tubshroom that really isn't a possibility, so I was stuck today and just rushed to finish up and get out. I'm single... I clean it before every shower and it doesn't work....
title: Doesn't work....

author: luckyguy1976
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
review_content: I have been using the TubShroom for over one year and it has made my life a lot easier. I have used a few other tub drain strainers in the past and they did not work as effectively as the TubShroom.My wife has long, thick hair and I have an above-average amount of body hair. As a result, I used to have to use an powered auger to snake my main sewer line about once per year (keep in mind... this would happen after it backed up drains and flooded our basement) and a small velcro snake for my tub drain about once every three months, and since I started using the TubShroom I no longer need to snake my drains. We do have to clean-out the TubShroom every time my wife uses the shower because of the amount of hair she sheds while bathing.It's fairly easy to clean but it's a little gross because it's slimy from soap-scum. However, it is well worth the effort because I haven't had to snake my drains nor am I dealing with floods that created a messy clean-up and plenty of damage to our floors and baseboards since using this product.It's pretty durable too... I just replaced it after one year of use because the rubber seal on the base was beginning to warp.Other reviewers say they don't like it because it creates a puddle in the tub basin while showering. This is true but it's because it works so well at blocking all that hair from going down the drain. So, I ask these consumers: "What would you rather deal with - a little puddle in the tub everyday or hiring a plumber to unclog your drain on at least an annual basis (which will cost you a minimum of $200)?" For me, the answer is obvious! If this is the reason you don't like the product, I'd recommend buying two so when one gets clogged halfway through your shower, then you can just replace it with a clean one which will prevent the puddling.I swear by this product and I have recommended it to plenty of others. Do yourself (and your pipes) a favor and buy the TubShroom. You'll be glad you did!
title: Eliminated clogs in our tub drain and sewer line

author: V. G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: Trash! The shroom does catch hair, but some still goes down the drain. It also collects mold and some slime at the bottom and in your drain. The mold and slime collect in the drain with the hair and it creates a mess!!! Still clogged my drain with mold, slime and hair. It’s not easy to clean at all. Rinsing, washing with soap does nothing. I’ve tried scrubbing the little holes at the bottom and it still doesn’t help or remove the mold. It needs weekly scrubbing for a one person use. Even then, it’s a hassle. Removing the hair will spray moldy water all over. I tossed it and and bought a stainless steel disc hair catcher. Waaay better and more sanitary.
title: Not worth all the mold and slime!

author: Stephanie M. Campbell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2019
review_content: I love this thing so much that I just ordered one for the bathroom sink. My husband is the tub issue with hair. He sometimes shaves in the shower and the hair is difficult to get out of the drain since it's so small.  I have long hair as well, and it's keeping me from having to dig it out of the drain.  I had found that there best way to keep it clean is it remove it after every shower and clean it off.  If you do that, the drain flows like normal. I've read some other reviews that said it drained slow no matter what, but I think they don't have it sitting up like it should, so maybe their drain isn't compatible? Mine sits up about 1/2"-3/4" out of the drain and I have zero problems.  The only other thing I can think of is that their drains are needing cleaned out otherwise before using this.In any case, it's a win at my house.  I just pop it into the dishwasher every couple weeks and it keeps it sparkling clean! (Top shelf)
title: The solution to my drain issues!!!!!

author: Jeremy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
review_content: I've used this product for six weeks now and I kinda wish I had one twenty years ago.  Hair is a thing.  That exists.  In my house.  My wife sheds like a husky.  I have three cats that produce hair at an absolutely astounding rate.  We also have a...... husky.  If "dog wool" were a thing I could clothe half of North America with the output of my derpy buddy.  I don't know how he's not bald.  I bought a professional drain snake for crying out loud.  I was absolutely sick of showering in ankle deep filth so I figured I'd give this a try.  Why not eh?  For thirteen bucks it'll either work, or it won't.  Well, I'll cut to the chase.  It works.  I shower in a bathtub that drains now.  Like:  DRAINS.  All the way, no water in the tub at ALL when I shut the water off.  Pros and cons?  Sure.  Pro:  It works.  It's easy to clean.  Enough said.  Cons:  You, your loved ones, and your pets, are all disgusting.  Alllll of your hair, most of the soap, and a good amount of the filth you scrape off of your carcass gets stuck in the 'shroom.  That's kind of its job though, so you really can't call it a con.  "It's filthy, it's icky, I have to touch *gag* it.  WaaaAaAAA"  It's YOUR filth from YOUR body that clogged your drain in the first place.  I have to clean mine every time I shower and yeah, it's gross, but, ya know what?  My tub drains and I haven't had to snake it since.
title: Absolutely Fantastic

author: K.B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
review_content: I edited this post from a 5-star to a 2-star. The shower drain was always clogged with my daughter and my hair. Seeing this "As seen on TV" product I always thought they were a joke. It was on sale and thought, fine it won't work but whatever. The FIRST WEEK, there was hair wrapped all around it. Took some toilet paper, one wipe and it was clean. Shoved it right back in the drain. Easy to use. Easy install and removal. Easy clean up. No water backing up in the shower. No move struggling to get the hair out of the drain and no water backed up. MONTH LATER, everything was still the same. However, the tub is filling up during a shower. The picture provided is 5 minutes after the shower and there is still water in the bottom. I take it out before every shower to make sure it's not clogged because of hair. Now I have to go back and clean the tub from all the soap that's built up during the shower
title: It's okay.

author: tdm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
review_content: This was doing exactly as promised-catching hair and making the retrieval and disposal easy.  Both my daughter and granddaughter have waist-length hair that was constantly clogging the shower drain. After I put this in, I was able to easily clean out the drain when the water movement became sluggish.  My biggest problem-keeping this glorious secret to myself and not telling my daughter I had installed this magical little mushroom in the shower.  Apparently, late one night of marathon showering, the shower was becoming clogged so she took out the might plunger and aggressively and with glee plunged the magic mushroom straight down the drain.  The next day she told me that the shower was soooooo clogged that she had to maniacally plunged for 10 minutes before it becomes unclogged.  I took a flashlight and desperately searched the narrow passage of the drain to see if the mushroom was within grabbing reach.  Apparently, no to be.  My best guess is that it's in the "u" that is part of the plumbing system I can view coming out of the ceiling of my basement, suffering a slow and tragic demise, forever in limbo between a world of useful utopia and worthless waste in the town's sewage system.
title: well, it was working until.....

author: TheOasis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020
review_content: I'm not impressed by this product at all. Although I never was one to clean the hair off my tub, as I'm easily grossed out. So I tried other gimmicky items, but they never work. One of them was almost good, but overtime, I discovered it had icky mildew/molds on the bottom of the drain lid. Anyway, back to this product. So I used it for about a week, then reluctantly clean it out. It was good until I forgot to clean it (maybe 3 weeks?) and my tub starts flooding. I realize if you leave the hair in there that long, somehow the clumped hair slips and falls in the drain. Reason why I guessed that because there was still a clump of hair in the tubshroom so I cleaned it- I thought that would stop the flooding, but apparently not. So had to get my trusty declogger snake, and yup, you guessed it, got me a huge clump of hair back which caused the clog. My tub is now back to normal, and although I still use the tubshroom, I make sure to clean it everyday. I gave it 2 stars because it does not grow mildew/molds so that deserves an extra star. Still low rating due to the slippery material that allows heavy hair to slip (maybe make it grippier so when it does have too much hair, it wont fall in).
title: Not a better mouse trap, keep searching!

author: Michaela
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
review_content: History :I bought the metal tub Shroom one at Walmart. It worked great and did it’s job. It collected all the hair and I had to clean it out after every 2 showers because the water wouldn’t drain. After 2 months of having it, it broke. The top part just popped off and it wouldn’t go back on. Not going to but the metal one again. So I was really disappointed because it was kinda expensive so I got the flat drain covers that you just lay over your drain. It was meant to catch hair but after a week of using it , it hardly caught any hair. So that was basically a joke. I did more research and I found this rubber tubshroom! I was a little skeptical to buy it because my first one broke. So I ended up buying it anyways because I really liked my last metal one.Review :  This one is definitely  perfect ! It’s all rubber so I don’t have to worry about it breaking ( the top part coming off ) and it’s easy to clean. It catches my hair, my hair length is medium to long and I have been shedding like crazy.  I also gave my dog a bath and it caught his hair too.  I highly recommend it. This is the way to go if you don’t want hair going down the drain. I’ll update again in a few months to see if my drain ever gets clogged.
title: This is it

author: CrabbShack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2019
review_content: I don't like this thing at all. Even when there is no hair in it, the water doesn't drain from the tub. We are a family of long haired people and I continually have a drain problem. This is NOT the solution. Sure, it catches hair, but that just makes the drain slower. Without any hair in the mushroom at all, my feet are completely under water in about 10 minutes. I can pull this thing out of the drain and I get the "hurricane" drain going and the water drains quickly... but this just seems to clog it more than it helps. The drain holes on it are too small or something. Water doesn't drain well if you use this, even if there is no clog.
title: Drain is too slow with this thing

author: Lance D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2017
review_content: It does what it says it's going to do: makes it easy to get hair out of the drain.I should probably give it 5 stars but I'm going to nitpick one of it's advertising details and it's this: They act like these are easy to clean and they aren't.Maybe if you lived alone and didn't shower daily they would be easy to clean when dry. But there's 2 of us in this house and we both shower daily. The thing basically never gets a chance to dry and digging the hair out of it is an icky mess.Granted, it's an icky mess that is now made 1000 times easier because I can yank it out and clean it over the sink (and dump the hair in the garbage can) as opposed to digging it out of the drain in the bathtub, but it's still not the super easy pull-off-a-dried-whisp-of-hair that some of the ads try to make it out to beBottom line, if you have hair clogs to clean, you are already dealing with this goop and this product makes it functionally far easier to access and dispose of that hair. But you are still going to be touching the wet icky hair despite the advertisements.Though I suppose another solution would be to buy two of these and swap them out. Let one dry before yanking the hair off of it.Anyway, if you need a drain protector these do work and work well for how cheap they are. They just aren't the prissy no-mess perfection that the ads imply.
title: Functional

author: Kathleen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
review_content: I've had long hair my entire life and have spent much of that life searching for a drain cover that actually catches my hair.  I'm knocking on the door of 50 so have tried many, many different products.  Some have been terrible, some have been good.  However, even the best ones missed enough hair that every couple of weeks I would need to snake my drain and extract a wad of hair.  This isn't hard or time consuming but I could list 100 things I'd rather do than snake a drain.A couple of months ago I was surfing Amazon and saw this product.  I rolled my eyes at the claims and glowing reviews and continued on with my shopping.  A couple days later I found myself snaking my drain (again!), remembered this product and decided I had nothing to lose.Flash forward many weeks and where has this been all my life?!??!  I should have had to snake my drain twice/three times by now.  It hasn't needed it once.I even tested this Tubshroom by cutting my bangs in the bathtub and brushing my cat in the bathtub (I don't recommend that, btw) and this magical device caught everything.I know the Shroom is filling up when there's a little standing water while I'm showering.  Then, cleaning it is simple:  I just wipe a tissue over it and all the hair comes offBuy this.  But it now.  It is perfect.
title: Do not hesitate...buy this now!

author: Chelsea Howell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2018
review_content: I bought this specifically to use for when I bathe my dog, who’s a border collie mix so she has lots of hair that typically clogs my drain up. The entire time I bathed her, I noticed already the water not draining from the tub, and when I removed the device there were MAYBE four hairs of my dogs on it, and the rest clearly in the drain. This is a highly overpriced piece of garbage. Now I get to get some gloves on and clean out the drain!
title: Does not work for pet hair as advertised

author: Mary&Joseph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2016
review_content: Bought this because a buddy of mine said he saw it on a gadget app of some sort. I have used EVERY one of those suction cup hair catchers and they are completely useless and get gross after a few weeks. They never stay attached and don't actually catch all the hair it just sneaks past it cause there is no real seal. I am constantly clearing long hair out of the shower drain and any man who lives with a woman knows this is a regular maintenance once the drain gets slow. I have had the TubShroom in the drain for about two weeks now and I have pulled it out about three or 4 times with hair caught in it so apparently its doing something. Also I just gave my dog a bath in the shower and the claim that it catches dog hair is definitely true as while I was washing him the water started to back up and i pulled it out and it was covered in his hair pulled it off and put it back in the drain good as new. I had put in one of those push down stoppers that allows you to fill the tub and had to unscrew it to install this which isn't really an issue since we never really take bathes. If you have the old style drain with the handle on the tub to close the drain I think you would just have to remove the screen from the floor drain to install this which would still allow you to fill the tub and catch any hair. Overall not a bad product for the price and if i get a year out of it it was well worth it.This is NOT a paid review I purchased this product independently.
title: Hair Catcher for mens sanity

author: Mineat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020
review_content: Note to Amazon: IT DOES NOT SUCK AT ALL!!!!Now that it is out of the way, I can get to the review. I bought this so I can replace a steel-wired strainer that kept blocking the bathroom tub drain whenever me and my family take showers, prompting me to clean it every time, which is gruesome. Installed it right into the drain which has a grill built-in halfway into it.The Tub Shroom really has a lot of holes for its design, which allows a lot of water flow and doesn't collect much short hair (just being honest, no need for racism!). It is very frustrating to get the center when cleaning it. After cleaning it and in the middle of taking another shower, the drain was blocked for a bit, but later slowly drained out. There are plans to clean out the pipes but I'm currently wondering if they're safe to try using vinegar and baking soda on since many fixtures on the same floor the bathroom is on has many plastic pipes in its construction.The only complaints I'm worried about at the moment are about my bathroom's  water temperature, tiling, pipe and tub conditions. The Tub Shroom is but any of these problems.
title: Free-flowing, but couldn't tell if it catches anything short!

author: Loveit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2020
review_content: Absolutely phenomenal!! Super durable!! I have an older home and my shower/tub drain only had metal covering that caught maybe half of my long curly hair! And it would always seem to clog halfway through the shower where I would have to pull the hair off of the drain cover or I would be standing in a pool of water! Now as long as I clean the tubshroom out everytime before I shower, I can take a full shower without standing in water!! It is super easy to put in the drain, it just slides right in. It is super easy to pull out to clean. I recommend cleaning it out before you shower where the hair in the tubshroom is dry but I have cleaned it while it was wet and it still comes off quickly. I do wash my hands after I clean the tubshroom because yes the hair if wet will have soap residue since it is being held on the hairs while the water goes down the drain. However, it is super easy to clean when dry and collects all of my hair and my dogs hair when I give him a bath!! I would absolutely purchase again in a heartbeat!!
title: Highly recommend

author: Kayla
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           I have shoulder length hair and an open drain (as shown in my photos) and used to use a basic, flat ‘hair catcher’ on my shower drain. Before buying this, my husband would have to ‘snake’ and/or use drain-o to clear our shower approximately every 6 months. (Gross. I know. But it’s true). Anyway, my hair stylist recommended I try one of these and WOW. It’s been a total game changer! I have this placed in my drain every time I shower and I clear it off as soon as I’m done. It’s easy to remove the hair (I just use a Kleenex over my hand and pull it all off after every shower) and since having it, we’ve never had to snake or use draino again! It really does work to magically prevent anything from going down the drain that shouldn’t. If you lose a lot of hair, you need this! Your shower (and your husband) will thank you!
title: Ladies, your shower drain (and your husband) will thank you for buying this!

author: Terrie S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
review_content: Oh my gosh.. I feel SO DUMB!!!! I left a review because I HATED this product.. Now I feel completely stupid!! I think we had it in upside down!!! WTH?!!!!!! I flipped it over.. water flows through fantastically, and IT CATCHES ALL THE HAIR!!  YOU MUST BUY THIS PRODUCT!! Don't listen or read my other review.. completely wrong due to my stupidity!!  ~sigh.....Bought this in the hopes it would do what it said.  So sad! It has not collected a single hair in the week + that we have had it! My daughter has very long curly hair, I have medium length.. We both lose a LOT in the shower, causing the random clog. Thinking this would be the answer to our hairy headaches, I bought it.  Total waste of money!! So disappointed!It did fit perfectly in the drain hole. Looked like it would work as stated.. but, the water doesn't drain as effectively while showering, causing you to stand in a few inches of water while showering..But because of this you think, 'Oh my gosh! I can totally deal with this, because it must be collecting all my precious hair I'm losing!!!'..  Yeah.. No.. It's not.. It's just being a jerk by sitting there and not doing the one job it was given.
title: UPDATE of original review!! (face palm...)

author: jjb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
review_content: So, this is a good product and good design, however, in order for it to work properly, it's supposed to sit up a little out of your drain.  However, the length of the item is too long for this in my drain pipe.  It either goes all the way into the pipe, thus plugging the drain and making a bath, or I have to pull it up way farther than it should go, which does catch the hair, but it ends up sitting out at a tipped angle and is hard to position so that it will actually catch the hair.  So it's not very user friendly unless you have the correct length drain.
title: Check your measurements before you order!

author: Janet Chandler
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2019
review_content: Among the many chores I have to do around the house one includes periodically cleaning out the clogged tub drain from all the hair that will accumulate down there. Not a fun job but a neccessary one to keep the water able to drain down freely. When I first heard about the TubShroom the next thing that came to my mind after about how weird the name was just how good can this thing really be. Still if it might help with keeping the drain clear it was worth a shot. So I ordered one. And after about a month and a half of having it in the drain it seems to be doing a good job of keeping the hair from getting down into the drain. Instead it collects around the TubShroom itself. Once a week, and I do suggest you do this, I remove the device and with a paper towel I easily remove the hair the TubShroom has caught. And it is indeed a hell of a lot easier cleaning off the hair from the Tubshroom then getting down on your hands and knees trying to dig out all that gunk that has collected in the drain. It works good enough that we are going for get one for the other tub along with a couple of SinkShrooms for the bathroom sinks.
title: Funny Name, Good Product

author: T. Hollins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2017
review_content: Note the size of the item  ONE AND A HALF INCH pipe. Mine was 1 3/4 " pipe. Didn't even think of checking. I put it in anyway, but it backs up the water too much. However it looked like it was hanging onto the hair that went down.So I believe this is a winner. Maybe if they make enough money they can create a slightly larger one.To be specific the bottom of the Shroom is 1 5/8"The middle must be close to 1 1/4"The top is 2 1/4"I hope this helps.
title: Your pipe must be 1 1/2". Mine was 1 3/4". But even though it dropped in it was still collecting the hair.

author: Erin Wilson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2020
review_content: I thought about posting a picture of this thing in action, but then realized how gross that is, so I decided against it. I have long hair and every two weeks was needing to snake my drain. I bought a bunch of drain snakes on here and then stumbled across the Tub Shroom. I registered for it for our wedding and someone bought us an Amazon gift card, so I ordered this. I put it in the tub and was a little skeptical (it just sits in the drain) that it could actually stop hair from going down the drain, but I decided to take a shower. After the shower, I lifted and there was SO MUCH HAIR in there. It was satisfying to pull it off the Shroom (super easy) and toss it in the trash (well, I put it in the toilet and flush it later, but you get the picture). At first, I was kind of grossed out, but then thought how much more pleasant it is to get rid of the hair right away rather than pulling regurgitated hair from the drain that has been sitting for weeks. Now, it is a little ritual at the end of each shower. I find myself telling my husband how amazing this little thing is at least weekly. Who knew that something so simple could cause me so much joy?! This thing works like a dream and if you are tired of clogged drains or have long hair, you need this.PS. I also bought the Tub Shroom cover so I didn't have to keep my old bathtub plug but could easily switch between showers and baths. If you have any interest, it's here: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07B7SDHKW/ref=twister_B07PY9TVJ3?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1
title: Feeling grateful for this after each shower

author: Amber
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2016
review_content: TubShroom, where have you been all my life?!Seriously, this thing is amazing. As a woman with very long, VERY curly hair, I've battled shower drains my ENTIRE life. But never before was I equipped with such a unique and perfect weapon: The TubShroom.I've used it for about a month and here's what a love so far…1. East installation. You simply unscrew your drain cover and pop in the TubShroom. The end.2. It's cute (and barely noticeable). So often, I find products like this to be functionally amazing but total eyesores. Not the TubShroom. While it does come in some ghastly colors, it also comes in standard white so it's easy to ignore.3. Easy cleaning. This was a HUGE concern of mine. Now, I know it's my own hair but I still don't want to touch it once it's all gunked up with my sloughed off skin and dirt. That said, a quick swipe with a bit of toilet paper gets the TubShroom clean in an instant. Personally, I like to wait until the hair is dry so I've made cleaning the TubShroom a part of my pre-shower ritual.4. GREAT price. Seriously, GREAT. FREAKING. PRICE. I've tried so many gimmicky drain products over the years that I'm amazed that this one works so well and has an AMAZING price point. I mean, I get why (it's all rubber) but still, this little guy is a Godsend so I love that it's so reasonably priced.So, that's it. Buy the TubShroom and thank me later.
title: BUY. THIS. NOW.

author: Stefanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2018
review_content: Yeah this concept is good, except it doesn't fit in my tub drain. Which is honestly a standard normal drain. It tips to the side allowing the hair to get into the drain. And if it stays in an upright position then it doesn't allow the water to drain quickly enough and the bottom of the tub fills up with water and away floats the tub shroom. I had such high hopes. I've tried it multiple times, and it just doesn't work.
title: Yeah this concept is good, except it doesn't fit in my tub drain

author: Lindsay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_content: I regret having kept this in my shopping cart for a year over the price. While $12 seems a little crazy for a tub stopper, it now seems crazy that that was the reason preventing me from getting it, when we ended up having to go through a bottle of Draino and purchase drain snakes (giving a German Shepherd baths in a tub with a porcelain drain doesn't mix), not to mention purchasing an assortment of cheap drain stoppers along the way. You still have to pull it out and clean it every couple of days depending on the traffic your shower/ tub gets and the hair coming off said traffic, but it's a pinch to clean, just lift and wipe off. I'm not sure how people are having any kind of erosion issues with the silicone unless they are leaving it in their drain uncleaned for a very long time. If you clean your tub/shower on a regular basis you will have no issues, and this thing catches everything, it's a winner. Get it you won't regret it.
title: Having trouble with hair in the drain, look no further

author: Yoga Sponge
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020
review_content: I did read lots of the reviews here on Amazon before I purchased this item, and I was still a bit skeptical, because this is a very REAL problem, and the best solution I've found did work but was "meh." Well, we moved and "lost" that other solution, and  being confronted with a new shower situation but same long hairs going down the drain, the question arose once more  -- what to do?I will vouch for this 'shroom thing. I pop it in and out, it's super easy to clean, and my detached hairs are long, upwards of 10+" AND curly! Still, they wrap right around the stem and do not clog the drain. When I'm done drying off and wiping down the shower, I pop the shroom out, pull the hairs off and DONE! If you are not one to clean it after every use, I can't say how it will work for you.Additionally, I have a regular common standard drain size, which I think most homes do have. Otherwise, YMMV.
title: Finally, an easy answer for my long hair and the shower drain

author: lee-lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
review_content: I've had this bad boy for about four months now. It does not need another good review, but here we are. I adore it. I praise it everytime I bathe. I praise it everytime that water drains from the tub so effortlessly. I praise it everytime I notice how much less cleaning I have to do to the tub - no more funky, gunky water sitting in the tub for eternity = way less gunk buildup.I have obnoxiously long and thick hair. I shed more than any human should. I thought I was being clever with my questionable hair-art projects on the shower wall. No way I was letting any hair escape to the drain. Our tub had to be clogging because of all the car liquids and gunk my mechanic husband was washing away. Life went on.I avoided mechanically clearing that clogged up drain for so long. I was still processing the first time I did that. It was at my first ever "I'm an adult now" rental. Y'all... I have a strong stomach for grossness. I gagged the whole time I was pulling that hairball out of my drain. I was CERTAIN it was a dead mouse.It wasn't. It was hair.Finally, this year, it was time. Like I said, I was prepared to scoop grease and grime out of the drain, courtesy of the husband....yeah. No. It was all me. One giant hairball. It had to be close to sentience. For every hair I caught before it hit the drain? There was another that slipped by. And another. And another.Bought the tubshroom that night. Bought the cover for it, because I can't be giving up those long soaks in the tub. Got the drain nice and clear. Got the tub nice and clean. Popped the tubshroom in. Haven't had a single problem since.Sure, it's a little yucky to clean the tubshroom. But, I promise this, you won't mistake that mess for a dead mouse.
title: Perfection

author: Alexandria Segura
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
review_content: Alright, I usually wait to write reviews but this is I bought in February 2017 & continue to be amazed! I had to clean out my drain today for the first time in over TWO YEARS. I have super long, thick hair along with a partner with curly hair, a long haired dog, & basically constant stream of foster animals. Before we got the tub shroom, the drain would start running slow within a week or two. Even cleaning it today with over two years of gunk, it was practically nothing. Y’all, this thing is truly a wonder product. Of all the drain strainers I’ve used, this one so the only one that actually works, is easy to use & clean, AND lasts!
title: Seriously, just get one.

author: OUberLord
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2017
review_content: For years I had issues with my tub drain getting clogged.  Sure, it'd take some time, but once it did it was a huge pain.  I can't really use any stronger pipe cleaners due to my home's mix of different pipes, the softer ones never worked properly, and my snake access pipe only lets the smallest snake heads through.In short: The drain clogged yearly, and every time it was me spending a couple hours cussing at it before calling a plumber and paying for that instead.I'd tried other solutions; mesh baskets, rubber coverings, etc. but they all had issues with water flow.  Sure they caught hair, but it required weekly if not daily cleaning, and even on the best of days I'd still have issues with water not draining fast enough and standing around in the water.  I'd bought this almost solely due to it being something, anything different to try and it was relatively inexpensive.Imagine my surprise when I found it works *perfectly*.  The top of the "stalk" sticks out an inch or two from the bottom of the tub.  The bottom of the stalk forms a watertight seal against the sides of the drain.  This means that water all has to flow through the stalk, and hair invariably just accumulates around the sides of it.  Fresh out of the box or after cleaning I have zero issues with standing water while I shower.  Cleaning it isn't *quite* as simple as the advertising may have you believe but it's commendably close.  Grab a couple sheets of toilet paper, pinch off the hair, repeat, then throw away.  You'll know you need to when water doesn't drain as fast, which in my case is maybe once or twice a month.As such this product is one I felt compelled to review.  Not only is it inexpensive but it works nearly flawlessly.
title: Buy this, and forget about your drain clogging going forward

author: Lauren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
review_content: I found out about this product while reading one of those "Best buys of Amazon" articles a few weeks ago. Well, last week we were having so many issues with water draining slowly from our bathtub and I knew it had to be because of the pounds of hair that leaves my scalp on a daily basis. We pulled out the blockage and it was absolutely disgusting. Had to remove pipes, use a snake, the whole thing. So after my husband threatened to shave off all of my hair, I knew I had to buy this and give it a shot. The delivery came andmy husband looked at it pathetically because its just a small little rubber thing and he questioned how this was going to resolve our hair problem, but it took me only 2 days to fall in love with it. The moment the water started backing up, I lifted this out of my drain and there it was, all of the hair. All of it. It was so easy & convenient!
title: Save your pipes!

author: Nicole C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2016
review_content: I purchased the TubShroom because my daughter and I seem to shed our hair quite frequently and end up clogging the bath tub drain. It gets so bad, that within a matter of weeks, we are standing in up to 6 inches of water.I have tried other hair catchers in the past, but they would somehow move around or let hair slip through underneath them. The TunShroom is the first hair catcher that actually fits into the drain. It has a little lip on the bottom that seems to catch every strand of hair, preventing it from going down the drain. It's made of a flexible silicone that won't rust and washes of easily. It serms to be very thick and sturdy.After a few showers, I decided to pull out the Tub Shroom to see how much hair it caught. I was pretty horrified at how much hair was wrapped around it in just a matter of days! It was actually pretty gross, to be honest. I was able to quickly and easily grab the hair off with a Kleenex, give it a quick rinse, and stick it back in the tub.I am extremely pleased with how well the TubShroom works. It's a great price for something that can save you hundreds of dolls in plumbing expenses. I would definitely recommend it.
title: It actually works!

author: Daisy M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2017
review_content: This little gadget has saved me! It definitely looks like an "as seen on TV" product, but it works like a charm! Our drain used to clog once every two or three months to the point of the bathtub half-filling with water by the end of a shower, and it hasn't clogged once since I plopped this in to replace the drain cover. One star off because it is definitely not as easy to clean as it may seem - soap scum, dirt, and hair get all tangled in the tiny holes. The hair is easy to remove, but the scum is still caked into the holes. Water doesn't drain quite as well as it did at the beginning (there's a tiny puddle near the drain during a shower), but if the drain's not clogging, that's a small price to pay. Wish there was some product/directions to clean it!
title: Works so well, but hard to clean

author: just me
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2019
review_content: Works quite well, and unlike others we have tried it doesn't get all clogged up before you finish your shower.The downside is trying to get the stuff out of the inside of this little thing. it's a bit gross stuffing your fingers inside all the tub scum to clean it out. That's something the other ones didn't seem to collect like this one.Overall its a good thing to have in the drain. It does allow a few hairs to slip by, you can see them in the drain when you take this out, but it catches 100% more than not having anything there at all.
title: Great hair catcher

author: P. Kingsriter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020
review_content: Having a teenage girl in the house tends to lead to a fine clog in the shower drain.  Her fabulous hair just doesn't want to go down the drain and instead collects around the drain cap.  Enter this little beauty as a simple solution.The simplicity of this design is brilliant.  You have to remove your drain cap.  Then you easily slide this into the drain.  It has a flat strainer surface that will catch hair, with other channels to guide water into the drain.  The top of this hair snare rises above the lip of the drain for easy gripping (and thus trapped hair removal).  Once the bottom grill is gunked up, you simply pull it out of the drain, remove the hair, and replace.  Sure, it's gross, but not nearly as gross as having to clean off a drain snake or needle-nose pliers from removing drain bezoars.I'm really grateful for this simple, inexpensive solution to my hairball headache.
title: Simple Installation, Simple Use

author: Julie K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2019
review_content: This product is great! I've tried lots of styles over the year and this one is the best. In fact, I just ordered my second because I was too lazy to clean the other one the way it needed after a couple of years.Things you should know:It gets gross and I hate cleaning it, but there's no getting around that and it's a million times better than cleaning out the gross drain without a catcher.  I generally just pull all the hair/gunk off when the water starts to drain too slow. If you want to keep it nicer, you should also clean the rubber thing itself.When I first ordered this, it took me a long time to start using it.  I couldn't figure out how to get the drain thingy (I'm sure it has a name) out so that I could put this in.  So, figure out if you're up for that! Also, I had to order a flat plastic thing to cover the drain when I take a bath since I got rid of the cover that would normally open/close the drain.
title: I shed, a lot

author: Christine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2017
review_content: Love, love, love this thing! I know it probably seem like a pretty strong sentiment for a rubber plug that stops hair in your shower, but there's nothing I hate more than having to clean out the drains every few months from gobs of hair *GAG*. And I also hate wadding it up in the corner of the shower to throw away later. I've been using this for several months now and in that time we haven't had to clean out our drain once. I just pop this guy out and throw away the hair once a week or so. You might say, "but you're still cleaning out hair" but to me the difference is it's not been stewing down in the drain pipes for months and it just easily slides right off. My hair is a little longer than shoulder length and my husbands is a high and tight style with the longest being a little over an inch and it catches both of our hairs as far as I can tell. Most importantly it still lets ALLLLL the water through so you're never standing in puddles. I would definitely recommend this if you don't have one of those perforated style drains.
title: Love, love

author: Julie Faenza
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2018
review_content: I LOVE this product!! I have tried hair catching devices for drains before, with limited success - either they don't catch all the hair, or they don't fit over the drain. I was a little skeptical that this product, which is inserted into the drain, would be both effective as well as still let water drain out when I was showering. I've been using it for about a month now, and I am delighted! When it's freshly cleaned, water drains from my tub as if there was nothing in the drain at all. I can tell that the product is catching the hair and it's time to clean it when the water stops draining as well. When I pull the product out of the drain to clean it, all the hair is wrapped around the product - there aren't stragglers that are halfway attached and halfway down the drain - and it is incredibly easy to clean. I pull the hair downward toward the end, as if I'm sliding it off like an elastic band, and the hair comes right off. I would rate it six stars if I could - I highly recommend it!
title: An inexpensive way to stop clogged drains

author: Debbie E.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019
review_content: My apt shower/tub drain was frequently getting clogged with hair and I was hesitant to keep using Liquid Plumber every time.I heard about this stopper on a YouTube video and thought I would give it a try.  It works great!  It was easy to just put in the drain hole and when the water started draining slow the next time, I just lifted it out and used some tissue to pull the hair and soap residue that it had caught off, placed the stopper back in and voila, perfect drain flow again!  Only regret is that I didn’t know about this item sooner!  Definitely recommend!
title: Great product!  Works just as advertised!

author: Abigail
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2016
review_content: So I live in an apartment with three other girls... Obviously that's a lot of hair! I got the TubShroom in hopes of avoiding any nasty draining snaking, and so far it has been successful. I'm able to go about 3 days with this guy in the drain before I need to clean it off. The cleaning process was not quite as smooth as the packaging would suggest, but it still only took me about a minute, with a tissue, and it was good as new. And it is by FAR the easiest and most aesthetically pleasing hair catcher I've seen!Honestly the only reason this didn't get 5 stars for me was because of the packaging. The TubShroom is ziptied to the cardboard backing, and I had quite a struggle cutting off the ziptie without cutting through the silicone. But I have no other complaints!
title: Top Contender for Drain Defense

author: Nouvelle Héloïse
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2019
review_content: I have hair past my waist, so keeping drains flowing is a battle.  I also rent, so I was looking for a shower drain solution that wouldn't involve changing much.This shroom seems like a good idea, but it would not stay in place.  In my bath, when you unscrew the normal cover on the drain, there's a frame only about 3/4 inch below that, that the screw goes into to hold down the cover.  That 3/4" is not nearly enough depth for the shroom to stay in place.  Perhaps if my drain had more depth, or the plastic of the shroom were more flexible or "sticky" then it might work, but in my case it soon popped right out every time I tried to put it in.For the brief moments when it stayed, it seemed like it blocked a lot of water as well.  I don't have a high-powered shower, so that seems kind of ridiculous.  If I had great water pressure in my apartment, I'm pretty sure I would have had water at my ankles in no time.
title: Seems like a good idea, but wouldn't stay in place

author: Shay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
review_content: I mean I like to think my apartment has pretty basic stuff like drainage hole in the shower but this was too big and needs to be stuffed in to kind of work. So far its catching some hair but some is still getting through. it doesn’t dry between washes so it needs to be cleaned while wet which can be hard to get the hair out. I’d recommend making sure it fits ? Seems to be an expensive piece of silicon.
title: Doesn’t really fit my apartment drain hole in shower

author: Brittany
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2020
review_content: I like this product but I can’t even use it. I put it in the drain and had it half way sticking out. When I started the shower after 3 mins the shroom was fully in the drain blocking the water from draining out and filling my tub. I had to keep pulling it up and it kept going down so in the end I gave up. I can’t even return it cause the packaging went in the garbage and my kids dumped spaghetti over it. On the only plus side though is that it did catch the hair and was easy to clean. Just wished it worked.
title: kept getting sucked in and blocking the drain

author: Rachel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
review_content: I am so glad I have FINALLY found something that keeps my long, thick hair from clogging the drain. I used to pull HUGE nasty globs of hair out of my drain almost every month and now I do not have to worry about it. After I wash my hair, I just pull the TubShroom out of my drain and easily slide the hair off from around it. I know it catches most of my hair because there is always a TON of hair wrapped around the TubShroom every time I pull it out of the drain. THANK YOU for convincing me that I do not have to shave my head every month I have to tug and pull globs and globs of my hair out of the drain. Also, I have two pug dachshund mix dogs and I give them baths every few months. The TubShroom also collects most of their fur as well. And these two pups shed like crazy so there is always globs of dog fur in the tub and around the TubShroom.
title: Keeps the Drain Unclogged

author: hewlew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019
review_content: Literally never clean your tub drain again, just pull this out, grab a piece of toilet paper, and wipe off the hair into the trash! We clear this off once a week and we never have tub backups. It is so much easier than having to take the drain out and pull the hair out... plus it's way more sanitary! Beware, cats might pull these out of the tub and it might end up in your slipper at the front door. I think that means my cat wants me to clean the drain LOL!
title: Revolutionary
