author: Paul F Karthaeuser
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2019
review_content: Works great out of the packaging but once you get a collection of hair and soap scum on it then it starts to back up and pool water around your feet.  I'm sorry but I find it incredibly unpleasant to stand in my own filthy water. Right?!?!  Quickly it gets covered in black mold like something and the holes will clog obviously with hair but it is imposiible to clean/remove the mold like substance.  Trust me I tried and tried.  Wire brush and straight muriatic acid finally and even that did nothing on the mold.  Typical cleaning requires like 10 seconds and a piece of toilet paper to grab the hair surrounding the drain holes and remove but the black mold builds up and significantly reduces the waters ability to drain efficiently and effectively.  After a few weeks of trying this drain plug and trying repeatedly to clean it i gave up and bought a 2 pack of stainless steel ones very similar in design to this silicone rubber tub mushroom.  Night and day difference.  Buy the stainless steel one, it doesn't grow mold....ever the only issue with those is that the holes are smaller diameter and clog quickly butn the hair wipes off very easily and you're back in business in 10 seconds.  Yes it's annoying to clean it daily but when you do it's the best hair catcher/drain plug ever.  plus you can get 2 stainless ones for the price I paid for this one tub mushroom.  I may drill the holes out larger in my stainless ones and see.
title: Works great FIRST DAY ONLY

author: Kaila
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
review_content: This did not function as advertised for me. I've had this product for a little over six months. At the beginning it worked alright, though I do think it blocked the water flow of the shower/tub even when it was clean (even though it specifically advertised it wouldn't). It also was more difficult to get into the drain than advertised, and I had to fold the little bottom parts to get it to fit properly (even though my shower is standard). More on that later.Immediately upon collecting hair it also became clear that this was not as easy to clean as advertised. It would catch hair, but shower products and other gross stuff would get caught in the little holes of the bottom of the mushroom, and that gunk is very difficult to get out completely unless you want to get in there with several Q-tips or something. Nasty. The hair itself wasn't the easiest to remove either, especially since I have longer hair so it wrapped around and wanted to cling to the cylinder.Finally, six months after purchase, the bottom part has become so bent out of shape that it is literally not doing its job at all - it has begun to let hair through and clog up the drain once more. Save yourself the trouble and the $13, and just get a traditional metal screen. They are more effective, straight forward, and easy to clean.
title: Not 'Revolutionary': Does not work as advertised

author: Lee Stevens
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
review_content: The company changed the material they made it from. Good silicon to some plasticky rubber crap! It's hard to push down in the drain because the sides collapse. I emailed them and all I got was the email tag until I gave up. I surrender but, will not buy anything they make!!So I emailed the company and complained about our product and they sent me a Tubshroom ultra edition. Much better! Buy the ultra edition it better quality and it looks better!
title: Just not the same as the original! Edited!

author: LINDA VANTASSELL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2018
review_content: I've had this product for approximately two months, and I love it.  My hair is thick and extends all the way down my back to my rear.  Needless to say, I have to wash my hair every day.  Prior to purchasing the TubShroom, I used the regular hair trap that can be purchased in any local store.  The problem with the old design is that it does not create a seal so hair would inevitably wind up down the drain and would, over time, build up within the drain and have to be pulled out.  Yuck!  With the TubShroom, this does not happen.  The hair wraps itself around the center and is very easy to remove.  I place the TubShroom in the drain before showering, remove it when done, remove the hair and throw it away, and then I place the TubShroom on a hook to allow it to dry.One of the reviews that I remember reading complained about mold build up.  Well, wherever you have water, you will have mold build up if you choose to leave it immersed in water.  Removing it from the drain and setting it aside to dry prevents this from happening.  I have used this daily for two months and have never had an issue with mold.If you have long hair, I highly recommend this product. It is a better design that actually works.
title: Ingenious Design

author: GwendolynH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019
review_content: I purchased the tub shroom as a replacement for a previous purchased tub shroom. I originally purchased the plain white shroom and it was fantastic for stopping hair from clogging the drain. I purchased the chrome one and did not like that one as much. The chrome one didnt seem to fit as well and though I like the chrome part it didnt seem as effective. The tub shroom is very effective at stopping long and short hair from getting stuck in the drain.My daughter and I both have long hair and I believe it truly helps to save from drain back ups and possible expensive plumbing repairs. This is also great for when my dog gets a bath. It stops the fur from clogging the drain well.I would definitely recommend this product.
title: Second time still great

author: PJL1990
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2018
review_content: I bought this as a Gold Box deal, so I figured what the hell. It was cheap enough to try. Item arrived on time. I opened one up, took off the old screw-down hair drain cover, and put in the Tubshroom. Done! About a week of using it I noticed it wasn’t draining the water as well while showering. That was because of all the hair it had caught that would’ve been stuck in the drain pipe! I took it out, used a paper towel to wipe away the hair around the Tubshroom, and put it back in. Very surprised & happy it works. No more clogged tub drains to clean out for me! Note: if you use a rubber stopper or a ‘pop-up’ stopper for your sink or tub then this item won’t work for you.
title: It works great!

author: jfknapp3
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
review_content: I first bought this product in December 2017.  I love it!! It has saved us from many clogged drains since then.  It is easy to clean. I use a wet wipe or wet paper towel to grab the hair & remove. Then rinse the tubshroom & put back in the drain. Using a wet wipe is the key.  A dry tissue will just fall apart.  A dry paper towel would be better, but using a damp one makes it much easier.  It not only collects hair, but sometimes conditioner and body wash. So it's gross to clean. But it keeps so much from going down & clogging the drain, saving money by not having a plumber come out.  I usually clean it every other day.  Apparently we shed a lot at our house!!  I am buying a new one today because the one we have is starting to tear a little bit around the bottom, but it hasn't affected it's performance at all.  It probably has more life in it, but it's Prime Day and on sale, so I'll get another to have on hand when I need to replace it.
title: Best Hair Catcher for the Tub

author: Avid Shopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2019
review_content: This is a great design for catching hair before it goes down the drain - it really works.  We are on our second one, only because the first one we bought was white and it got moldy and even though I thoroughly washed and boiled in hot water, it stained black where there was mold.  So this time I bought the dark grey one and will make an effort to clean it more frequently.  Our bathtub is cleaned on a regular basis by our housekeeper so it isn't like we are nasty and let it get disgusting.  So my only request is that it could be made of an anti-mold material.  But if you want it to collect hair, it is spot on for that!
title: This thing really works!

author: ShortStout
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020
review_content: Does this collect your hair so it doesn't go down the drain? Yes. Is it easy to clean? Yes. Do you have to clean it often? Yes.I have shoulder length, thin hair that's quite thick, so I'm used to my hair strands being all over the place. Knowing that, I brush before I get in the shower so I don't clog the drain as quick. The only other person who uses the shower is my boyfriend, who has short hair.I have to clean the shroom every time after I shower. If I don't, the water doesn't drain. Thankfully it is easy to clean and more pleasant than sticking my hand in the gunky drain. I don't really recommend this for those with long hair, but for those with short, enjoy!
title: Have to clean after every use

author: Mandy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2017
review_content: This is a life changer! I have a lot of hair, and I shed a lot... For years I have been clogging drains everywhere I go. It annoys me as much as the other people in my life. But, now I don't have to worry any more, the TubShroom has effectively caught every hair and there are no more clogs in our tub! I could not be happier with this product, I have begun recommending it to others that have clogging issues. I expect it will save many more relationships. :)A plus, it also catches dog hair! My Labrador get her weekly bath in the tub, she has LOTS of hair too. Little hairs that I didn't expect the TubShroom to catch, but it does! It catches them all! It's simply fantastic!!
title: This is a life changer!

author: gussydlb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2017
review_content: 3 girls... need I say more.  I was having to use my shop vac on a monthly basis to suck the hair and conditioner out of my shower drain.  Using this bad boy, and i couldn't be happier.  I have yet to have a clogged drain.  I'd post pictures of the hair that i pull off of this, but i wouldn't want to disgust you.  If you get hair in your drains, use this product.  AWESOME
title: Excellent product.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2018
review_content: I'll be brief and clear. I was nervous about spending money on something that seems like you'd see it on an infomercial at 2:30 in the morning on a Wednesday. After trying this thing out for a few months, I am over the moon to report that I have not had to clear my pipes in a good while. For something that seems so simple and honestly dumb-looking, this little guy actually works.It's effective at stopping hair and other junk from draining, and it will allow water to drain until nearly every hole on the device is clogged. Cleanup is really not that hard. People were saying it's difficult to clean, especially when wet, but that's not been my experience. Just one or two pinches and pulls with some toilet paper and she's ready to go back to the drain. I suppose the story might be different if you have really long hair, but I doubt it could really complicate cleanup to the point where this thing isn't worth it.So, if you, like I was, are looking at this thing thinking, "is this really worth the risk?", just buy it. This little thingy does actually work, and I'll gladly swap out 20 minutes of waiting around for harsh chemicals to clear my drain for 2 minutes of wiping off the TubShroom.
title: If you're on the fence, buy it. It WORKS.

author: Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2019
review_content: So I got a new roommate, and it seemed like every couple of weeks the shower drain would get clogged. She would then use liquid plumr to bust the clog - but that was pretty useless. After getting fed up with the mini pool that just would not leave the tub, I pipe-snaked the drain clean, and put in my new TubShroom. From then on out, whenever I'd start to notice the drain getting slow again, I'd take the Shroom out, throw the hair in the garbage, put the Shroom back in, and once again have a perfectly functional drain. SO much easier than snaking the drain, and SO much more effective than liquid clog busters. If not for this TubShroom I think one or both of us would have just given up on cleaning the shower drain, and ultimately have paid much more than the $12 for this handy little device, in order to bring the plumber in.
title: Saved my shower!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
review_content: I'm going to  spare you from an attached photo, because ew.I have massively thick & curly hair - it's a wonder that I'm not yet somehow bald from how much I shed. I've experienced the pain so many times of fishing nasty hair from the drain after a long period of time my entire life. I decided to take the leap and purchase this, the price was decent and I needed a better option. Installation was easy, just put it in the drain. I needed to take the stopper out, so whenever my daughter decides she'd rather bathe than shower I need to remove it and replace the stopper, but that's easy enough. I'd say once every two weeks the water begins to not drain in the shower very easily - after my shower I remove the TubShroom (which is completely COVERED in hair) and remove the hair relatively easily then replace it in the drain. Once replaced the water flows down the drain as it should. I knew I shed quite a bit, but I had no idea that much hair was going down the drain.Save yourself the headache of needing to clean the drain and having unnecessary plumbing issues - BUY IT.
title: BUY THIS.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2018
review_content: I'm inherently skeptical of all of the "As Seen on TV" products because they tend to be junk, especially when they're inexpensive like the TubShroom is, so I wasn't sold on the product when I bought it. Now however, I'll be putting these in any tub I ever own. I clean the TubShroom once every 3-5 days which takes 5 seconds, and we no longer have clogs due to the hair from myself, my wife, and our dog (who we bathe in the tub). The only part I don't like about this product is that I didn't think of it first. Great product!
title: At First I Was Afraid, I Was Petrified

author: Portia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2018
review_content: We would give it 12 Stars if we could. We have long hair and have it in the drain haa been a constant headache.In a gray color is discrete bathroom without drawing attention.It's so much easier to take in and out and clean than any of the other ones we've ever used. Plus none of the hair shows.My daughter says we have to order two more because it's such a dream product. We waited over a month to write our review to make sure there weren't any problems overtime.
title: Dream product 12 Stars!

author: Deb M, Mililani
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2020
review_content: It works as it states.  The hair stops from going down the drain.  But here's the gross part.  The shroom is a breeding house for mildew and grime.  It's really gross.  I use gloves to remove the trapped hair, but the mildew build up is intense.  I wipe the shroom with cleaning wipes, but it does not remove all of the mildew.  It plugs the holes.  I even waste hot water running over the shroom, but mildew still there!  If it was made of steel (or some other metal), I'm sure I would be able to wipe away the grime.  The silicone makes it way too hard to keep clean.
title: I'd give it only 3.5 stars because it's so hard to remove the mildew buildup

author: Connie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2020
review_content: This thing is amazing.  I’ve been fighting a hair clogged shower drain and standing in icky water my whole life and suddenly with this little gadget my problem is solved.  Now I’m not stretched out over the tub after every shower trying to wipe up the hair so it doesn’t go down the drain.  I now rinse the tub allowing the hair to go in the drain where I can easily remove the Shroom to clean the hair out of it and replace it in seconds.  When my tub / shower is cleaner my whole bathroom feels cleaner.  I would definitely recommend this to a friend!You will have to do a little research to figure out how to remove your current tub stopper.  They don’t all come out / off the same way, but it is doable.
title: Must have for keeping your drain clear!

author: sarah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2018
review_content: My husband insisted on ordering this thing. I’m failing to see it’s usefulness because I’m still cleaning hair from inside the drain that passes through the shroom, as well as cleaning the shroom before, during and after hair washing. Otherwise I would be standing in water and then slipping on conditioner once it actually drains.Even though I clean the hair off and allow it to air dry between uses it’s still mildewed on the inside. I’ve tried bleach and peroxide and it’s still yucky. We rarely even use the thing because we only wash our hair 1-2 times a week.
title: My husband insisted on ordering this thing. I’m failing ...

author: Just me, Jenna :)
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
review_content: My hair is long and super curly.  I used to wash it in the sink with the strainer to catch hair instead of clogging the shower drain.  I've bought ones for the shower before:  one rusted, and the other was a waste of cash.  I was skeptical at first, but want to wash my darn hair in the shower instead of bent over a sink for a half hour.  My back was hating me for it.Well, my back loves me now!  Easy to use and clean and pop back in and catches all my hair with ease!  Read the instructions and you're good to go.  This was a purchase I'm so glad I made!  If you get tired of having to DIY or call a plumber to snake the drain, this is a purchase you will be glad to of made.  At least I know it was for me!
title: Worth the money in a world where you don't always get what you pay for!

author: Lara W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
review_content: I live in a house with three people, but often we have our boyfriends/ girlfriends around and it often ends up being five people here with one bath. I have to clean this thing every other day, no exceptions. It's always full, it's always nasty. I pluck it up at the beginning of my shower and tug off the hair and throw it away (my trash can is right beside my shower) and pop it right back in. No clogs, no hassle... just gross.This is a great strainer for the tub, it's soft and nice and can't get kicked out of the way. But be prepared to clean this thing out all the time and just do it in the shower so everything is wet. The entire thing is malleable so the "ring" of hair and gunk slides right off easily. Try not to think about it too much. Good product.
title: Good but gross

author: AimeeP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2017
review_content: I shed hair like a long haired cat in the summer. After clogging the drain a few too many times, I had to find something. We tried a different product that was like a cup with holes that you placed over the drain but it kept like a 1/2 inch of water in the tub while you showered and then a little leftover water sat in the tub leaving rings. Then we realized it was the Cat In The Hat that made the rings and we all had a laugh. But I had enough and needed a solution. THIS WAS IT! Tub drains completely while showering and after. It pops right out and you clean the hair off with toilet paper and pop it back in. I run it under hot water quick then put it back. No hair gets through! Finally a product that does what it claims. Good job TubShroom. Shroom...haha
title: Perfect!

author: Tony Stefani
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019
review_content: Ok so I'm not sure if it works properly or not. It caught some hair but it does not fit tightly into my drain. My house is only 15 years old and has standard plumbing. When I measured the drain it measured 1.5" and this is advertised to fit up to 1.5". It does not. It wobbles around and I'm sure hair is bypassing it. Maybe I got a lemon, but it is of no use to me. Destroyed the package opening it because there is no way around that so I'm sure I can't return it. I guess it will go into the trash. I found another brand that advertises it will fit a "standard size" drain but they list standard size as 1.46" to 1.79". That one will work much better. I had no idea there were two "standard" sizes.
title: Standard size

author: T. Curby
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
review_content: I was so excited to get this and use it because there are 4 girls in my house with long hair. I also opened the box and tossed it. I was sure it would work since I read so many positive reviews. I don’t know if I got a defective one or people were paid to lie on their review but mine trapped more water than any hair. In no time in my shower I was in water over my ankles trying to drain they some pinhole size holes in the top. I readjusted it and tried a few times to no avail. I pulled it out and threw it away... wow at the money they must be making from suckers like me.
title: I wouldn’t even bother trying it

author: amazon mamma of two
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2017
review_content: Ordered wrong size product. So I contacted customer service (an actual human being, how wonderful!) as instructed by Amazon. Asked to snap some pics of drain to get sizing correct in order to get sizing right. Kindly told me to keep original product (which we happily use in 2nd bathroom) & a new one was received in less than a week.Product works flawlessly (2 long-haired gals in our house give it 5 stars!) and has simple design and usage.Cannot think of a single bad thing to say - GREAT PRODUCT & RARE CUSTOMER SERVICE - very happy customer!
title: Fantastic product - stellar customer service!

author: Hannah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019
review_content: If you're easily grossed out by hair globs, beware this product. Pros = our tub hasn't clogged and the drain hasn't slowed since we got this mushroom. We haven't needed to snake our drains at all. Looks nice, and you can't see the hair in it when it's down in the drain. We clean ours maybe once every other week and it's pretty dang gross. The commercial videos show hair easily coming out of it, and that's just not the case. We've tried cleaning it when wet and dry, and both ways just end in gagging. However, our drain doesn't get clogged with hair anymore, so I'd still recommend this product. Just make sure whoever is cleaning it doesn't have an aversion to hair clumps.
title: Tub no longer gets clogged, but mushroom is difficult to clean

author: E. Marlowe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2019
review_content: As a long-haired lady, I've clogged up my fair share of shower drains over the years. After we got our new house, I didn't want to ruin it by constantly having to dig my hair out with snakes or flush chemicals down the drain. I've been using it for about two weeks and it's worked out very well. I do wait overnight to let everything dry out before I clean it, but I haven't had any issues with it backing up or getting slime everywhere. It's amazing how much hair gets caught in it instead of clogging up the drain!
title: So far it's working well

author: Rory
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2017
review_content: It does a great job of keeping hair out of the drain. We have to clean ours roughly once a week or the tub stops draining quickly, but that just shows you exactly how much stuff it prevents from going down the drain and potentially causing a clog.Super easy to clean. You pull it out, wipe it off, and put it back.
title: No More Clogged Drains

author: oregonbowhnter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2018
review_content: The product performs as advertised. It certainly catches hair and did not take long to prove this with 3 females in the house. It also does not impede drain function, there is no standing water in the tub during showers. My guess is if you are finding the water not draining well either you need to clean the Shroom or you have an existing slow drain that needs attention.Best to establish how often you need to clean the hair out of the Shroom, which is probably more often then you think, then rinse it off, then just leave it out of the drain and sitting on the rim of the tub to air dry until the next time someone showers, whoever that is puts it back in the drain and viola', ready to do it's job once again. This way you shouldn't get the funky scum buildup. After reading some of the reviews if you expect to leave it in the drain w/out cleaning it, or letting it dry out once in awhile, of course it is going to get funky. There is nothing on the planet that is not going to get gross if you leave it in a wet tub drain 24/7.
title: Catches Hair

author: dcv
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019
review_content: Absolutely great, what a find.  I have a normal bathroom drain, nothing fancy,  After using all those wire cuppy wire devices that stop draining after getting filled with a few hairs, become jammed with debris and are absolutely difficult to clean (fingernails, brushes)--this ingenious device is the opposite.  It catches hair but still keeps draining and all those other things in the tub and is SO easy to clean.  It doesn't jam.  It is the easiest thing to clean...just a wipe with a paper towel.  Whoever designed this deserves kudos.  I'll be buying more in case they stop making them.  I appreciate the smart, innovative solution this product delivers.  I wish they would make something for the kitchen sink.  I really recommend this product.Disclaimer: this is just a happy customer's (surprised) response to the product & I have received no request from the anyone for a review.
title: Wow!

author: Sargent Dude
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2019
review_content: I live in a very old house and wanted to make sure to get something like this before i started clogging up the drain, well this thing restricted my drain enough to where it was acting like it was clogged! i even went so far as to snake the drain after i realized this to see if maybe the drain was already having issues, well it still backed up water while taking a shower. These may work well on new drains but i think the main issue is my house is very old and the drain system might be a little difficult to have something like this work well.
title: does not work on old drains

author: TAMMY D BARNETT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2019
review_content: GREAT item!  Works very well and is very easy to remove and clean.  I have a toe stopper in the tub that had to be removed but that only took a few minutes. We don't usually use the tub anyway.  I have been using this now for about two months and NO CLOGS!  I remove this and clean it once a week and there is a ton of hair that it catches.  It just lifts out, you clean it and pop it back in.  Takes SECONDS when before I had to remove the toe stopper, take long tweezers and reach down into the drain and TRY to get all the hair which was about a fourth of the hair this catches, then return the toe stopper which was a pain.  All in all that took about 5-10 minutes and then we still had a clog.  This is GREAT!
title: GREAT ITEM THAT WORKS!

author: Khald
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2016
review_content: I was a bit skeptical about this product but for 8 bucks decided to give it a shot. My previous drain strainer was one of the ones with small holes/spikes on the sides and the cage that went down the middle kinda like a sloped hill over the drain. The small holes were impossible to really clean and the whole thing was horrible to clean out since it not only collected hair but also soap residue. The clogged smaller holes also backed up the tub a bit, leaving scummy soap residue and hair that made it look disgustingly unclean.The tubshroom is simple yet effective. The tub drains completely and looks so much cleaner than before. Cleaning hair off it is much easier and without the soapy residue that made cleaning my old one disgusting. I'm honestly amazed how much hair it collects while not getting difficult to cleab or plugging up the tub. I shed hair like a golden retriever, so if it works for me then it should work for everyone
title: Every time I use this I'm surprised I still have hair

author: Christopher Olson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2018
review_content: Looks great, Works good.I am one of thoes people who CONSTANTLY clog drains with how much hair I shed, I have thick medium length hair, and have always had issues with clogged drains, I've tried several diffrent types of drain filters and they either let hair through too easily, or clog instantly, or are just a nightmare to clean.I have to say this is by far the BEST looking one to date.that being said, with my absurd amount of hair loss in the shower, it DOES clog this thing up. resulting in a ankle bath by the time I'm done with my shower.HOWEVER. it let through almost none of the hair, and was really easy to clean (when still wet, don't let the hair dry to this!)I give it 4 stars for making me need to snake my drain less often, but lose a star for eventually clogging in a single shower.I highly suggest this for most people, It's the best product I've found to date. and it looks sooooo much better than anything else I've used!
title: Great for average people, clogs with thick haired people like me who shed a small dog each shower.

author: Carrie Timlin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2016
review_content: LOVE it. We have an older home with an older cast iron tub. It has a crazy U bend that makes it impossible to snake, and some kind of crazy box trap about 3 feet away from the tub.  For 3 years we have battled with a slow drain and hair build up.Last month, we finally had to pull the trap plug - resulting in water on our floor and pulling out a rat sized clump of nastiness.Previous hair traps didn't stay in place, floated, and got stolen by our cat.The Shroom fits perfectly! It captures short and big hair. I have seen some complaints from people saying it made their drain slow - that's because it's grabbing your hair! clean it out after every shower for long haired persons, and you will be happy!!
title: Love love love love love love it.

author: Tiago
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2016
review_content: I have a list of the top 5 most useful items I have purchased over the years of owning a home. This BY FAR is one of the best tools I have ever owned! I have an unbiased opinion. When I review a new purchase, I make sure I give it time to really get a feel for it. I also purposely try to find a flaw to avoid giving out my rare 5 stars. I simply cannot find a negative thing to say with the Tubshroom.  I have 2 ladies living with me, my wife and daughter. I was unclogging our bathtub drain about 1-2 times every 2 months. I have had the Tubshroom now for over a year. Guess how many times I’ve had to reach for the plunger or snake? Zero! Not a single time! I have been cleaning it off about once a week. It is amazing how much hair it catches! You never know how much goes down the drain until you see it collected. Granted, it is as gross as it sounds to clean it, but I cannot fault it for that. It comes with the territory of pipe maintenance.  So in closing... Buy it!! If used and placed correctly, this little miracle worker will save you many headaches in the future. I love it so much, I purchased an extra one to have as a spare! This is one of the best handy gadgets I’ve purchased. Highly rated and highly recommended by me. I will never run the water without this thing in place!
title: Genius! Pure genius!

author: PC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2019
review_content: Ever since my fiancé moved in 6 months ago, our shower always seemed to be clogged. I would use drain cleaners only to have it be clogged again a week later. I knew it had to be her hair because it was everywhere else in the house too lol.So, I took a chance on this "Shroom" because of all the great reviews.Well, it's been over a week and no clogs! I pulled it out to check it the other day and it had a bunch of her hair wrapped around it! I simply just pulled the hair off and threw it in the trash and put the shroom back in the drain. All this took less than a minute.So far, so good. I will update if anything changes.
title: Great product! Gets the job done.

author: Carlisle, PA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2016
review_content: We just ordered a new shroom to replace one that we have had for a couple of years.  The Shroom does a good job of catching hair but you must clean it every few days because it will clog the drain with all that collected hair.We bought the white Shroom to match the tub color.  Time, hair mung  and mold make it turn black in the bottom and nothing seems to kill that mold. We tried washing it with chlorine and cleaning it with several bathroom and household cleaners.  Nothing that we tried would keep the bottom of the Shroom white and clean.  So I still give it five stars for catching hair but rate it lower based on the mold issue.Seems they could make Shrooms out of mold resistant rubber/plastic.
title: Just bought a replacement Shroom

author: mcb in JP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
review_content: We've tried a bunch of other drain protectors, but this one wins HANDS DOWN!  It catches all the hair -- and we have several long-haired shower users!  Once we figured out that it has to stick up out of the drain a little (about 1/4 inch), it works wonderfully.  (If you push it all the way down, the holes in the top are too few to let water out quickly, which results in water accumulating in the tub).  It cleans with a few wipes with some toilet paper or paper towel (don't ever flush hair, throw it out!)  We are very satisfied with this drain catcher.  Finally!
title: This really DOES catch all the hair!

author: Y. B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2017
review_content: We had been putting off buying a drain guard for our bathtub/shower, and it finally caught up with us.The tub always filled with water up to our ankles, and it took forever to drain.Which also meant it took forever to clean-- I'd scrub it down, rinse it, and then have to wait about 30-60 minutes for it to drain. But it drained so slowly that it barely washed any of the cleaner down with it! So I had to do it over and over... it was horrible.Finally I got the drain cleaned out (and the tub clean!), and immediately went online to find a guard.Based on the reviews and my best guess as to what would work well, I chose the TubShroom.I am extremely satisfied. It seems to do a wonderful job of catching the hair, and we haven't had a clog since we started using it!Two nice things about the TubShroom which other guards I've used before had trouble with: it's easy to clean (there aren't lots of little hooks or things to clean in between), and even if you forget to clean it, it lets water through quite well. Many other ones I've used prevent water flow even after a single use, until you clean them!It's also a squishy rubber, so if you accidentally step on it it doesn't hurt your foot.
title: Best tub drain guard I've used

author: Maylin N.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2017
review_content: All my life I have had constant remarks about my fall out. My hair here, my hair there. I got to the point where I am searching for things to improve my situation. This product being one. My hair clogs my shower drain in less than a month, so I am always having to pull out the drain with there being a huge hairball! With now using the tubshroom in over a month I have been able to wipe away the hair every two days or so; it's super simple. I am a bit concerned with the holes being as big as they are because I feel that my hair falls out more than what it catches. Nonetheless, I am happier not pulling out the drain plug ☺If you're looking for an easy clean, literally grab a piece of toilet paper and wipe it away. It's not that hard like the other reviews have said. As long as you maintence it you should have no pool at your feet. This is coming from a girl with long thick Mexican hair.
title: It's not my fault I shed so much! Haha

author: JRF
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2018
review_content: I bought this half asleep one morning as I was scrolling through my social media. A suggestion popped for a TubShroom. I thought "why not"? I used Drano for years and it would fix the problem temporarily if at all.  After years of constantly unclogging drains from hair build up I decided to try a preventive method. The TubShroom is an awesome invention and works without fail. It catches all the hair prior to meeting the pipes. I clean the TubShroom once every two weeks and while it is gross it takes less than a minute to clean. I think its more gross to constantly clog a drain and only notice when you are standing mid shower as the water starts to back up. This is a problem solver and I highly recommended this product for all women or men who have the tendency to shed.
title: Works PERFECTLY!

author: Shelly Arrenquin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: If you’re on the fence about this product, buy it!! You won’t regret it!! I live in an older home so my drain was constantly clogging and is such a pain to get it to clear. After this last time when I had to call a plumber, I decided to try to Tubshroom and I’m beyond thankful that I did. It sits perfectly in my drain and collects all of the hair that would normally end up down the drain. I clean the tubshroom once a week and it keeps the water flowing perfectly!! I bought the first one months ago and have had no issues with actual drain clogs (water will slow as tubshroom becomes full of hair and needs cleaned). I love it so much, I bought one for my parents and now both of my sisters want one too.
title: But it. You won’t regret it.

author: Sprinks&Bell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2016
review_content: As a woman, our hair for whatever reason gets everywhere!  I try to keep on top of it as best as possible but the shower has always been a struggle.  My hair eventually would clog up the drain and was very frustrating because I would try to be careful.  We tried many other products to catch my hair from going down the drain but everything would just resolve things on a short term basis.  Luckily, my husband came across this product and figured we give it a shot.  Let me tell you it's awesome!  I thought it looked really weird and I thought for sure the hair would some how get around it but it doesn't.  I've been using it for close to 2 months now and I love it.  It literally locks into place very well over the drain, catches all my runaway hairs and is easy to clean.  So far it has been worth every penny!
title: You need to try it!

author: K. Zavarin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2017
review_content: These inventors were really thinking outside the box (or inside the drain).  My house only has a shower-over-bathtub option with a small drain, and I've been through about a half-dozen drain covers over the last few years - not one worked well at catching hair.  They either were too light and floated, or suction didn't work, or the holes were so small bathtub would eventually fill with water.  This one is brilliant:  fits perfectly inside my old tub drain, catches every strand of hair (works kind of like a spool with hair winding around the "spindle").  I do need to clean it every time, otherwise it slightly restricts water flow.  Comes in cute colors, works great, not exactly cheap but totally worth it.
title: Brilliant product

author: Anon Ymous
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2017
review_content: Really does catch every hair, can verify works on my really long, straight hair, and my roommate's hair. She's black with long, natural hair, and wasn't sure it'd work super well with her hair, but we empty it like once a week and it's fine. I don't have any problems actually getting the hair off, either, and gunk hasn't had much of a tendency to form on it, for that matter. Definitely looks way cleaner over a period of time than my old hair catchers did. In particular, no surprise pink and black gunk on the underside. The other hair catchers always just ended up feeling really gross since they'd never dry out properly. Really happy with this catcher and won't use the old-style ones again.
title: Better in every sense, works on everybody's hair

author: dhanson865
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2019
review_content: Great for the first 3 months, then it curled up at the bottom and let hair go down the drain.At first it was literally perfect, pull the hair off of it and no slow drain.After a few months of pulling it out to clean and putting it back in the bottom of it curled up and gave a path for hair to go down the drain leaving us with a slow drain and eventually a clogged drain.I suppose if they sold them in a combo pack (maybe 10 at a time) so I could put a new one in every couple of months it'd be perfect. But at this price I can't afford to toss these in the trash and buy a new one that often.
title: Great for the first 3 months, then it curled up at the bottom and let hair go down the drain

author: Nancy Rosenthal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020
review_content: It works really well.  It's amazing how much hair goes in the drain.  I no longer have to take a screwdriver or something to try to get my hair out.  The only part that I am concerned about is that the bottom stretches(?) It doesn't fit as snugly as it did when I bought it a few months ago.  Maybe I am using it improperly.  I would certainly buy it again despite my issue with it.  It is THAT GOOD.
title: It works!!

author: Ms. X
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2019
review_content: PROS- Straight forward to use- FITS Perfectly- Easy to Clean- Continues to drain water WHILE catching hairCONS- minor cosmetic - if the top part was sturdier and had less of rubbery look this product would not just fit functional but aesthetic profileWHY BUY?Any body who owns hair longer than 4 inches must have something at the bathtub or else it’s remembering the plumber’s number because you had to call them to unplug the drains too many times! Hair warrants drain issues and quite a ton of snaking if you don’t commit to hair preventions.Better than competitors.I tried to buy a standard drainer that catches hair similar to the one I use in my kitchen sink. Only issue is that the soap that runs through it eventually hardens and clogs up any water from passing through the net. It then acts like a shower plug. So every wash, I had to clean it right after or else it would clog up my bathtub, and it was difficult as it needed a thorough scrub to clean every small hole of the net.TubShroom was 100X easier - no joke! Because the holes in the tubshroom is much larger (and doesn’t impact its ability to catch hair due to the design) it filters the water without any soap clogs. This means I can shower as many times as I want without worrying that my shower will turn into a gross bath during my shower.When I do clean it, it’s literally grabbing the bottom part of the tubshroom to remove any hair caught - easier than cleaning my hair brush by far because it slides right off. I do appreciate how flexible the material is and how easy it is to clean!Also, keep in mind - I didn’t even measure the bathtub hole, and I rent so in terms of this fitting the standard bathtub, I can verify this will fit and will satisfy your need.Overall I’m pleased with my experience and will continue to use this product until I need to replace it!
title: Easy to Clean & Doesn’t Water Clog!!

author: BohdiTree
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
review_content: This product is much better than a mesh or wire strainer.I hesitated to buy it at first because I thought it wouldn’t be much different but it is.This device drains better than a mesh or wire strainer with hair in it and catches more hair.It is also much easier to remove hair from it than it is to remove hair from a wire mesh strainer, much much easier.That hair spoils around it and can easily be pulled off.It is so effective at catching hair that you have to clean or frequently in order to maintain good drainage.If you take the hair out of it after every bath or shower that is more than enough.Using this is so much better than trying to pick hairs out of a mesh strainer or snake your drain.
title: Much better than a mesh or wire strainer

author: Josen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2020
review_content: My hair is constantly shedding so I decided to try this product as my water was often taking forever to drain while showering. And wow what a difference. My hair completely goes around it and the water continues to drain quickly. As disgusting as it is, it is extremely easy to clean. To remove and apply is so simple. definitely would recommend to anyone with hair that sheds like crazy, your drain will thank you.
title: Impressed and disgusted

author: Mrs. H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2017
review_content: OH.  MY.  GOSH!!!!  This thing is amazing.  I tried about four other products before this and was always dissapointed.  We have a septic system and must be very careful with what goes down the drains including hair.  This catches it all.  But the most wonderful thing of all... NO backup of water while you're showering.  I would always hate standing in the dirty rinse water puddle bc the catch would back up.  Nothing at all with this.  It's amazing.
title: Amazing!!!!!

author: Emily C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2017
review_content: I'm sold. With my post-pregnancy hair shed, our old drain cover was getting covered and clogging up the bath. This thing really lets the water pass through and somehow manages to grip all the hair. It's super easy to remove the hair from it - you don't have to pull gunky gross hair up out of anything, it just rolls right off. LOVE that this device keeps the hair hidden until you're ready to remove it.Pro tip: Keep the top of the cover up out of the tub by about a half inch for maximum performance.
title: It is seriously amazing

author: A. Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020
review_content: This product sticks up about two inches in the drain, no biggie, but if it catches even a few hairs, it then acts as a plug and your standing in filthy water while you shower. It is not that easy to clean either. I find I have to clean it every shower. All in all just ok.
title: Acts more like a plug than a hair catcher

author: JD DaWildman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2019
review_content: This product works quite well. It came as advertised and after using it for over a year, we are about to order a replacement. While it is easy to clean, it also becomes quite nasty, as you can imagine, from all of the soap scum, hair, and dirt it catches.We have a house of 6 and this little gem has kept my bathtub from becoming clogged, as long as the wife and kids leave it in place or clean it and put it back in place when it becomes full.It works as advertised and while it was a little small for our drain hole, we were able to tilt it to the side and keep it elevated enough for it to work as it is supposed to. I would order again, as I am about to at the end of typing this review, and I would also recommend it to a friend.
title: Works Well

author: Grammy2
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2017
review_content: Omg!  I love this thing!  I sent one to my daughter-in-law and grand daughter. We all have long hair and shed in the shower. I have a drain with a plug that screws down. It has broken off and there is only a metal piece sticking up. I couldn't use regular hair catchers because of it. This is open at the bottom and allows me to put it right in the drain. It's perfect. Apparently, hair conditioner doesn't dissolve when it goes down the drain as one would think. I think that's why it's so slimy and gross when you have to clean the drain. Anyway, you could clean this every day or every couple of days. It is so easy to clean and not gross. The hair conditioner is also left on it. It just wipes right off with one little square of tissue paper. One of the most functional things I've bought in years.  I know longer have to have my husband clean the drain.  Joy joy!
title: Omg!  I love this thing!

author: A. Reeve
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2019
review_content: I used to have to clean big globs of hair out of the shower drain every other month.  But now thanks to Tub Shroom, I do it daily!  Yes, Tub Shroom catches the hair, but then it clogs.  And, it's not easy to clean.  Maybe it would work better if my drain was deeper for the device to set into, but I didn't see that recommended.
title: Nope.  Try something else.

author: Josh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
review_content: I'm pretty blown away by how well this thing works. It's one of those genius ideas that are so simple,  you wonder how you didn't come up with it...lol. We recently got out tub drain cleared and they said that it was just some hair. So I bought this, why not. It is insane how much hair comes off my wife's head. This little thing seems to catch every bit or it. It's really easy to clean the hair off. And for those who wrote about mold and mildew, i just took a mold and mildew cleaner, sprayed the tub shroom, before in used it, let it dry and i have not noticed and stains, mildew or mold on it since. I highly recommend this product if you worry about hair and debris clogging your drains..brilliant design
title: Brilliant!

author: Mainemom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2019
review_content: I have used the Tubshroom for a little over a year, and while it does great at catching ALL hair in the tub, it also catches everything else.  Conditioner, soap scum, teeny tiny hairs, anything that might come off you while showering all gets caught somewhere in the Tubshroom...for you to clean out.  Although we've cleaned off the hair after every two showers at least, it remains clogged with conditioner and soap scum and whatever else.  Really cleaning out the clogged holes is nearly impossible.  I've had to periodically soak in bleach or hydrogen peroxide, scrape the inside with a toothpick and jab through all the clogs within, and I still can't get it clean. Dealing with it is gross. This thing truly catches everything, but some things are meant to just go down the drain!
title: Some things should go down the drain

author: Steph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2018
review_content: I have very long, thick hair and have had poor luck with all shower drains and hair traps so naturally I wasn’t expecting much with this but what a game changer! This product doesn’t look like much right out of the box but just plug it into your drain and watch the magic happen. The cleanup is what really has me jumping on here to write a review. Literally takes 5 seconds to peel the hair off and it looks like it’s new out of the box again. Soo happy with this product.
title: Five Stars All The Way!!

author: KarinMarie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2017
review_content: We purchased the TubShroom a few months ago after years of trying a variety of other similar solution products. I have very long hair, so it's always been an issue. This is hands-down my favorite solution. It looks clean when in the tub because the hair catches beneath the topper. Other varieties the hair catch is right on top where it is most visible - GROSS! Typically I let the tub dry out for the day and then in the evening pull it up to remove the hair. I can typically tell when this is needed as the tub drains more slowly. As this is our main showering area I maybe clean it out once a month. However, if you have several long haired folks using the shower I suspect it would need more regular cleaning. Lastly, when I'm cleaning the shower I like to soak it in a bucket of cleaning water to get soap scum off and for general cleaning purposes.
title: Best Shower Drain Protector Yet!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020
review_content: Maybe it's our tub, but the holes in this product don't seem to be large enough to allow normal water flow. Consequently, within a minute, you're taking a shower in a puddle, then a pond, then a lake. Since, for me, the purpose of a shower is to get clean, standing in inches of dirty water isn't part of my plan. My family apparently didn't like it either because they kept taking it out to take a shower and then putting it back in when they were done. Definitely not the purpose of purchasing this product.
title: Holes aren't big enough

author: Nikki
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2018
review_content: This product came to me bent and I was never able to get it to it’s original shape. It let hair down my drain and clogged it within two weeks. I have to throw it out beacuse it was worst than my usual product. Also the material started to warp and became an even bigger hassle than help.  Will never buy again!!!!!!
title: Will Never Buy Again!!!!!

author: Diana Dupree
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019
review_content: I originally gave this product 5 stars but this was before I had really used it. After awhile the Tubshroom gets mold on it. I tried to clean it with bleach but it still wouldn't come off. I have to clean it every other day or it gets clogged up and the water won't drain. It's disgusting to clean with the wet hair and soap residue plus it doesn't come completely clean. Im throwing it out and going back to the metal drain insert.
title: Not great

author: debbielovesbooks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2016
review_content: Update:OK, I have been using this product for a few months now and I cannot recommend it highly enough.  It works great!  I have not had to put drain cleaner in my tub drains even once since using this product.I have to admit I was skeptical about this product.  I have tried so many other products to prevent hair from going down the drain and they never work.  I was very happy to find this product worked exactly as described.  It is easy to install and really does keep the hair from going down the drain.  The hair is very easy to remove unlike some other products.  I highly recommend this product if you are having problems with clogged drains or slow drains due to hair loss.
title: Amazing Product!

author: Tom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2017
review_content: I received this product and it fit perfectly in my drain with no fuss.  I picked it up because, while I have a full head of healthy, strong, thick hair, a clogged drain is not worth the risk.  Plumbers are expensive!Two days later during my morning shower, my bathtub was filling with water!  "That's weird." I thought. "The TubShroom must have slipped farther in, and started plugging the drain."  When I removed the product to examine what the problem was, what stared back at me was pure terror incarnate.  The TubShroom was ENTIRELY wrapped, from bottom to top, in a thick layer of someone else's hair!  This is especially concerning to me, as I currently live alone, which means clearly someone has been breaking into my house when I'm not home to use my shower!I have contacted the police to let them know that a mysterious, possibly balding individual has been breaking into my home when I'm away.  While the police seemed skeptical for some reason, they assured me they'd "look into it."  I have my doubts, so I've also begun investing approximately $1200 into an advanced surveillance system for my bathroom.  Hopefully I can finally catch this shower invader and be able to once again sleep comfortably at night.Thank you, Juka Innovations, for your fantastic product.  Without the TubShroom, I might never have noticed anything was amiss.  Who knows how long this person has been using my shower before I got the TubShroom?  I shudder to think.
title: Helped me discover a home intruder.

author: cyrus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2017
review_content: I am SO happy we got the tubshroom! I had a baby 3 months ago, and the post partum hormones make my hair fall out by the bunch! I could probably make 2 birds nests with how much comes out! (I still have tons of hair thank goodness! 😊)Since I lose SO much hair, it is impossible for the water to drain like normal even with the tubshroom. So yes, the water backs up on ME in the shower. After every shower, I wait for the water to drain to take all the hair to the tubshroom, I use a papertowel and throw away the hair. I then rinse the tubshroom and put it back. Every one in this house is so happy bc I don't leave hidden clumps of hair every where! I use the shower head and wet thh entire shower to take any little hair down to the tubshroom. My shower is clean!!No one else has water back up on them. I have two girls, and a husband with long hair, it flows freely since they're not losing an absurd amount of hair.
title: It works great!

author: PernRider
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019
review_content: My entire family has long hair (three daughters, myself, and a fiancé with a beard down his chest!), and I was constantly having to battle with clogged drains in the shower. After purchasing this nearly two years ago, I have had almost NO fights with the drain! The only issue I ever find is simply having to clean it between showers, because it WILL act as a plug if it’s fully inserted into the drain rather than left raised, and if the hair is not cleaned from it. I swear by it now, though, and no one in the house showers without it...or they have to deal with ME, because I can’t stand snaking the drain or having to use Drano! (Admittedly, that still does happen at times, but it’s gone from every couple of months to maybe twice a year...we have a LOT of long hair!)
title: It’s been a lifesaver, no more Drano or snaking hair from the tub!

author: Stephen Cummings
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2017
review_content: You know how sometimes you see things online, and you wonder to yourself..... is this really that magical? Welp, this is. I have used the metal mesh strainer and those gets nasty and rusty in Seattle so I decided to give this little thing a try. Sure enough, it works as it says it does. I usually let it dry overnight and remove the hair the next day as dry hair grosses me out less than wet. I just use a tissue paper to grab the hair, and since the tubshroom is flexible, it doesn't rip the paper like it would if you were to try and clear a metal strainer. Gotta say, this is one of the best home purchase I've made in the last 6 months. Highly recommend (and great for stocking stuffers)!
title: It really works!

author: laura
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2019
review_content: So I purchased this because I’m tired of buying chemicals to clear my drain. It says it catches every single hair every time which is true. However, let’s talk this through. If it catches every single on of my hairs as I shampoo my mid length hair and then soap up to wash, the water backs up into the tub because it can’t filter through the clogged up tub shroom. Now my feet are soaking in grimy water and my bathtub has a stubborn stuck on soap scum ring. And yes, I do clear it after each shower. It is slimy with shampoo, conditioner, and soap. I’m not impressed.
title: Yuck!

author: AnaMarie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
review_content: I was really excited when this arrived.  I cleaned the drain and installed this right away.  I pulled it out to clean after 3 showers and it was amazing how much hair was there and how easy it was.  Then I waited about 4 days to clean it, and I noticed the bottom had misshapen and it was more difficult to get the hair and soap residue off.  This has gotten worse every time I pull it out to clean it.  Yesterday I noticed the water not draining well even though I'd just cleaned it 2 days prior.  When I pulled the Tubshroom out I noticed the drain was full of hair and soap scum debris.  In less than a month of use the drain was in the same condition it used to take 3 weeks to get to.  Yes it stops some of the hair and debris but not as much as advertised.  I was disappointed to see how deformed it became and how much was still getting through.
title: excitement turned to disappointment

author: Nicki Bunt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2016
review_content: A girlfriend of mine recommended this product to me as a joke because she knows I'm constantly pulling hair from my clogged shower drain. I really don't understand how I possibly lose so much hair in the shower, but it's been a huge problem for years. I figured I'd give it a try and I could not possibly be happier!This TubShroom fits perfectly in my bathtub drain. It just slides right in and it's ready to start collecting the hair! I cannot believe how well this product works!! It literally traps every single hair that tries to go down the drain.I pull it up and wipe it clean after every other shower or so. I've found that the hair is easier to remove when it's still wet. When wet, I just use some toilet paper to grab the hair and it all comes pulls right off together in a big clump. If you try to remove the hair when it's dry, it's a little more difficult as the hair tends to stick to the rubber and get stuck in the holes. I've been using this for about 2 months now and I have had ZERO problems with hair clogging the drain!! Absolutely awesome!!Highly recommend this for EVERYONE!!If you found this review to be helpful in any way, please click the "Helfpul" button right below. Thanks!
title: Holy moly this thing works!!

author: Neilson Vo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
review_content: I have used this product in my shower since moving into my apartment. I never once showered without it and cleaned it religiously. Unfortunately, hair still built up in the drain and caused the tub to fill up several inches after each shower, taking almost a full day to drain. After calling the plumber, it only took a couple minutes to reveal that the source of the clog was simply hair build-up. Evidently, this product did not work at all.
title: DOES NOT WORK. Plumber described excessive hair as sole source of clog.

author: Dabbzy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2017
review_content: This thing is amazing if you have a lot of hair! I can't tell you the times I've stopped our shower up with my long hair and had to pull out what looked like a dead rat from the drain line. This thing catches the hair, you clean it off and toss it in the garbage and your drain line stays clear. I've just got to say, one of the best inventions ever for anyone that doesn't like to clear out drain lines of nasty, slimy globs of hair.
title: Amazing Little Gadget, Must Have!!

author: Robert Verburg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
review_content: This has been amazing at preventing shower clogs.I have two persons with long hair and a short haired dog that sheds in a bath like he has been pranked with Nair.This catches all the hair and prevents drain issues.The only down side is the bottom of the tubshroom is now stained with mildew despite the rest of the shower being clean.You only see the stain when you remove it, but it has resisted all attempts thus far to remove the stain.I will continue to use the tubshroom and will replace it with a new one when it is no longer functional.
title: Hair today, gone tomorrow.

author: Book/Moviefreak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2018
review_content: I am absolutely stunned by how well this little gizmo works!  I have never seen my drain swirl like this makes it do, and never have I not stood in water while showering until I installed this little gem.  It is AMAZING!!!  Whoever thought of this and created it is a certified genius!!  Thank you, thank you, thank you to the genius who created this.  When I get my walk-in shower done, I hope to find the ShowerShroom to purchase for it.  I also need to get the SinkShroom for both bathrooms.  Never again will I have clogged or slow draining drains again!  By the way, I find it easier to clean this gizmo when I get out of the shower and it is still wet with fresh hair that has come off my head.  I've cleaned it both ways now (wet and dry), and I have to say that cleaning it while still wet is the best.
title: This WORKS!!!!

author: Straysod
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2018
review_content: This is by far the best drain protector I've ever tried. It seems like it catches pretty much 100% of hair, even short hairs from shaving your legs/underarms. I'd definitely recommend removing the caught hair every couple of days--because it's so good at grabbing hairs it fills up pretty quick. It is super easy to clean when dry, but because I take showers in the evening and my spouse takes showers in the morning, it never really has time to dry for us. If you're super squeamish, that might be a problem, but I just grab a few squares of toilet paper and pull off all the wet hair at once and it doesn't bother me at all. It doesn't really impede the flow of water at all, either, unless you let it get way way too full. If you use a lot of product in the shower it will eventually get a buildup of soap/conditioner/whatever on it that can be a little gross, but I just take it out and wipe it down every week when I clean the bathtub.
title: Extremely good at catching hair

author: Karen S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020
review_content: I didn't even make it through one shower. I use a suctioned bath mat to prevent slips.  Within a couple of minutes I was up to my ankles in water and my bath mat was floating making the whole shower hazardous.  I turned the water off, pulled the shroom and tossed in the garbage and replaced it with my tried and true small mesh strainer that came with a set of 3 and cost about $1.00 - it never fails to catch hair.  Sorry I wasted my money on this.
title: Does Not Drain Well During Shower

author: Keynotes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020
review_content: I bought this and the plastic strips with the teeth to clean the drain out in my bath tub. I shed worse than a dog so I had quite the build up. I got the drain cleaned out and then stuck this in. It fit PERFECTLY. After a shower I pulled it out and was shocked how much hair it caught. Where has this been all my life?!? I highly recommend. I remove it to stop the bath tub from draining when my daughter takes a bath (use the old fashion stopper.) But it is super easy to stick right back into place. I plan to always have once of these in my bath tub drain. Now to find one for the bathroom sink :)
title: BEST PRODUCT OF ITS KIND

author: Addleton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2018
review_content: My sister and I have very long hair (waist- and hip-length respectively), and we've tried tons of different hair catchers. Most of them worked in the sense that they caught the hair, but they failed miserably in the letting the water drain department. This thing catches all the hair while still letting the water drain so I'm not left standing in a puddle of icky water at the end of my shower. It is also INCREDIBLY easy to get the hair off, and so far, I haven't had any issues with it getting gross or dirty. I DO clean it after every shower though because it can only handle so much hair, and I have a lot.I think it worth noting that I had to clean all the other hair catchers I've tried after every shower as well, so I don't consider that an issue.
title: Where has this been all my life?

author: Cassidy rill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2017
review_content: Was a tad bit skeptical, you know, as seen on tv products can be a hit or miss. I'm very happy with this tubshroom. I have long hair and always lose a lot of hair in the shower. I moved into a new house and the drain cover they had clogged every single time I showered. It was annoying and gross. I use a thick conditioner and that mixed with hair left a nasty hair ball that was visible the entire time. Since I got the shroom I haven't clogged the shower yet. It catches my hair but I don't have to look at it until I clean it off. Also I think the design allows the conditioner to pass or at least dissolve so it's not assisting in clogging my drain. Overall very happy. Wish it came in pink, but that's my own problem. I got the grey color.
title: Perfect

author: Completely satisfied customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2018
review_content: If you're wondering if you need this, you do.  Buy it now.  We recently bought a home about 6 months ago and the shower drain was slowish the past month or so.  Finally got slow enough for me to force hubby to pull gunky hair out and such.  It was still slow and took lots of trial and error to get it completely clear.  Thought oh it must have been hair build up from years and years from old homeowners.  Got this to prevent problem from happening again and I was shocked at the amount of hair on it after ONE SHOWER from one person.  Now I leave it in and clean it off after about 3 showers.  It only takes a second.  Don't wipe it off when it's wet.  Wait till it's dry.  So I will wipe it off before starting up water for my shower.  Then the hair and plastic shroom is dry and wipes off in one swipe of a Kleenex or tp.  Pop it back in and shed away!
title: Disgustingly effective!

author: Monica Bushoven
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
review_content: Having long, thick hair means the shower drain gets clogged very easily. This TubShroom has seriously helped our clogging issue. Before, my hair could clog the drain and cause backup in a matter of a few weeks. Since "installing" the TubShroom, it is immensely easier to clean out the drain, meaning no more clogs! It slips right inside the drain and even sticks up just a little bit (maybe a centimeter?) and is easy to grab and pull out. Just remember to clean it every week or every few weeks depending on how quickly the drain would normally clog. You can pretty easily just wipe out the hair that is stuck around it and rinse it off a little, then place it back in the drain. I will say that over time, there is slight discoloration in mine, but a really good, deep cleaning should do the trick to get it back to normal.Overall, this thing has saved my bathtub from a terribly clogged fate and I am so glad this handy little tool exists!
title: Essential to keeping the drain clear!

author: PJW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: This thing is overpriced and it does a lousy job.  It was too small for my drain so it just fell down inside, not leaving any space to drain through the sides.  As such, it drains super slow and all of the hair and gunk end up on the inside instead of the outside edges.  Not only does this make it a lot harder to clean, the slow draining causes the water to build up in the tub as I'm showering and (when and if) it does finish draining, all of the sludge collects on the floor of the tub.I ended up going back to the $3 strainer that I was using before.  This was a waste of $12.
title: Not worth it!  Went back to regular strainer.

author: Tina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2019
review_content: I get sketchy about products what can be labeled as "As Seen on TV" but because of the high rating, I decided to buy this and I'm so glad I did! This works AMAZINGLY! When I first plopped this in, I wasn't sure if it would work because I had to wiggle it in a bit. I thought that it would be too big for my drain and water wouldn't be able to pass but I was so wrong. As I showered, my hair disappeared down the drain and water still went through. After I finished, I lifted it up and my hair was neatly around the base. I'm so happy with this! No more unsightly hair around the drain!
title: The Best!

author: Jihwan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020
review_content: My apt unit is super old, so everything is just very outdated and the bathtub isn't an exception. My hair is pretty long and it just sheds everytime I shower so it would often clog the bathtub hole. I had this original cover but it didn't prevent the hole from getting clogged. It's very annoying and hard to clean. But oh man this one is a toal life saver. It's extremely handy. You just put it in and that's it. All the hair and other stuff will get all captured by it and when it's time you just pull it out and collect the hair and stuff. Lastly simply dump it in the trash can.
title: Life Saver Ya'll!

author: Ben C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019
review_content: I like how much hair the Shroom catches. I just want to say that some hair still makes it past and clogs the drain, (nothing is a perfect fix for that, but this far exceeds my expectations) but that takes about 4 times as long to happen. With the amount of long hair in this house I was cleaning the drain weekly to remove hairballs. Now it is about every month and a half or so. If I notice the drain being slow I check the Shroom and if it's clear I step on the Shroom a few times and it acts like a mini plunger speeding up the drain until I finish the shower and fish the hair out with a chunk of Velcro on solid copper wire.
title: Works great, well exceeds expectations.

author: David G. Andersen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019
review_content: Needs to be cleaned fairly often, but as far as I can tell, that's because it catches about 3x more hair than any other drain protector I've tried.  I'm happy to pay that price:  I'm using it in a really old plumbing situation where my shower drain was clogging weekly.  I'd taken to using drain maintainer (the bacterial type, not the draino type) every few days.  Since getting this, I haven't had to use the drain maintainer once, and the tub is draining better than ever.  I'm really impressed.  It's a good design, too - takes advantage of a robust 3D design to have lots of exposed drain surface area.  The only drawback is the cleaning, but - that's exactly what I bought it for!It doesn't look nearly as stylish as the flat, stainless oxo drain cover it replaced, but it's SO MUCH BETTER.
title: Most effective hair catcher I've used

author: DaneMom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2017
review_content: This works amazingly well!!! I have long hair and shed handfuls of hair during washing and conditioning in the shower. This catches it all! It doesn't have to be cleaned out after every shower; it actually works better if you only empty it out every few days! The only complaint is that it sticks out above the surface of the drain. (I understand it's part of the design and likely necessary for it's function), however, that small bit that sticks up makes it easy for my dogs to take it out of the drain. They think it's an awesome toy because it bounces and rolls, and then they chew it up all over the floor!!! I've gone through three already and had to quit buying them because of this! I don't like the one I've had to switch to nearly as much and it doesn't catch anywhere as much hair as the TubShroom does.  I wish the manufacturer could modify the design so that it either sits flush with the tub floor, or so that it could fit more snugly in the drain!
title: Absolutely fantastic at catching long and short hair in the shower drain -My dogs think they taste great unfortunately! LOL.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2019
review_content: I love my tubshroom but I do have to replace once a month. Would be cool if they could invent one that won't get moldy. The directions says to clean off every other shower, it actually carts by how much hair you lose, I'm a curly mess so when I deep wash once weekly I lose a ton. I am revolted by wet hair mess so I typically check it after work when its dry and do this daily, this makes it last longer before it gets grungy.
title: Works as it's supposed too.

author: Bellecibunch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2018
review_content: I have three of these in my house now.  I have to clean the drain more often but it is so much simpler to do each time.  I used to need to unscrew the drain and use a hook to pull out all of the hair build up. It would take much longer to back up but it was also a hassle to fish all of that disgusting build up out of the drain.  Now, when the drain slows, we just pull out this product, pull the hair away and pop the drain back in.  Easy enough for everyone in the family to do.
title: This product has made my life easier.

author: bjl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2018
review_content: The product is really good but for me it doesn't stay up when in the drain. It sinks all the way down and the water can't go down the drain. If I tilt it, it stays up but doesn't catch all the hair. I gave it 4 stars as it doesn't fit my drain really. Any suggestions as to how I can keep it in the drain to stop hair from going down without the TubShroom from sinking all the way down would be greatly appreciated.
title: Ease of cleaning

author: Alive Girl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
review_content: I have purchased the metal tubshroom and this rubber one (in the clear color) and previously had a rubber one that my cat sadly chewed up and got a little gunky.
