I found the metal one difficult to clean so I went back to the rubber one and have been rinsing it several times a week when I remove the hair. That seems to have helped with the gunky issue.  I haven't had any clogging issues since using these.  They really do trap all the hair.  It works well when full and I didn't notice before starting my shower - the water is able to drain through the middle, even if it's a little slower.
title: Very easy to clean

author: D&N
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2019
review_content: It does trap the hair at the top and around the sides, as well as wet miscellaneous "lint" . I purchased a white one several months ago, and the biggest issue is the growth of disgusting black slime on the inside of the bottom cylinder part. Even after soaking the entire "shroom" in a bowl of bleach water, the black staining stays and re-grows again. Also, this drain protector must be cleaned every single time you shower to effectively allow water to drain, otherwise you will stand in about 4 inches of water every time. I'm going to dispose of the gross one I have now and try a different drain protector design to see if it will work better.
title: Helps, but not perfect for my needs

author: Jennifer Gill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2017
review_content: I have two animals, and have very long hair myself. After each bath for my animals i drain it with tub shroom. I leave it in unless giving baths to my animals or child. It seems to catch 99% of the hair that falls off of us. Which is great, because I just got a super ball of disgusting hair/goop out of my drain after snaking it. Never again!!!!! It was so disgusting and it took forever to snake that thing out. I peel the hair off weekly of my tub shroom because we are just a hairy house and I'm happy to do it verses the alternative!
title: Which is great, because I just got a super ball of ...

author: W Family
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
review_content: I am enjoying using this product.It catches all the hair and gunk that goes in the drain.The only issue I have with it is that it stops up the water, I have to twist it around to get water flowing down the drain again (this may be because I have thick curly hair).Overall I enjoy this little hair catcher. It makes cleaning up the drain a lot easier!
title: Works well at catching hair 👍

author: pj
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
review_content: Having long hair is the bane of shower drains. I was constantly pouring chemicals down the drain to clear clogs. I saw this and thought I'd try it and it works okay. Just okay!  It does collect a lot of hair, but it apparently allows a lot to pass too... That said, I only have to put the chemicals (Green Gobbler) down the drain every two or three months instead of every few weeks...It works but it is not a panacea... you will still have hair in your trap to somehow remove - just not as often.Would I recommend it... yes I would.
title: Okay, but not a panacea

author: Traci M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2019
review_content: I bought the TubShroom over a year ago.  I have long hair and my drain was periodically getting clogged...so I thought I'd try out the TubShroom.  It catches the hair great.  My only complaint is cleaning it.  I find that to be easy, just wish there was a better way.  I clean it out every few days, we have 3 people showering daily = lots of hair.  When the hair is caught by the TubShroom you have to clean it off or the water can't flow down the drain smoothly.  The best way to clean it off is wet.  Wet the hair, grab toilet paper, wrap it around the TubShroom and pull the hair towards the bottom, most of it will come off with one swipe.  As I said, I have had mine over a year, I bought the white one and it has never molded.  It still looks just like when I bought it.  I think the product is great and works exactly as stated.
title: Works great, cleaning is easy

author: Todd L. Owens
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
review_content: I should have discovered this year's ago.Trying to give my dogs baths were a pain because of the hair that inevitably went (and blocked) the drain!I tried several differ items that was supposed to "catch hair" which was a waste of time and money.This thing is exactly what I needed!I tried it moments after I received it and it worked like a charm!Both dogs got a bath and I did not have to unclog the tub drain or pour chemicals down to unclog the drain.Best money I have spent in a long time!If you have pets BUY THIS!
title: Great buy!

author: Chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2019
review_content: The Savior of Drains! The TubShroom does its job at catching hair! Gone are the days where I have to fish down the tub drain to clean out my fiance's hair! The only minor complaint, which is hardly a complaint at all, is that the hair and and residue that gets caught, will build up and slow the draining process down, which is its job. It's just frustrating having the residue build up on it from products and having to clean that too. And if you don't clean it quick enough, the water will drain slowly and leave residue on your tub. But it's either that or have to do the more painstaking task of cleaning out the drain so...TUBSHROOM IT IS! SAVIOR OF DRAINS!
title: Savior of Drains

author: JoeVegas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2017
review_content: The TubShroom is overpriced for what it is.  It likely costs 10 cents to make so 12 bucks is too much to pay.  We have used it for a few days and it does catch more hair than any other strainer that we've used.  My wife does not like the way it sticks up out of the drain and she does not like, after a shower, having to pull it out and touch it--it can be a bit slimy from soap residue, etc.  Me, I don't care about that.  If you don't think you'd like the style or unwinding the hair from around the spool, you should consider the OXO Good Grips Bathtub Drain Protector.  It catches almost as much hair and my wife says it's easier to clean.  The Oxo sits nicely over the drain and really doesn't move in our tub.  Finally, depending on how long your hair is, I'd recommend cleaning the TubShroom daily so it doesn't get funky.  It is pretty easy to remove the hair.
title: Overpriced piece of rubber, but it works

author: Surf Cal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020
review_content: My shower drain used to back up or drain slow and I needed to clean frequently. But this TubShroom really works! It catches long hair, short hair, and extra like gunky soap and skin etc. It sticks out a bit more than the picture is showing - about 1/3" on my tub because there is a metal stopper inside, but I put in as far as it goes and then totally works fine. The material is very soft silicon so it won't hurt my toes when I step on it by accident. I wish there is SinkShroom as there is really no good hair catcher for bathroom sinks.
title: Works amazing!

author: SBJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2016
review_content: This is about the fifth drain product I've bought trying to keep hair out of our bathtub drain.  Plastic items invariably float.  Stainless steel mesh baskets either haven't fit right or they prevent hair AND water from going down the drain.  This actually works.  Thank goodness.3 month update:  Still very happy to have found this and it continues to do the job and look like new.  I'm going to buy a backup one for just in case they become unavailable.  The pro trick is to remove the hair while it's still wet, much easier that way.  I don't know why the same stuff that I love to touch when attached to a head creeps me out once it's detached but it does so I use chlorox wet wipes to take the hair off the shroom.
title: This is about the fifth drain product I've bought trying ...

author: Penny S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2017
review_content: Lets be real; It’s obvious from the photos that this item is not going to be the most aesthetically pleasing. I choose to go with blue because at least it would match the colors in our bathroom. Really, that doesn’t matter though. You should be making this purchase because of how well it works because people don’t shop for these types of products based on style. With that said, this thing works amazing. You do need to pull it out after every use or at the very least every other to clean it off. It will be gross because your cleaning off hair, shampoo and such BUT it’s worth it and the silicon it’s made of makes it easy to clean off.
title: this thing works amazing. You do need to pull it out after ...

author: Renee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2017
review_content: I am so impressed! We had a hair trap that fit over the drain. It blocked the water from draining properly, and everyone would push it off the drain to allow water through, which made it completely worthless. This Tubshroom is a totally different story! It's only been two days, but it since the water drained freely, no one removed it. The amount of hair it has caught each day has been surprising! I was initially wondering how it would fit and stay in place, but now that I have it, I have no doubts it would fit and stay in place for nearly any drain! Now I've got to get one ordered for the sink!
title: Shocked at how well it is working!

author: kenaka
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2017
review_content: aloha,received the new tubshroom today. i couldn't wait to install it and test it out.  great news! the new tubshroom with the bigger flange worked great! bad news.... i'm losing hair at an alarming rate!great product! great design!best tub hair catcher i've come across. catches all the hair, doesn't clog, so the tub continues to drain well, and easy to clean! and comes in my favorite color orange! i couldn't ask for more.just a note, when you  install it, make sure that the flange at the bottom makes contact with the sides of the drain hole. if the flange doesn't make full contact with the sides of the drain, it won't catch anything. i contacted the company, and they sent me one with a slightly bigger flange. it worked perfect!mahalo and aloha, ken
title: best hair catcher!

author: Hannah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020
review_content: I was hesitant to pay this amount of money for a silly piece of silicone like this but I let myself be influenced by the raving reviews and ended up wasting my money on it. It might prevent clogs but what’s the point if your bathtub will anyway behave as if it was clogged? The water was so slow to drain with this thing in, the water even reached my chins by the end of the shower... That’s so frustrating, terrible design for a huge price, not worth a dollar.
title: Not functional

author: Lindsay Valentine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2018
review_content: This thing is pretty sweet.  I have used something similar before but this one is hardcore.  My only complaints, and it may be because my drain is weird, is that it doesn't go in the drain all the way.It sticks out about an inch from the drain which is annoying That and I guess it works so well that you kind of have to stand in a tub full of water because it takes so long to go through it. However If you are looking to catch any stuff from going into your drain, this is the device for you.
title: Great

author: Leila
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
review_content: This product is absolutely wonderful. I bought this to combat the issue of having to pull wads of smelly, knotted hair from deep within the shower drain (using a traditional cord with notches that pull the hair out). That process is gross and takes too much time. BUT this product has kept me away from that whole ordeal for all the years I have had it, and I would recommend it to anyone. Do keep in mind that you will notice when the product needs to be cleaned when you notice the water going down the drain slower. Cleaning it is simple, all you have to do is make sure it is wet, and then you can proceed to wipe the hair off with a paper towel. This is simple because the product is flexible, and not made from hard plastic. I prefer cleaning this every few days over pulling out huge wads of hair out from the drain every few months!!! Superb product!
title: Amazing! Needs to be cleaned often, but that’s easy!

author: Jasmine G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
review_content: Didn't know this wasn't going to fit properly. I knew it was going to stick out but i didn't realize it sticks out more than it's technically supposed to. Really that's my fault for not looking how tall the thing was. I clean it everytime I'm done taking a shower since i hear a lot of people were having an issue with it still. For me it's working just fine. The water will not drain as fast with the thing in. It works just find if you only have the shower going and not having the battom spout going. I always put mine on after i turn the shower part on. Seems to work just fine and catches a lot of hair!
title: Great

author: J. Zohn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2017
review_content: This is good for keeping the hair from going down the pipes without having to look at a wad of slippery soapy hair all the time. The blue knob  sticking out of the drain is pretty stupid looking, but not as stupid looking as having to suck the clogs out of the drain with a vacuum cleaner while holding a coffee lid over the overflow all the time. It works so well that I bought the one for the sink when they came out with that too.
title: Works

author: Ashley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2019
review_content: The tubshroom is great in theory but apparently does not fit all drain types.The circumference is fine, but in the advertisements the tubshroom is slightly raised, allowing water to go underneath the top. My drain must go a little deeper than others, because the tubshroom fits all the way in, leaving the top flush with the bathtub floor.With that setup, drainage through the four holes on top was not very good, so I had to cut additional holes into the top of the tubshroom. It works okay now, but I don't think collects hair as easily as it is meant to with a different kind of drain.
title: Doesn't fit all drains

author: ACE of Burke's
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
review_content: Awful. There are 4 drain holes at the top that all but stopped the water from going down the drain. My long hair just collected on the top making the drain work even slower. It lasted half a shower before I threw it away. Unfortunately, it was a waste of money.
title: Waste of money

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2016
review_content: I have tried everything I could think of to cut back on hair clogs.  I definitely became a pro at taking apart my drain to clean it which is a disgusting process. Between my long hair and having two dogs who shed in the bed when we aren't around there is a lot of hair of different lengths. This simple creation catches it all and is easy to get the hair off. The drain stopper still works for baths and the soft silicone is more gentle if a kid rubs it then the original screw on drain cover. Fantastic
title: Actually works

author: Ariana Zarate
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019
review_content: I preach and swear by the Tubshroom. It is a life saver and keeps our drains clear. We haven't had to use harsh chemicals to unclog the drains since we started using it. Since two women share the tub we have to clean it more often but it really isn't bad at all. It blends right in the tub- no nasty weird contraptions that trap the hair outside the drain making it an eyesore. LOVE LOVE LOVE.
title: Utter lifesaver

author: Linae BT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2017
review_content: My first glance at this product design had me thinking "yeah right".  But reading the reviews (and being desperately unhappy with our current drain cover), I gave it a try.  It works great! We only need to clean it out every 2 weeks or so, compared to after every shower which saves a few precious seconds during the morning rush to work.With only 2 people in our house, the shower sees relatively light use.  However, my long hair has challenged lesser covers.  It takes a little more work to clean off than they claim but it's not bad. I haven't had any problems with conditioners, etc., creating a mess.  Give it a try!
title: Surprisingly good.

author: Emma Frost
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
review_content: Catches my hair, which is what I needed it to do. I have thick, long hair (down to my shoulder blades) and I typically need to clean the catch immediately after I've showered and washed my hair. I only need to wash my hair once a week though, so it's not too much of an inconvenience. I wish I didn't have to deal with soap scum and conditioner residue, but that's not this little thing's fault. I bought two as my roommate let the first one get nasty and mildewy (he never cleaned his hair from it, so it got gross) while I was away for a week.
title: Does what I need it to!

author: Kaleem
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2019
review_content: This is hands down the best thing I think I’ve purchased on amazon. I can’t belive it took me this long to buy it and boy do I love it. It so easy to setup just I set it in to the bathtub drain and you are good to go. Hair will wrap it self around the Tub shroom and when it’s starting to get full just take a napkin and remove the hairs from it and you can put it right back on the tub.  I will be buying these for all the bathrooms. I have had this for about a month now and it seems to be holding up fine.  I would recommend this to anyone who’s ever dealt with having to use harsh chemicals or even having to call plumbers to fix a clogged drain.  Simply amazing.
title: This is the best thing I’ve bought on Amazon

author: Family account
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
review_content: My husband bought this as he was tired of dealing with clogged drains that we were experiencing due to the length of my hair. Yes, we did start noticing that our drains had to be unclogged less but still needed the occasional declogging even after having the product installed for only 3 months. The grossness comes from all the hair that does get stuck but in addition, it accumulates soap scum, body fluids, etc on the hair it does catch. Maybe this is an issue with our pipes, but the thing doesn't even fit into the drain properly. Oh well. Better luck next time.
title: Not impressed

author: Donna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020
review_content: Usually I am stuck with using a shop vac, to vacuum out out bath drain every two to three weeks because of clogging issues. (I have long hair, and huskys I give baths to)I decided to try out this little device, and I am extremely pleased with its ability to catch hair. I have not had to pull the shop vac back out and I don't believe I will have to as long as I have this little device.There is really no "work" to install, you just take off your drain plug and put the tubshroom in its place, just stick it in the hole, that's it.
title: Amazing😁

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2019
review_content: I've had the shroom for a year and yes it does catch the hair as advertised, but the holes get clogged easily!  I remove it after each use remove the hair, and rinse it, the holes don't clear.  I've soaked it in CLR, bleach, used a micro brush and IF i get it clean, it fills back in within 3-4 showers (yes, still clean after each use).  If you use any sort of shower gel/wash that foams, this will fill the holes as well.  Yes, it does save your drain from hair, but you're showering with your feet in a pool of water, and cleaning it is a pain!
title: Can't believe all the things this company "Claims" , come on.

author: Douglas Parker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2019
review_content: Once you pop the Tubshroom out of the package and stuff it into your drain, it makes your life significantly easier for taking care of your bathtub/shower. I had multiple family members staying here while helping them during transitions at one point, and they all had long hair. I lost my mind trying to stay on top of cleaning out hairs that they missed from the drain. Once I found this, it eliminated the headache and hassle from thereafter. When you're ready to clean it, you just pull it out of the drain and use some tissue to wipe it away and the hairs are intertwined making it really easy to get all of the hair off and out of it with your first wipe. Put it back into your drain, and like magic it drains like normal again!
title: The best $12 I've spent for bathroom care

author: S. Bryant'Peters
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: Just received Sunday 8/7/16, it's perfect!! Hesitant at first because of the price but so worth it!! I used drain declogging stuff before using this to ensure proper water drainage. And I try to clean mine after each shower otherwise it gets nasty and then won't work as well because well it's clogged up. At times the tub will start to fill up a bit with water but then I just take it out mid shower and clean it and all is well.Update 5/20/19As amazing as this is at catching ALL the hair, it makes my tub drain so slow. It often fills up past my feet, even on quick showers and yes even with cleaning it multiple times a day. I've gone back to the Hair Catcher Snare and Strainer, which doesn't make the drain slow up and I don't have to clean it mid shower to get the water to drain. But I kept it at a 3 star rating because it does amazing at getting ALL the hair, including dog hair.
title: Updated review 8/2016 to 5/2019

author: Patree Sheid
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018
review_content: I couldn't open the packaging the drain protector was in.  When I finally took scissors to it, I managed to cut through the protector!  I have never had this trouble before, so I blame the tight packaging.  I guess I'll have to order another one to find out whether it works.
title: Packaging!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020
review_content: This product works great! There are four adults showering in the home (2 women). It does not fit all the way down in my drain but it is still a champ at catching hair. It needs to be cleaned often, approximately every four days. If not cleaned, water will pool in the bottom of the tub. I have found my family does not like the pooling water BUT somehow does not realize how easy it is to clean off. I grab it with the end of a paper towel and use the other end to pull off the hair. The silicone makes the hair slide right off with a firm tug.
title: Works Very Well. Easy To Clean

author: Alexander N.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2019
review_content: I have never written an enthusiastic review for a random product such as this. But there is always a first time!  After years of snaking hair and soap goop from our shower drain, I saw this product.  I was a bit skeptical that something this small and affordable could really deliver on its promises. Boy, was I wrong! It collected enough hair on its first few uses to create a small animal. And when I tried rinsing our rabbit cage, it caught all of the debris. Simply amazing product (and the choice of colors is an added bonus)!
title: Holy Moly

author: Kyla
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019
review_content: I’m a disgusting human. I never knew that I was losing hair at such a rate... I thought we would get this and I would clean it monthly instead of cleaning a disgusting hair clog every 6 months. Little did I know that this shroom would be completely full EVERY SINGLE TIME that I wash my hair. I literally have to empty it three times a week or the water will pool at the bottom of the tub... I can’t believe I lose this much hair. That being said I love this thing and it’s silicone structure makes it easy to clean. But ew.
title: Never knew I needed this so much

author: Good cook
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2020
review_content: To use this gizmo, you must first remove the drain cover and then stuff this into the drain. Then, the water in your shower will collect around your ankles and take a long time to drain out. Most, but not all, of the hair wraps around the gizmo. You have to remove it, clean it and then clean out the drain to remove more hair.
title: WASTE OF MONEY

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020
review_content: Okay, I don't write a lot of reviews, and I was VERY skeptical about buying this. But let me tell you when I say I am IMPRESSED...here's why.My husband and I have a Beagle/Collie mix, definitely more Collie hair, but it is very thin and we spent a long time trying to find a brush that would even catch her hair. Giving her a bath is really the only way to get it all off of her but we didn't want to completely destroy our drains as we have in the past.While giving her a MUCH needed bath, clumps of hair were coming off of her and this thing caught every single hair and drained at a normal pace. I've already told someone else about it and will continue to use this every day. Not only did it catch all of her hair, but also all the hair that came off me when I took a shower earlier that day.A lot of people complain that it stops working after 1 use...you do have to clean it off. But it's very easy. Lift it out of the drain, wipe everything off with a paper towel, be amazed by how much hair it caught, throw away the paper towel, and replace it in the drain. I'm so happy we found this!!
title: Great for pets & humans - read if skeptical!

author: ~My Lovely Me~
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2018
review_content: I bought this for my ex, because when he was staying with me, his ample supply of spare hair was clogging up my shower drain on the regular. He moved into his own place, and they have strict rules about drain clog management, so I bought this for him before he ever even showered there.Just a few days later, he called me to complain: "What is this thing you put in my drain? The water won't go through it!"I told him it was to collect hair so he wouldn't clog the drain. Ever since then, he RAVES about it. I think he must shed enough to fill it up during every shower. Probably once a week he says "Let me tell you - that thing really works!!"So! If you want to be taking this out to clean all the time, and saving yourself the trouble of a totally clogged up drain later, it's what you want!
title: Works too well!

author: Fawn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2016
review_content: I've had this for a week and I really like it. I live with  4 other people and there can be a lot of hair going down the drain. We weren't having an issue with the tub backing up but I thought if I didn't get something soon we might. I saw an ad on Facebook and it looked pretty cool. I've not had the best of luck with the other stick on hair catchers in the past so I thought this might be good. It works amazing! It looks like it's catching everything and not letting one single hair down the drain. I really like this, but if you don't clean it often the hair off water will start to back up into the tub.
title: Love it!

author: Katie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2019
review_content: My hair is about 1.5 ft long and my husband's hair is about an inch. This thing catches it all. We have to empty about every 7-10 showers. I use scissors to just skim across the hair on the side, cut it and it just comes off. The shower continues to drain through this item. I have used different things that have to be cleaned out after every shower. This is great because I'm never standing in an inch or more of water.
title: The best thing I've used

author: Katie C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2020
review_content: Every household should have this in their shower! This thing is AMAZING!I have long curly hair, which means that when it is conditioned and brushed in the shower, a lot of it washes down the drain. My shower drain would be clogged several times a week before we bought this. We bought a Zip It to stick down and retrieve hair, but it was difficult to get down in the drain and didn't get all the hair. This TubShroom was on sale as a Lightning Deal on Prime day so I thought "what the heck, let's try it." After only a month of use, I can without a doubt recommend this product for every home! WE LOVE IT! It's does all it promises. It catches hair. It's easy to remove and replace quickly. It is easy to clean. It is in no way intrusive. Try it for yourself! You will not be disappointed!**One thing I think you should know is that it may stick up out of the drain a bit. I thought we had to take the drain apart or something and that we weren't using it correctly, but upon further investigation, I was wrong. It basically sits on top of the support bracket in the drain and catches the hair.
title: Finally....A Clog-Free Shower Drain

author: Kaydee Park
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2019
review_content: The shroom is super easy to install and remove and it catches everything! But you should definitely clean it either daily or every other day because it not only catches hair but also soap, dead skin, and other gunk so it can either be pretty gross to have to clean or it can end up clogging up your shower/tub if you leave it in too long
title: WORKS!

author: Jamie Adams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: I really like this product, I have noticed it pretty simple to clean off, but sometimes the hair get so wrapped around that it does take a few tissues worth to clean off.I haven't really noticed much suction, it fits well though. Easy to put in and take out. I have noticed that maybe it's because I have really long hair and alot that falls out each time that the bath gets filled because it cloggs a bit with my hair wrapped around it so much. So I end up having to clean it off twice during my shower. Other than that I love it.
title: Pretty good..

author: Caitlin H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2020
review_content: This is the second one I've bought, I did have to replace my first one, it had so much gunk built up on it even scrubbing and soaking it I couldn't get it all off but I'd had it at least 2 years before I replaced it. These things are great, totally save my drains. I just empty it out after every couple showers.
title: Love it

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2017
review_content: If I were a more creative person, I'd write a love song for this little contraption. I have curly hair that sheds a lot, and for years I've battled (unsuccessfully) to keep my bathtub drain clear. I've tried a few different metal strainer things that go over the drain, but they would just get really gunky and only do an OK job. I've now been using TubShroom for a month and it works great! I can usually go 3 showers before cleaning it off. Some have said it's hard to clean off when it's wet, but I just take it out the drain to let it air dry on the side of the tub before cleaning. Very happy with the purchase!
title: I'd write a love song for this little contraption

author: Kyle Schott
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: I thought this thing was going to be amazing and help trap hair (which I have a lot of). I was sold by the many great reviews. Although it fit easily into our shower drain, there aren’t enough holes for the water to drain so the tub fills up with water while you shower which is gross. To be clear, our drain works fine and we never have a problem with drainage. The issue is the holes being too few and too small. I just threw away $11.
title: I wish I didn’t buy this

author: C. Grasso
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2017
review_content: Collects hair very well.  I have a lot of hair on my head, and every time I wash it, it seems like I should have a bald patch from the hair that's come out.  Anyway, the 'shroom collects it well, but by the end of my shower it seems to be so full of hair that the water drainage slows down.  It's not a huge deal, and it's a better system then having to drag clumps of hair away from the drain with my foot as I was doing before, but basically I have to clean the TubShroom after every hair wash.  It's easier and more pleasant than grabbing a glop of wet hair with a wad of toilet paper and having it drip on the floor as you bring it to the toilet; the hair now dries on the 'shroom and I can easily grab it with the TP and throw it in the toilet without touching the cold, wet clump of hair I used to have to deal with.
title: I'm pleased.

author: Lynn K.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2019
review_content: It's obvious this only cost maybe 40 cents to make in China. Why would I spend $13??? It turns out the product is a design miracle! I shed every time I wash my hair and my hunk is a molting fur ball. It was amazing, disgusting, jaw dropping when I pulled the gizmo out after only a week of use. Sure enough tons of hair was wrapped around the spool. Grab some paper, pluck the mass off and flush. Because the top stays above the level of the water it stays clean and you never need touch the spool. No trouble with water backing up. The best part is we will not be pouring chemicals down the drain when it is slow.  FYI I did not receive this for free in exchange for review
title: This Gizmo really WORKS!!!!

author: Michael M-M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2020
review_content: I am very pleased with the tubshroom. I was having a very hard time finding the right hair trap for the tub in my new apartment. I was skeptical of the tub shroom but it is by far the most effective for my tub. I find it easiest to clean the shroom after running the tap a little to wet the hair and then use some toilet paper to clean it. Others have said they find it easiest to clean while the hair is dry. I guess everyone's hair and their soaps are different. I have no problems with the waterflow being blocked unlike previois traps I tried. The shroom goes the longest between cleanings of any hair trap I have tried so far. This is for sure worth the price to try it out.
title: Happy customer

author: Brandon Christenson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2017
review_content: Alright I bought this a while back, I really wanted to give it a run for it money. First off it works exactly how it says and it's really works well. Even In partially clogged drains. However my home has old 1940 plumbing and this doesn't fit the drain correctly. We push it in just far enough that it sticks out like on the picture, sometimes it sits crooked.........IT STILL WORKS! The soft rubber makes it easy to clean and manipulate, it's catches hair better than any drain cover I've used. Plus we now know our pluimbing is stupid and it wasn't hair the whole time.
title: It works like a charm!

author: brian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: I used it for a few months & it kept the drain from getting clogged up. Instead of reaching into the drain to retrieve hair, I'd just take out the tub shroom and put the hair in the trash.As time went on, i noticed that a black moldy substance was building up on the device & it was getting slimy so I put on some gloves and set about cleaning it. No amount of soap, scrubbing, or abrasives could remove the grossness so I just put it in the trash. I replaced it with a stainless-steel grate that was nearly half the price & has shown no sign of wear.This thing is infomercial-grade marketing trash.
title: Impossible to clean

author: Sarah White
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2016
review_content: So far so good. Yes, you do need to clean it frequently as other reviewers have posted; every two or three days for me - I have fairly long hair and shed a lot, and it could probably go a week or so with no attention before water started backing up (I just don't let it get that far). I clean it off right before I get in the shower (so it's totally dry from the night before) and it's really no big deal to just pull the hair off. MUCH better than having to snake my drain every couple of months ... I'll pull a little hair off a rubber thing every couple of days over snaking the drain and pulling out loads of vomit-inducing, smelly hair ANYTIME.And for what it's worth, in terms of durability, my two cats sometimes pull it out and play with it (which involves teeth and claws) and I still haven't found any signs of wear or destruction, so it's got to be fairly tough rubber.
title: So far so good. Yes

author: cbh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2018
review_content: Rarely have I seen an "infomercial" which actually intends to sell a working product. I was pleasantly surprised at how well this worked when I needed something to plug up a gaping drain in my shower and catch the volume of hair I have coming off my head everyday. Easy to clean, any gunk you see in it is probably just shampoo/conditioner that came off with the hair.EDIT 2018-04-06: I am removing a star because even though I clean the product of hair every few days, and spray it with bleach cleaner, the mold on it continues to accumulate over time. It functions basically the same, but with time a replacement would be necessary, perhaps another competitor does better - not sure.
title: Girlfriend sent me the video as a joke for all my hair falling out...

author: Katherine Hailey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
review_content: I had been using a different kind of hair trap, but the one we had was gross and i didn't like cleaning it out. I originally bought one back at the beginning of the year (found it at Target) and decided to give it a try. I loved the first one so much when it finally got worn out/used enough to get another one, i immediately went to Amazon. As soon as I found it it was purchased! These are super easy to clean and very easy to remove the hair from around the cylinder. I'm finding that I have to clean out the drain less and less due to this hair catcher. I will continue to buy and use this product!
title: Love this Product!

author: Karen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2016
review_content: Wow!!!  Whoever invented this product....THANK YOU!!!!  I have dealt with clogged drains for many years...have daughters with long hair.  I have bought every product on the market, but the hair always managed to still slip through.  This product fits snuggly into the drain, while still allowing the water to flow freely.  The hair collects around the bottom, and when you're done taking a shower, you just remove it from the drain, clean the hair off...which by the way is easy to do...and replace the product back in the drain.  Super simple to use, quick clean up of the collected hair.  Seriously, the TubShroom is the BEST product invented!!!!  If like me, you are constantly buying drain cleaners, this will pay for itself in two weeks!  Try it...you won't regret it!!
title: Best product ever invented for preventing hair clogged drains!!!

author: Bethany S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2016
review_content: This works exactly like it says it will! We have a very strange drain due to the previous owners of our home being less than careful with home repairs. I was reluctant to spend $12.99 on something that seemed so silly, so I tried multiple "cheap" items to try and catch hair from going down my drain (none of which worked). I have thick, long hair so we were frequently dealing with a clogged drain. This product fit perfectly and caught a TON of hair in just one use! Some reviews were saying that the TubShroom prevented the water from draining properly but I didn't have that issue. I cleaned it off immediately after my shower and the hair came off super easily. HIGHLY recommend!
title: Kicking myself for not getting it sooner...

author: Mish Mash Michele
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2016
review_content: The manufacturer says it  fits all 1.5" drains, but you also need to have a 1.5" PIPE below the drain. Our kids' bathtub has a 1.5" drain, but the drainpipe is wider than 1.5". Once inserted, there was too much room around the TubShroom, and the hair just went on down the drain. However, when we tried it on a different bathtub, which has a narrower drainpipe, it worked wonders.
title: Drainpipe size matters

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: I bought a white TubShroom several years ago. I shed a lot of hair in the shower and it was clogging my older pipes. The TubShroom fixed the problem. I like how the collected hair remains out of sight, makes the tub look much cleaner. Subtracted one star because the white one became discolored over time and I couldn't clean it, no matter what I tried (soap, vinegar, bleach, laundry detergent). I eventually threw it away and ordered one in gray to replace it. It's much better, no discoloration.
title: Great product, don't recommend the white

author: WASTELAND RAVEN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2017
review_content: Worked like a charm right out of the box, I was having drain issues after washing the dogs and hair from the family always ends up in the drain. This stopper must have caught 99% of my dogs hair (I was scrapping up huge handfuls after the water drained) and no hair/fuzz/fur got into the drain at all, this is a great buy! I will get another if this one goes missing or something, I put it through heck the first use and it was excellent.
title: Keep hair and other crap from going down the drain.

author: Kylie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019
review_content: I have long, curly-ish hair - and a lot of it. I also have an apartment with subpar drainage in the tub. I didn't really like pouring hardcore chemicals down my drain every few weeks, and I didn't like standing in ankle-deep water either (ew).SO, I purchased one last round of drain cleaner, a drain snake, and a Tubshroom. I started by deep cleaning my tub and drain like I had done a number of times before. I also used the drain snake to get any pesky clogs further down the line. Then I popped the tubshroom into the drain, and carried on with life.I haven't had to use chemical drain cleaner since (It's been over 6 months), which means this little piece of rubber has paid for itself a few times over.PROS:- fits the drain easily and easy to take out- squishy, so no pain if you step on it- saved me a good amount of $ in long run- takes less time to clean than it would take to unclog drainCONS:- it's harder and ickier to clean if it hasn't had time to fully dry.- shampoo gunk gets in the little holes. you have to clean out those holes for water to run through. it's gross.Overall:I'm glad I bought it, and I'm purchasing a replacement for an old one that was just too gross after it sitting while I was away for two months. Going forward I'll be cleaning the new one in vinegar somewhat regularly instead of just wiping it off.
title: Life-Saver for People with Lots of Hair

author: Vanessa Millett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020
review_content: I LOVE this product. It almost seems to simple in its design to think it would be of any good doing what it claims to do. But it IS good and it DOES work!! Due to strange plumbing in an old house, we are only able to insert the tubshroom halfway into our bathtub drain. Even being able to only using 50% of this product, I would recommend this to anyone. Long hair, short hair, dog hair, tiny chunks of soap, those plastic razor covers... anything that might get lost in your shower that you dont want down your drain, this will catch it. Its quiet easy to clean even if it is disgusting. Because it will be disgusting. But do you really want that disgustingness sitting in your drain getting, well, more disgusting?? Probably not. Buy the damn tubshroom.
title: Buy it because whats going down your drain is disgusting.

author: Katie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2017
review_content: This product is not for the faint of heart! Should be avoided by pregnant women, the elderly, and people with heart conditions.I'm just kidding, everyone should have one of these. It works, and that being said, the stuff it catches is GROSS. I was not mentally prepared for the gunk I have to clean off this thing weekly. I didn't realize when I ordered that my shower drain has a metal catch a couple of inches down, so the TubShroom sticks up a little past the shower floor, but it still works great.
title: DISGUSTING. BE WARNED

author: Plantgrrl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2017
review_content: Tubshroom did indeed revolutionize my bathtub experience. I have a shedding problem, enough that once a month my husband and I would wind up showering with a slow drain standing in soapy water and grumbling. Then I got one of those toothed tub decloggers. Sweet! But also, super gross. Enter tubshroom. I bought it on a whim, thinking, well...if it doesn't work at least it was cheap. As seen on TV, amiright? But it's awesome. About once a week or every other week things start to drain slow, I pull the shroom out, and with a little toilet paper I grab it and pull the hair off without a whole lot of pressure. No worries about getting the hair out of it. It literally takes less than 5 minutes and it's not super gross. Would recommend to anyone with hair. :)
title: As seen on...my tub!

author: Gene Lang
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
review_content: The TubShroom saved my life! I’ve been happily married to my wife for 8 years now, and since I’ve known her she has posed as a smokin’ hot babe. I believed the lie, all the while thinking we had poor plumbing that resulted in shower clogs. After just 3 days with the TubShroom, her true identity was revealed. I pulled that thing out, and there was enough hair to knit a sweater. When confronted, she began to growl. Sasquatch is not hiding in the woods in Canada. She’s been hiding in plain sight, wreaking havoc on my drain. What’s worse? My six year old daughter seems to have some of her Sasquatch genes as well. Thank you, TubShroom, for bringing out the truth!
title: Helped me locate Sasquatch

author: Mike O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2018
review_content: Prior to this product we used a hair strainer that simply sat on top of the bathtub drain in the kids bathroom.  When my daughters would take showers their long hair would find its way under the strainer and into the drain, resulting in clogged drains.  One of my daughters clued my into this product and it looked like it was worth a try.  It fits snuggly into the drain hole and catches all the hair without letting it get into the drain pipe. It is much easier to clean than the strainer we were using.  I expect this will save me a lot of work clearing out clogged drains.
title: Keeps the hair out of the drain

author: LK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019
review_content: This ended up with some permenant stains, I soaked it overnight in bleach and it got better but still some stains remain.  It does catch hair, it works, but unless you clean it after every shower (why would I get this then), it gets grimey fast and clogs the drain.  With a traditional mesh insert the hair sits on top of the mesh and you pull it off, with this the hair actually sits slightly in the drain and it gets gross.  To clean it you’re actually pulling something up through the drain albiet not far down it.  It does go a little longer before clogging than a mesh insert but the silicone seems to grip grime as much as hair.
title: Gets grimey fast and doesn’t improve on the regular mesh insert

author: Susan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2017
review_content: These are the best!  My daughter and I have very long hair. This catches the hair before it could clog the drain.  I also works for my husband's short hair and my dogs hair/fur.  I love this so much I bought one for my bathroom sink, also bought my daughter one for her tub and my son bought one for his girlfriend.  This is a fantastic product.  TubShroom The Revolutionary Tub Drain Protector Hair Catcher/Strainer/Snare, Blue
title: Best hair catcher out there!

author: Jackie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
review_content: I heard about this product on tv and I was skeptical about this thing actually working. I read the reviews and still wasn’t convinced. So I bought it and when I opened the packaging I thought this flimsy little thing won’t work. I plugged it into the tub drain and washed my hair. I look down and don’t see anything special happening. Once I finished taking a shower I pull it out and whoa! All the hair was wrapped around Shroom! It works really good. Keep in mind that the soap and shampoo will also get trapped with the hair a little. But this doesn’t bother me because it actually helps me remove the hair easy and wash the Shroom. I highly recommend this product for any woman having hair loss issues.
title: Highly Recommend!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2018
review_content: Never use Draino again! This thing works!! I have really long hair and so does my boyfriend. Our hair would clog up our tub drain so often and it would usually require going down with that spikey snake tool and Draino to clear the clog. This this is fantastic - it catches all of our hair and when the water starts to back up, you know it's time to pop it out and pull the collected hair off. It's gross to see, but I'd rather see and it just remove it than have a major drain clog and have to use Draino (such a bad toxic chemical to pour down the drain). I highly recommend this, especially if you and your family have a lot of hair going down your drain!
title: Never use Draino again!

author: Peachtreepatty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2018
review_content: The TubShroom really works!  It seems to catch every strand of hair.  It's slightly unpleasant clearing the hair from the TubShroom, but it beats the heck out of clogged drains! I liked it so much I bought one for my son and his family.  If they like it as much as I do I'll buy another one for them. I have one in both of my bathrooms.
title: Nifty product that really works.

author: Sarah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2017
review_content: I love our little tub shroom. It really does catch a lot of hair. I haven't had any issues with a slow draining shower since I started using it. Don't forget to take it out of the drain BEFORE filling a bath. Even if you've cleaned it small hairs manage to find their way into the bath water.Save yourself a headache with your drain and get this! It catches my long hair and my boyfriends shorter hair, lots of it. I really appreciate not having to deal with a clogged shower drain frequently anymore.
title: It really works!

author: Jennifer Paulk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2019
review_content: I am a woman who SHEDS hair while taking a shower (and just throughout the day). Spend the money on this so you don't have to spend any more money on liquid drain cleaners/uncloggers. I actually have two of them. When one gets too full, I switch it out and put the other one in. Once I'm done cleaning the dirty one (paper towels and spray cleaners or put in bleach) I place that one in a draw until I'm ready to switch them out again. If you do not have one of these already, get one!
title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!

author: J. A. Joseph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2016
review_content: Saw this in recommended ads online and it seemed ridiculous but then this was in the Amazon Lightning Deals and I figured it was worth a try. I give my dog baths in the tub and she usually fills up the hair catcher every time. They get gross, I throw them out, and buy new ones. Seems super wasteful, so I was excited to give this a try. This actually works really well! If I don't clean it after bathing her, it does clog a little bit, but it's easy to clean and stick back in the tub. I will never use a different drain protector again.
title: Saw this in recommended ads online and it seemed ridiculous but then this ...

author: Boris L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2016
review_content: First of all I have to admit very smart design of hair catcher that separates water flow to catch hair and main drain water flow to pass it by . Most of others I know catch hair not so effectively and slow down drainage at the same time because caught hair  clogs holes. As a result I had to remove hair from my previous catcher while taking shower to avoid pool of water.After 2 mo of use I still see perfect drainage and no pools of water at the drain hole if we clean Tubshroom at least once a day or depending on frequency of use.  It is not a  big deal : I just take a piece of paper towel to remove hair and after that clean its holes of soap accumulation under hot water's flow from faucet. Tubshroom is very soft - just bend it under water flow and you are done in several seconds.Not completely sure it catches "every single hair" as manufacturer claims but very close to that. I 'd name it "Tubguard" just because it keeps my tub in working and perfect condition with very basic maintenance.
title: Tub Guard

author: amaze
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020
review_content: Looked like a well designed product. Was a perfect fit for my drain. Got the right color and the right price. But what I did not anticipate was how well it would slow down the water flow. It probably caught every debris including the water. Every time you take a shower there is a pool created that would drain very slowly. I finally removed it and put a regular shower drain.
title: Why do people like this?

author: Tati Davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2018
review_content: This is the best of its kind on the market so far, I’ve tested everything before because I have a huge hair loss every shower, this catches ALL the hairs, including my husband’s thin body hairs! I check daily for hairs and there is always a lot. After few weeks of installation my drain started to run faster! It’s saving me a lot of money on chemicals and services on my plumbing system! My bathtub is old and it’s a system that I can’t use the snakes or introduce anything there to pull hairs out cause it hits some kind of “metal cap” and the tubshroom is the only thing that is really working. I’ve bought 2 more for gifts and my mother in law is loving it too! BUY THIS!
title: It fits like a charm

author: Brett S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2018
review_content: I tried out the TubShroom as a replacement to the mesh strainer type I had been using.  The original mesh strainer got full of 'stuff' quickly and had to be cleaned out at least twice a week.  The TubShroom, on the other hand, had almost nothing after a week of use.  I have to be careful as I live in an older apartment, and the bathtub drain gets clogged easily.  I switched back to my strainer type filter because too much hair was going down the drain.It fit right, snugly against the sides and bottom, so it is a design/material issue.Oh well, you win some you loose some.
title: Some of the hair, some of the time...

author: Silver330xi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: This is seriously the very best thing ever invented!!!! I have such an issue with hair clogging my tub drain and I have tried EVERYTHING... I didn't really want to pay $12.99 for this, but after reading the reviews of others who stated that it worked great for them, I decided I would give it a shot! I am SO glad that I did!!! My tub doesn't get plugged up anymore, and it is SO easy to remove the hair from it as well! I am beyond pleased with this! It has saved my marriage! LOL my husband no longer has to unclog the drain because of my hair... Happy wife, happy husband... Thanks TubShroom!
title: This saved my marriage!

author: R. Maeda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020
review_content: Took a chance when I bought this. Normally, I don't have much faith in "miracle" products advertised on TV.  I had one of those stainless steel wire mesh covers for my son's bathtub. Although it kept a lot of hair out of the drain, somehow hair still got clogged in the drain.  Once i put in the TubShroom I noticed that the drain no longer seems to get clogged. And the amount of hair the TubShroom picks up is amazing!  Not sure how it does it, but take it from me it really works!
title: It really works!

author: Scott in MO
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2016
review_content: OK, I was not sure what I would think of this product.  My wife has long thick hair and every so often the drain would get stopped up or drain slowly.  I would have to remove the drain plug, and then pull out a wad of nasty, stinky, gunk that was a combination of hair and soap, and some unidentifiable combination.  We tried drain filters, but none of them worked really well.We got the tubshroom.  I pulled the drain stopper, and put the shroom in place.  Every few days, my wife or I easily pull the shroom out of the drain, and can easily wipe the hair off of it.  Our drain pipes stay clear, and overall we could not be more happy.This thing is great!
title: Amazing

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: I ordered these for the tub and bathroom sinks as well as the stoppers. They install with no effort as you just push them into the drain. Fit is no issue and the catch all hair and other debris so nothing goes down the drain that can clog. They lift out with no effort and will not scratch any finish on the fixtures.I would suggest order the stoppers, they work great. I was a little concerned because of the shape of the sink bowls, but they were flexible enough to easily sit in the bottom of the sinks and tub to stop water flow. I would recommend both products as they work very well.
title: It does what it claims to do

author: SirAlexFerguson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
review_content: I have a teenage daughter who has her own bathroom. She has thick, long hair that she must love to shed while showering. Whenever I went to clean her shower, the tub was dirty - as in I would never shower in that thing - because her hair clogged the drain and the water drained very slowly (gross). I still don't understand how she could could be okay with that. Teenage girls....No more though!! This little contraption has kept her shower clog-free and because of that, normal people would now take a shower in her bathroom if they had to. Seriously, thank goodness for this thing!
title: Thank Goodness!

author: Natalya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2018
review_content: It was ok, prevented all the hair from going down the drain.  However, once shampoo/conditioner/soap also gets onto the hair that’s already on the shroom, even if there’s still not much hair, the water can not flow down easily anymore and it starts to kinda flood the tub and I’m standing on water with suds so then I have to clean the shroom halfway through my shower so I can properly rinse and clean the suds off of my feet.  But that’s better than my previous one which was shaped like a hat and designed to go on top of the tub drain because the “hat” wasn’t high enough so it just basically sat on tip of the drain and still let all the hair go down the drain from the gap between it and the tub floor...it wouldnt stay stuck to the floor to keep hair from flowing down the drain.  At least this shroom catches the hair even if I had to take out the original tub drainstop or whatever you call it and place this one in instead.
title: Not that great but at least it catches the hair

author: Elaine Andrew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
review_content: I was very amazed to see how much hair this contraption caught after the first night of use. My daughter has very long hair, so after her shower I popped this TubShroom out to see how effective it was at catching hair...turns out...VERY! It looks like I won't have to worry about my tub drain stopping up again with hair balls any more! I don't think it will work for stopping the water from draining during a bath, as it sticks out about half an inch when it's installed, and can't be pushed down to plug the opening like a regular tub stopper. I saved my old tubstopper to pop back in for when we want to take baths. I say having the clog-free drains is very well worth this purchase!
title: Wow!

author: Kaylee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2016
review_content: This hair catcher for your drain will actually work!! My hair falls out in GOBS every time I shower and I use to have to clean out my drain at least once a week because of all the hair. I have tried lots of other products that "catch" hair in the shower but they have either not worked or made it so the water won't drain while showering.....and I'm not a fan of standing in a bathtub full of water while showering. I was skeptical at first that this would work but since getting it I have not cleaned out my drain once! It catches all my hair, allows for the water to drain and is SUPER easy to clean the hair off of because its soft silicone. My bathtub drain is a stopper type and it was easy to pull out and drop the TubShroom in. If you are constantly cleaning out your hair I promise this is for you! I love it!
title: It actually works!

author: KimH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2017
review_content: I absolutely, positively LOVE my TubShroom!!  It catches everything!  I wasn't sure if it would work on catching my hair now that it's very short, but that wasn't a problem.  I washed my newly cut, kinky/curly/wavy hair as soon as it came in the mail.  This little gem even slurps up hair from shaving (for those of us that may have a slight winter coat to get of lol) and the best part is that now while washing my hair in the shower, I'm not also taking a bath!!  The water keeps flowing down the drain while catching the hair in the TubShroom.  Oh, and it's very easy to clean!!I'm very happy with my purchase and I will be buying more :)
title: positively LOVE my TubShroom

author: Megan K.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2017
review_content: I hardly ever write reviews but this thing is so amazing I had to share. With every shower I take, I shed a TON of hair and (as you can see from the picture) stick it to the wall so that no hair goes down my drain. I thought this method was working out well but my drain was continuing to stop up. I figured it must be my sister's fault since I was so good about not letting any hairs go down the drain, but I went ahead ordered the Tub Shroom after seeing advertisements on Facebook. I got this thing and after only 2 showers, it collected a crap ton of my hair that I didn't catch. It really is so easy to install and wipe away the hair, exactly like the videos. Awesome invention and I'm super happy with this purchase!Note to manufacturer: it would be awesome if you could make a metal version (I think it would look classier that way).
title: Works disgustingly well...

author: A
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2017
review_content: Needed an apartment based on location with a strange shower/tub drain. Nothing but a hole vs stopper option. This stuck up part way... old building. Anyway, it actually is pretty great... if you wash it once a week to two or three, depending on use. Soap particles, etc, do get stuck on it along with hair, so it's not just that you can take the hair off. You have to really rinse/wash it until all the residue is off. The good news is it does come off... but it's just not explained that way or advertised. This is even after being gone from a weekend to a few weeks, so yes, it fully dried.
title: Great solution if you take it out and wash it clean

author: A.W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2018
review_content: Cleaning hair out of the drain is such a gross thing! It makes my stomach hurt just thinking about it. The TubShroom has helped keep it from getting soapy and gross and clogged down the line so you're not pulling out a snake of hair. [Puke]. I just grab some toilet paper and pull it off the TubShroom (wet or dry when I remember I need to clean it) and throw it right in the trash, barely looking at it. I have long hair so it always seems like so much more, but I clean off my TubShroom probably every 2-4 showers. I can't imagine all that hair going down the drain and then having to pull it as one big hairball months later. [Puke again]. I'm really thankful for this product! It doesn't allow you take baths with it in, as it doesn't stop up the tub unless clogged, so you have to keep your drain stop nearby (but I don't take baths anyway, so this doesn't affect me).
title: I have long hair so it always seems like so much more

author: Kat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2017
review_content: Ok, we know that hair clogs is not something we talk about, or actually think about, until your tub/shower is not draining right. I certainly did not like my alternative of scoping out the drain with an old crochet hook. While the mystery remains where/how did all this hair get into my drain-I am still not bald....Now, once a week I pull out the TubShroom, wipe it clean, replace it, and life is good.Sincerely,Kat
title: I certainly did not like my alternative of scoping out the drain with an ...

author: Kara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
review_content: Not sure how I’ve gone this long without this product! My hair sheds like no other and I’m always having to unclog the shower drain every few months - Although taking a snake to the drain always fixed it, it could definitely Be a hassle.Taking this out is so easy and takes two seconds to clean. I typically will try to take it out and rinse off about once a week now so it doesn’t build up too much because in my opinion, all drain unclogging is gross. This is a much easier/ faster process I totally don’t mind doing more often so you’re not having to deal with a lot later.
title: Bathroom must-have

author: jen mak hart
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2017
review_content: When I first bought this product, I thought it was the wrong size, but upon further inspection, realized that the product needed to be slightly above the height of my tub ring. Before I bought this product, I had to manually take apart my tub drain pipes every 3-4 months. The sludge of hair mixed with bar soap chunks smelled awful!!!! My drain pipes are old and do not drain well, but still I only need to take them apart 1-2 times a year with not as much effort as I had previously! Almost 2 years later and I need to buy another one because my first one got moldy. I'm sure I can bleach it someway, but I'm too lazy, haha.
title: I live in a 1 bathroom house with 3 long-haired females.....

author: FIT85
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2018
review_content: I have long, thick hair and am a master at clogging shower drains.  After hearing how great this product was (buzzfeed...), I decided to try it out. Unfortunately, our tub drain has metal "x" or criss-cross inside that I didn't really want to bother with as it seemed like I may have to remove the entire metal drain piece.Despite this, I can still stick the TubShroom into the drain - and it still catches tons of hair after a bath/shower.  It protrudes out of the drain but still gets the job done, for the most part.
title: Not an ideal fit for my tub drain, but still does its job

author: Mike With Too Many Toys
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020
review_content: I tried a stainless steel screen thing and it worked well but clogged so fast my tenants kept taking it out.  Standing water from slow draining left gunk on the tub walls too.I've only had this a week but the drain drains MUCH faster and it's actually easier to clean than the screen thing. So far it's caught more than the screen since the tenants don't take it out every shower.It's cheap and it works!  What more could you want from a sink trap?
title: Cheap and it works very well!

author: Chloe Cavanaugh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
review_content: This is one of those ingenious inventions that just does exactly what it’s supposed to do, and PERFECTLY. I hope the inventor is making a big tub full of money!I have a serious head full of hair, as my stylist tells me every time he cuts it, and my tub drain used to get completely clogged on a regular basis. But this thing keeps it absolutely clear. I do have to pull a small gob of hair off it after every shower, but it’s very easy to do, and way better than poking something into a stopped-up drain to pull out a huge, disgusting clog, or waiting for the tub to drain so you can pour caustic chemicals into it (and ultimately, the ocean) that don’t always get it all in one go.
title: Don’t Hesitate — This Really Works!

author: leratt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
review_content: I have long curly hair and for years we've struggled with the standard drain hair catchers because they just didn't catch enough and we'd still end up with a clogged drain. After a year of use I feel comfortable saying this is a MUST HAVE. It is so easy to clean, I just pull it out when I'm done showering and clean it off and it's ready to go for the next shower. It really catches everything, we have had ZERO drain clogs since we started using this a year ago. So simple to use, love this product!
title: MUST HAVE!

author: Suzanne A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2019
review_content: After years of having problems with the tub drain and having to clean out the clogged hair we thought we would give this a try.  It definitely works, but I would suggest cleaning it after every use. Simple to do, the hair comes right off.  I noticed the newer ones are designed to be better for draining in a shower though and that will be my next purchase.  The problem I have with this one is it must be elevated from the drain at least 1/2" for a shower to drain properly and can't be inserted all of the way into the drain.  It definitely works as advertised for catching hair, but having it stick up is not ideal.
title: It definitely stops the hair from clogging the drain.

author: Alan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2017
review_content: As a guy I have long hair, a little past my shoulders. My hair is also super thick. So one of two things would happen to the other hair strainers I used.Sometimes it would not just strain all the hair. I found this out MONTHS later when I needed to get a snake. IT SUCKED! I had to rent a snake.The more "aggressive" metal strainers would have to clear out mid-wash or boom I'm standing in dirty water ankle deep. I really enjoyed poking myself after doing this for a few weeks because it was made of metal!I have been using The TubShroom for a little over three weeks now.The TubShroom has somehow fixed all my problems! With the design it is impossible for any hair to be missed. It has a snug fit for my drain. If you are like me, some days you just want to pamper your hair and condition it root to tip. The TubShroom somehow doesn't clog even with the bigger clumps of conditioner?! I am so thankful for this! I can actually wait for the hair to dry which to me seems more sanitary. As for the cleaning because it is rubber I can clean it with just one finger. It makes a neat ring for my hair length and boom into the garage.I have no idea how durable the The TubShroom is, but if I ever need a new hair strainer I know I'm going to buy this one. Maybe in blue...
title: The best hair strainer I have ever used. From function to clean up it is the best thing to buy for it's purpose.

author: rockalittle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2017
review_content: This thing is excellent. What a great idea. Check out youtube to see this in action. It really works. The only problem is it clogs up quickly, so you have to clean it after every use or you will get slow draining water. It's not a problem to clean though because the hair comes right out. I'll definitely be keeping this.The reviews whining about, having to actually clean the thing more than once a week are just sad. The tub shroom really does work and if you have a lot of hair or product in that hair it will obviously slow down with excessive buildup. If they ever make a tub shroom that cleans itself, I promise you it's going to cost way more than $12. And the whiners will still find something to complain about.
title: This thing is awesome.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020
review_content: Bought this cause of a review from a Youtuber. Bought mostly for the purpose of hair removal from my lady parts & will admit I was nervous because that's short hair & didn't think it would capture it. But to my surprise it captures it all. Love this thing! I do clean it after my use each time after I'm dressed & out the shower so no problem cleaning as it's still wet.
title: Great buy!

author: Erasmus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2016
review_content: Living in a household where both my girlfriend and I have long hair (plus I have facial hair), hair in the drain has always been an issue. We e tried a few different products that worked to an extent, but never great.We got our Tubshroom about 2 weeks ago, and it has worked amazingly. It's effectiveness is in its simplicity. It is one piece of durable rubber that is flexible enough to snugly fit in any drain. Because of the way it fits in the drain, there is literally no way for hair to get past it.There is no instilation. Open the package and place it in the drain. The material and design keep it in place. When a bit of hair build up in it, pull it out of the drain, quickly take the Har off, and place it back in the drain.I rarely write product reviews, but this product is such a simple but perfect designed solution to the hair clogging the drain problem, I can't believe that this product wasn't made decades ago.I gave it 5 stars. Barring any long term durability issues (I don't forsee any), I don't see any reason why I would give it any less.
title: Simple, ingenious product at a great price

author: Lizalu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2017
review_content: Awesome! Works amazingly, just as advertised. Every hair is caught in this silicone drain insert. I lose quite a few hairs consistently with each shower, and the TubShroom works flawlessly. I would recommend it to anyone that sheds in the shower, or someone without a traditional drain cover.
title: Two Thumbs Up

author: 🤗Ovrjoyd🤗
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
review_content: After trying every known bathroom tub and sink drain invented I am thrilled to find one that works without hampering water drainage! I have literally tried them all and to my amazement IT WORKS! GENIUS! The hair is trapped and easily removed when you pull it out while allowing water to flow freely while it catches all the hair. I have very long hair and cleaning out the yuck from my bathtub drain was becoming the bane of my existence. My tub has smallish holes that secure a drain stopper (original equipment) and I have yet to find a suitable implement small enough or study enough to properly clear the drain pipe that doesn't require chemicals. I was delighted to find something that prevents any further clogging. I highly recommend!
title: THE BEST tub drain filter I have ever used!

author: David Schweitzer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
review_content: My tub drain has a metal ring with two extensions, one opposite the other.  The drain itself is also about an inch narrower in diameter than the shaft (the longest, thinnest part) of this plug.  Either one by themselves would be fine--the plug is meant to squeeze into holes and the two extensions can be overcome by making slits into the plug.  But together?Doesn't fit, so it doesn't work.  This is clearly meant for specific types of drains.  I might try again when I move.
title: Universal, not likely

author: Mike H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2016
review_content: My wife and I both have long hair, every few days one of us was having to get into the tub on our hands and knees with an assortment of tools and clean out the drain. We have tried just about every option out there for preventing hair from clogging the drain in the bathtub, this is the ONLY one that works as advertised.  The drawback to every other option out there is that they sit on top of the drain, hair either gets under it and stps up the drain anyway or it gets caught in the guard, blocking the flow of water and it backs up anyway.The tub shroom sits inside the drain, catching all of the hair and still allowing water flow to prevent water from backing up.
title: My wife and I both have long hair, every ...

author: Aaliyah White
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2019
review_content: I am so glad I purchased this. The drain in my tub was constantly being blocked and I never noticed how much hair is shed until I had to stick one of those tools down the drain to free it. Got one of these, it fits right into the drain and I have not had to use drain cleaner in almost 2 months. The hair gets stuck to this little things and I clean it once or twice a week. I LOVE IT so much ! I would submit a video or pix but it is gross lol but yeah it’s a great invention
title: Get you ONE

author: Nicole Hurchick
