date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
review_content: I wish I had this earlier in life! Cleaning the shower drain absolutely disgusts me. Having long hair, the drain would always clog up and I’d have to do the terrible task of fishing out all that gross hair. After seeing this, I thought “What the heck. It’s worth a try.” One of the best purchases I’ve ever made! This thing catches EVERY strand of hair! And because of the design, it will capture the hair without blocking the water flowing down the drain. I empty it about once a week and then just let in air dry in the tub to try to prevent any moodiness. So far so good!!
title: Wish I bought this sooner!

author: moskigirl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: I’m not a big fan of how the Tub Shroom looks, so I tried a couple of other products when my last Shroom had finally had it.  My daughter has long curly hair, and uses a very heavy conditioner regularly.The other products were trash, so it was right back to the Shroom for us!!  Works exactly as it should, and is easy to clean, even with just a kleenex.  Do yourself a favor, buy this and save yourself the hassle (and money) of trying other products.
title: The best

author: Basam S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2019
review_content: Brilliant idea, perfect design, unmatched durability, and ultimate functionality.I'm honestly very happy with this purchase because it solved the disgusting bathtub hair clogging for me. The water flows through this thing incredibly smoothly and collects all the hair. The holes in it are big and numerous enough to let all the water flow without backing up but at the same time, with the great distribution of the holes horizontally and vertically, they will not let any hair slip through it.
title: Perfect solution for tub clogging

author: barnabusdonn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
review_content: I never realized how much hair was going down my tub drains! 6 people in my household. I clean out the hair every two days. This simple amazingly designed product traps all the hair and soap scum and it really works very well. I'm very pleased with this, thank you for such an amazing product that is well designed and works as advertised. We bought two of these. Over the almost 20 years of being in this house, we had to bring the plumbers out often to unclog the tub drains. Been using your product going on 2 months and it truly solved our tub clogging problems and I know will save us plumbing costs over the long run. Thanks again!
title: This traps the hair! It works

author: Christine S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2019
review_content: Love this little thing! I have long hair and I'm continously astonished at the amount of slimy hair in it after I shower.  I would always try to gather as much as I could but surely much was still going down the drain,  slowing down our pipes. I honestly thought there was no way this could work but it really does and fabulously! My family appreciates the hair clumps being gone from the side of the shower as well for when I'd forget to take itout with me lol
title: My favorite Amazon find EVER

author: emewilli
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2017
review_content: Dang it I love these things. It's like a whole new world for my drains. I no longer remember how I suffered through decades with dumb old strainer drains where I not only had to look at my filth but then actually touch it when I cleaned the strainer. These little guys work better, keep the hair or whatever mostly out of sight, and are so friggin easy to clean. It's one of those random little doohickies that I've been forcing everyone I know to buy.
title: So much better!

author: Panit Buranapramest
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2019
review_content: These things work! My boyfriend's long luxurious blonde Viking-stylie hair and my long over-processed mutli-colored hair often clog up our bathtub and we typically had to call in a plumber to clear out the blockage every 3-6 months. But since I bought these, every strand of hair clings to it instead going down the drain, costing us dollars to go down the drain with expensive repairs. We got the clear version and hardly notice it being there. I usually have to clean it every 2-3 days because we both lose so much, but other than pulling hairs off and rinsing the item quickly in hot water, this thing is minimal maintenance and maximum functionality!
title: Where have you been all my life, TubShroom?

author: Rachael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: This might be the best thing I have ever bought in my life. This is my second time buying. I got one for myself and loved it so much that I got one for my grandparents so they don’t have to deal with cleaning their drains all the time!! So happy I can help take one thing off their list.It’s to easy to install and works flawlessly. Pretty intuitive for guests too, as my grandparents host guests pretty often in their house.Highly, highly recommend.
title: Incredible product!! Totally worth it!

author: Catrina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
review_content: I've purchased one for my mom, one for my sister, and two for myself. The shroom has been great at capturing my long curly hair and we haven't had a shower clog in the shower since this past August (2019) and before then it took about a year for the shower to get a little clogged up. I wash my hair once or twice a week so it's pretty often throughout the year. I threw away my first one only because it does get black mold on it after some time. Since the 1st one, I make sure to take the shroom out after every wash to avoid the mold happening too quickly. Overall, this product has been great and I hope by switching up my methods the 2nd one lasts longer.
title: 4th one purchased

author: jenny8675309
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2018
review_content: I purchased this to replace the metal mesh drain protector in my tub. I was hoping that it would not need cleaning after every shower, as **someone** forgets to clean it. I was tired of almost falling every time I showered due to the residue from the moisturizing body soap. The TubShroom has helped, but still seems to need to be cleaned after each shower, or the water does start to back up. I have almost waist-length hair, and I usually have to clean it in the middle of my shower as well. I am happy with the product, but it was not a cure-all. It is much easier to clean than the metal protector. I have no trouble cleaning it when wet, as others have complained.
title: Needs frequent (but easy) cleaning

author: Taylor Kaits
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2019
review_content: I like the idea behind the TubShroom, and it ultimately does what I need it to, but I have a slight issue. When the TubShroom is in place, I notice that water drains REALLY slow whether showering or bathing. I've realized that having the product slightly raised while in the drain helps water drain faster, but this only really helps when showering. When draining a tub full of water on the other hand, the TubShroom doesn't usually stay raised (I'm assuming because of pressure from the large amount of water). Again, this product does what I want it to do by keeping hair out of my drains, but I'm a little disappointed by the aforementioned problem I've been having.
title: Mixed Review

author: SpliceSpice
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2018
review_content: I hardly ever do anything more than give a starred review for a product because I hate writing.  But I've had the Tub Shroom for over a year and I have to say it is the best money I have ever spent, hands down!  I even bought one for my parents and I got the sink version when it came out.  This thing has saved so much time in cleaning out nasty, hairy drains and works better than the handful of drain protectors I have tried.  You do have to clear it after every use to avoid mildew, but that's with anything in your bathroom.  And yes, you need to have a standard size tub drain with some kind of recessed "wheel spokes" to keep it in place or it will not fit properly.  If you have tried other drain protectors only to find yourself standing in a small pond by the end of your shower because your hair is everywhere, BUY THIS PRODUCT!  It really works.
title: Best money I ever spent!

author: AndiB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019
review_content: I absolutely love this product. As someone with long hair that sheds like crazy, my shower drain would be a nightmare to clean. I use to use the long plastic thing with spikes on it which was always a hassle and honestly disgusting to touch, but this tubshroom has made such a big difference for me. The tubshroom catches hair perfectly and makes it easy to grab the hair since it wraps around the tubshroom. I know it is time to clean the tubshroom when the water starts to back up in my tub, and in just a few seconds it's good to go. The tubshroom is super easy to clean as well. I will keep buying these!
title: Awesome.

author: Kim Perry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2016
review_content: The TubShroom works beautifully.  Just remove the the drain cover in your tub, pop in the TubShroom and you're ready to use it.  It's that simple.  I've bought two of these so far - one for me and one for a friend.  It truly does capture all the hair with every shower.When you're done showering, simply lift up the silicone TubShroom and you'll see all your hair is wrapped around the cylinder.  All you need to do it grab a tissue and pull off the tightly wound hair and debris to dispose of it.I give my dog a bath in the tub all the time and you wouldn't believe the hair that the TubShroom captures and he's just a Beagle. Imagine what's going down your drain if you have a longer-haired dog!
title: One of the Best Things I've Ever Owned!

author: Sharon Mickey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020
review_content: I loved the concept of the Tubshroom.  It does catch hair in the bathtub drain.  However within a few weeks of using the product mold developed on it and won't come off.  I've used in less than four months and there are mold spots all over it.  I've tried many different methods to clean it but nothing has worked.If you want a mold covered product in your tub drain then this is the product for you.  I'm going back to my old strainer in the drain, I've had it for years without any mold developing.
title: Watch out for mold

author: Carson Chapman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2018
review_content: The product works great! It fits perfectly in my tub and is easy to remove when I am going to take a bath or clean it. It catches all the hair. I have a medium length hair dog and it catches all of her hair when I wash her in the tub too, I was amazed at how much came off of her. I like that it is silicon because it is easy to wash off if soap builds up. The only down side is I have to clean the hair off once a week. Not much builds up but the soap scum clogs it in combo with the hair. But beats getting a clogged drain any day!
title: Just buy it!

author: Noura Randle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
review_content: I am so happy to not have to deal with snaking my tub drain or having to use draino again. I don't know why amazon is asking me to rate its suction power as there is no suction. It is easy to remove and I've been impressed but how much it collects. I have long hair and I end up needing to clean it off ever 2-3 weeks, making me appreciate more how much I must be saving my drains. Cleaning the tubshroom isreally easy, practically wipe the accumulated hair off.
title: Easy to clean and saves the need to snake the tub drain

author: Suzie W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2017
review_content: The tub drain stopper in a home we recently purchased was missing, so I purchased one of these, popped it in, and problem solved. You may have to adjust it a bit but it fits great and is so easy to use and clean. It can either be used to plug up the tub drain completely or positioned to just let the water drain out but catch anything that may go down the drain when you're in the shower. This is my second purchase, I used one in a bathroom sink where the stopper for that was acting up also. They look good, I purchased the gray and it lined up exactly with the chrome ring around the drain hole.
title: Plug It Up!

author: Michelle L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2019
review_content: SO glad I got this. Even though I do my best to keep my hair from going down the drain in the shower, my boyfriend would still occasionally have to get hair out of the pipes if it started draining more slowly.The first time I showered with this in place, I did as usual to try to keep my hair from going in the drain but after my shower I pulled this out and there was still a fair amount of hair on it. I pulled the hair off easily and put it back in place.Now this one little simple added routine has kept countless strands of hair from slowly building up and hindering drainage.  Wonderful invention  :)
title: This is totally worth it!

author: H. Bohaning
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2017
review_content: Any household with teenage girls NEED this product. We have 3 females here. All have long hair plus one with very thick tresses. Cleaning out the tub drain was one of the most disgusting jobs I have ever had to do. It was even worse that dismantling and cleaning out my kitchen sink pipes. I purchased this and hoped for the best. Well, I got my wish. No more disgusting hair being pulled out of the tub drain. I, and my youngest, prefer tub baths and this is easily removed. We just reinstall it after removing the tub stopper so it can catch anything as the tub drains. Everyone else takes showers so they don't need to do anything with it.To the person who stated their drain was slow enough to cause standing water in their tub and then draining fully off and on while showering. I suggest you check to make sure your drainage vents are not being obstructed by debris. It sounds like that is the main problem rather than this product. This WILL cause pipes to drain slightly slower than if there was nothing there but not to the point one would notice it.
title: Excellent Product!!

author: Tommy Ferreira
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2017
review_content: I really didn't like the idea of spending $13.00 but I was so sick of the other flower looking thing that I was using. The flower strainer thing that I use to use would grow this moldy black stuff on it that would never come off no matter what I washed it with (which is why the flower thing probably came in a two pack). But this Shroom thing is way better! Like a mushroom, it needs to be propped up a bit for enough water to drain otherwise it would pool up. I just cleaned the drain last week after about 6 months and there was very little hair (probably for the occasional time of not using it). It does get a bit gross from time to time but unlike the flower strainer thing I use to use this Shroom cleans up in seconds. A little warm water and a tooth brush and it looks brand new. The hair come off easier than other strainers too. I would buy another if I needed it.
title: Works great, cleans up very well. I would buy another.

author: Amazonluva
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2020
review_content: Perfect for keeping my tub clog free. I still love this but it does require MORE interaction with the gross hair and stuff that clogs your drain. Bec the plug gets clogged very easily and the tub will begin to back up. So I'm emptying it once a week were I could go a month+ bef having to deal with the clogging without it. It does make it easier to remove the gunk though so I'm still in favor of the product, instead of digging in my drain I just remove this and clean it with ease
title: Works but you have declog frequently

author: shb23
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2016
review_content: Great product, does exactly what it advertises.Make sure your drain is appropriate size, if it is then it pops right into place.It does slightly restrict the drainage rate, but that is only logical, by doing that, it does collect long hair. After a 10 minute shower I usually have around a 1/2" of water in the tub, but with the Tubshroom removed no water accumulates no matter how long the shower runs. It's a minor and foreseeable price to pay to keep your drains clear.Cleanup is easy, if a bit gross. At least it's clearly freshly washed hair!
title: Great product, does exactly what it advertises

author: David R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2019
review_content: This prevents a LOT of hair and soap scum from getting into your drain. It sits easily in the drain, and allows water to pass through without letting things that clog your pipes get through.Its a little gross to clean, so if touching wet hair skeeves you out just put on some rubber gloves and simply smear it into a trash can. You do need to clean it every 2 - 3 days or else it will just back up your tub when you run the water, but it beats pouring draino every couple of weeks and will save you a lot of money comparatively.
title: Buy one!

author: Carrie S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
review_content: Man, I so wish I'd invested in one of these years ago!  It makes such a difference.  I try and be good and catch hair.  But this proves how much is missed.  And if you clean it with a tissue every couple of days, the "absolutely disgusting" mess that causes major blocked drains is a mere "gross" instead. For those of you with long hair, do yourself (and your partner?!) a favor and buy one of these yesterday.I recall the packaging or item description gives details on what kind of drain it will work best for.  And after seeing how it fits into mine, I can better understand that to be true.  Good idea to make it available in bright color to draw attention to it as a reminder to clean it regularly; but I bought the grey to blend it better.  I have the luxury of living alone so it's all my mess anyway!
title: ORDER IT NOW!

author: VA Resident
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2019
review_content: This is a cheap, effective way to keep hair from clogging your tub drain. It's not pretty, but it works. It does sit a bit higher than a normal drain so we do bump them a lot but we don't knock it out of the drain. I have long, thick hair, so I clean it every couple of days, but it's easy and fast to clean the hair clump off.  I clean the tub shroom and sink shrooms we have every couple of weeks is a solution of 1/3 part bleach and 2/3 part water to dissolve the soap scum and other yucky stuff that builds up on them.
title: Cheap yet effective

author: Richard Chen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2017
review_content: How could I live without this for years! My wife's long hair means tons goes down the drain with tons of drain cleaner to follow. It's a simple silicon insert to replace the existing tub drain cover, nothing hard, and works like a total charm. The intelligence of the design in this product is truly breathtaking as simplicity is complex. I salute the founders and makers. It handles anything that goes down, hair, etc., and its trustworthiness means I now neither use drain cleaner nor clean the drain, woohoo.
title: No more drain cleaner

author: AppleGeek
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2018
review_content: Just purchased our second TubShroom for the master bathroom. We bought the first one earlier this year when our teenage son told us he was standing in 1-2 inches of water in his tub/shower. We unscrewed the push-down stopper and set this in place. It really works! The photo shows what it caught with just 1 shower!  Recently, we’ve noticed the master bathroom shower has been slow to drain. It’s a stand-up shower and the drain is in the center. It had a drain cover we had to pry off, which ruined the cover. We used a hair removal device and got quite a bit of gunk out of there. Now the water drains rapidly again. We tried the TubShroom to see if it would work, and it fits perfectly, so we ordered another.
title: Great item!

author: Cecillia J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020
review_content: I have saved SOOOOOO much money on drain cleaner because of this. My husband has THICK curly hair and other hair trappers were failing to catch half of it. So I was spending $10-20 a month on drain cleaner. Now, we're keeping the drain clear of hair. I've bought one bottle this year and that was when my brother in law stayed with us and kept taking it out. Only downside, is that the kitten has decided it is a toy (he loves to play in the tub) and has taken and HIDDEN the thing multiple times on us. *sigh*
title: YES YES YES YES YES

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2018
review_content: I bought the gray. Wish I had purchased the white. Probably going to be buying more as gifts for the women in my family. Finally something that stops the endless amount of hair, human and pup, without creating a small lake in the tub from lack of water flow down the actual drain. My dog has a short coat but sheds an impressive amount at bath time. Having to clean the tub after cleaning him was such a headache. The old hair catcher I had would get clogged up so fast and not let water down leaving me to wait for the couple inches of water to drain before wiping up all the remaining hair from around the bottom of the tub. Not anymore!
title: It actually works like it says.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2018
review_content: I initially bought this for our master shower, not realizing the drain in the shower was custom and not a standard size. Instead, I placed it in our other bathroom (which we frequently use as well), and it works so well! Definitely check your drain size before purchasing. If you have a standard tub/shower combination, you should be fine. The only thing we noticed is that you have to remove it and clean it more frequently (literally just lift it up, SO easy)! But that means it's working well! I'm amazed each time how much hair it has caught. It's easy to pull the hair off as well. And every so often, when it starts to look grimy, I either clean it with a clorox wipe, or I just soak it in a little in hot vinegar water and wipe it off.
title: Works great!!

author: Mark B Rivard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019
review_content: I have had the TubShroom for a few weeks now. It replaced a small mesh metal strainer that I had before and while the TubShroom definitely looks nicer and is easier to clean, it definitely seems to be catching less hair than the mesh strainer. Of course, I haven't done a true side by side comparison but I am cleaning the TubShroom as often as I cleaned the metal strainer and there are fewer hairs caught in the TubShroom. I would still recommend the TubShroom though as it is easier to clean and looks nicer but in terms of catching hair, I don't think anything can match the old fashioned fine mesh strainer. One other positive of the TubShroom is that unlike the mesh strainer type hair catches, the TubShroom is better when it comes to draining due to the design.Pros- Easy to clean- Looks great- Doesn't get clogged as easily as other hair catches like metal strainersCons- Doesn't seem to catch hair as well as a fine mesh metal strainer
title: Definitely catches the hair but it seems like it may not be catching all of it

author: mm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2019
review_content: wow, revolutionary.  this thing is really amazing.  i have long thick hair and have been dealing with collecting hair post-shower for decades.  This makes all that super easy for me.  It's super easy to clean.  It's also a soft rubbery material so if you step on it by accident, it doesn't hurt.  Ours sticks up about an inch or two, but that doesn't affect it at all.
title: where have you been??

author: Lauren Hernandez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
review_content: Wow. I am IMPRESSED. So I just used this for the first time to bathe my collie. Collie = TONS OF PET HAIR.The water drained pretty well, and when the bath was over, this may of hair was left. Gross. I was able to easily scoop up the hair from the tub, and removal from the shroom was SUPER easy, less than a minute. Then I put the shroom back in the drain, and quick sprayed down the tub to collect the rest of the hair in the shroom. I had no trouble removing the hair wet. Total hair removal time? >2min 😱😱😱
title: Where has this been all my life???

author: cynthiae
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2017
review_content: This is the best drain protector I've ever bought. Yes, you have to clean it out basically every other day, but it catches EVERYTHING and yet still allows water to drain quickly with no sitting water in the tub. To clean it out, you just need to get a tissue and pull the hair over the bottom lip (which bends to easily release the hair clump). I usually rinse mine in hot water after that, as sometimes soap or shampoo will clump up in the holes. It is definitely easier to clean out when dry, but it's nowhere near hard if you just want to do it immediately after your shower.
title: Best drain protector I've ever bought!

author: CombatActionDad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2019
review_content: As simple as the headline is, it just works.  Looks great in the tub, not too gaudy.  I am not sure how I have gone so long without this product.  This is truly just one of those products that work and does exactly what it is intended to do.  It was a pet peeve of mine to be taking a shower but have my feet covered in standing water due to a slow drain filled with hair.  This product is a game changer.  I simply pull off the ring of trapped hair every 3-4 showers and never have standing water in my tub while I shower.
title: It just works!

author: Frequent Amazon Shopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2019
review_content: After having to snake my shower drain multiple times to get long hair out of the pipes I got one of these and it is a lifesaver. My dog decided to eat the first one when it was sitting on the edge of the tub. I guess she couldn't resist the soft plastic. The resultant damage to her tummy and difficulty passing the pieces of plastic ultimately cost me about $5000 but I did buy a second tubshroom. I just keep it in a drawer when it's not in  use now.
title: Love the Tubshroom! So does my dog. :(

author: Ashley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
review_content: Gretlat purchase! I have tried many times to find a drain plug that lets the water through, catches hair and doesn't allow the drain to clog. This is it! I have fairly long hair and have struggled with drain issues forever. This plug is easy to use and it definitely gets the job done. I've had the plug over a year and only had to clean out the drain once. Before this plug, I had hair clogs every month or so. One downfall is it builds up mold fairly easily. But I just soak it in bleach for a few hours once a month or so and it cleans right up. Also, it tells you to wait until the hair dries to clean it off. I prefer to clean it off while it's wet as the hair stays together better. But this is really just personal preference.
title: I love this drain plug!

author: Marie Schieren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
review_content: It does the job, but you'd have to clean it daily. The instructions say to clean it once a week. That's a joke! I can't go three showers (and a single person) without my tub backing up because it doesn't drain well, even with minimal hair. I need pliers to get the hair off because it doesn't slide off easy. I've only had it a few weeks and I'm so highly disappointed. I'll be looking for a new method.
title: Not as easy to use as it seems.

author: ArtChar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2017
review_content: I have long hair and I live with a hairy of a beast called my boyfriend. We had an issue with our drain clogging and the apartment complex came and fixed it but said this would continue to happen. I saw this and thought it would be a great try. I clean out the TubShroom every month and we have not had problems with clogs since!
title: Exactily What I Needed

author: Zachary Simmons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2018
review_content: It's okay but not the greatest. My roommate is a female with long hair and I'd be buying de-clog liquids once a month for my drain. That's why I decided to buy this. For the first couple days it seemed to work, I had just de-clogged the drain. For me, this actually made the shower/tub fill up with standing water faster but it does catch the hair. 3 stars because it catches hair but it doesn't help with the standing water. I haven't used this since the first week, apparently bleach works really well with the clogging.
title: Meh

author: RC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: This thing is great! My husband and I would begrudge the chore of pulling out the collection of hair caught down in the shower drain once a month or so, but not since the Tub Shroom! This sucker really works!It's hassle-free; easy to install, remove, pull off the hair it's caught, and replace. It even catches pet hair. I can't believe how much hair was going down the drain before - no wonder it was clogging! And my husband and I no longer have to fight about who's going to clean I out!The silicone top is very prominent, sticking up out of the drain a bit, but it doesn't bother us any. Maybe just choose a color you don't mind looking at.Highly recommend. Will buy again for other drains!
title: Highly Recommended, Hassle-Free Solution

author: R. Cartagena
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2017
review_content: I can’t recommend this thing enough. I live in an old building with old pipes, and was constantly having to run an auger down my drain because I couldn’t reach the hair clog— it was happening too far down the line. You have to clean the hair off this thing often— it’s eye opening the amount of hair that goes down your drain and you don’t even realize it til you see it on the shroom. I’ve had it over 6 months now, and haven’t had any slow drains or clogs. You need this in your life.
title: I can’t recommend this thing enough

author: The consumer's voice
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2017
review_content: This is one of those sort of impulse buys you run across online when you've had a couple beers and see something that makes you say, "Hey, they're right - pulling hair out of the regular drain in the tub IS a pain in the rear..."I think that's their intended market here.The "TubShroom does collect hair as advertised, and it is surprisingly easy to remove your shedding at the drain with this installed, but it does fit kinda wonky into the drain hole itself.  Gotta kinda force it in there, and when it comes time to retrieve all your spoils, they do sluff off easily under water, but the part of the drain plug/shroom in the hole does get deformed a bit.  Comes out all wavy and you don't know if it's going to fit back in the drain like it did before.  Doesn't really affect it's effectiveness and is worth a 4&1/2 star rating, but since that isn't an option, rounding up to five stars simply isn't deserved and you'd probably not even be reading these comments.Still a cool thing, and if I have to work harder to cram that bottom part into the hole, that's why I dropped part of a star to the review.  I'd still buy another one, though - provided it was discounted on a lightning deal like this one was for less than even their sale price, despite how goofy it looks like in the tub.
title: Mixed emotions about the purchase.  Mostly good.

author: Sara C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2017
review_content: We just moved in to a new place, and I wanted to replace the old school metal filter that was in the tub/shower when we arrived. The TubShroom was easy to open and install.I have thick, medium length hair and the TubShroom grabbed the hairs up with no problem. The real test was when we gave our cocker spaniel a bath - it picked up the longer hairs AND the short clippings from his haircut. This alone made this purchase worth it!I now realize why I was constantly buying draino or having to snake out the drains in the bathroom. TubShroom is great! Looking forward to getting the sink version as well.
title: The TubShroom was easy to open and install

author: ThatMomLady
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
review_content: 3 out of 4 people in my home have long, longer and really long hair. the tub drains were a disaster. installed this and now the drains are SO much easier to keep hair free.  These are very easy to pop out, clean off, and pop back in. The material is very flexible, and yet stays very firmly in place. And the water drains through as if nothing was in the drain.  One of the best home related purchases with regard to cost vs. usefulness. I cannot recommend these enough!
title: Super easy to install, remove and clean

author: Mollypop
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018
review_content: This thing is great!!! My tub/shower was CONSTANTLY getting clogged with my hair sheddage. It’s so easy to “install” literally unscrew your old stopper, and plop this thing in. That simple! I clean this out every time I use it, only because it literally takes 5 seconds, then you don’t have to deal with soap scum hardening & that way it will always only take 5 seconds to clean! It’s so simple, yet very effective. It catches all of my hair & it has totally solved my drain problem. Why is this product only rated 4 stars overall!? I don’t understand how this couldn’t work for anyone who has a tub/shower. It’s great, I highly reccomend.
title: don’t understand the 4 star overall reviews!?

author: jb008
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019
review_content: Couldn't even get through 2 showers before this was backing up and water was pooling in the tub.  Compared to another shower drain cover which we can get through multiple days of showering before needing to clean.  Yes, TS is easy to clean but be prepared to be cleaning it after basically every shower.  A clear PASS in my book, and an example of product not fulfilling the hype.
title: A clear PASS in my book - example of product not fulfilling the hype

author: New Orleans Lizzy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2017
review_content: I've spent probably $500 on Draino and Lye in my 11 years of living outside of my parent's house.  I've got a lot of hair.  Like, a lot.  Like, thick, tight, curls down to my mid-back.  I'm not changing my hair just because I have to use chemicals and snakes to pull rat-sized clumps of hair out of my drain, monthly.I was about to lose my mind, though.  I had tried every single type of drain catcher in existence and nothing worked.  It doesn't help that I live in a 120 year old house with 100+ year old pipes either.After meeting my husband and adopting my dog, the TubShroom is the best thing that has ever happened to me.  I don't want to vomit once a month when I am on my knees bent over the tub with a snake digging and pulling and gagging to get all of my hair out so I can take a shower without also taking a bath.
title: Necessity for all curly girls/gals

author: JD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2016
review_content: This product keeps its promises!The drain in my shower was constantly slowing due to hair, almost every other week I was purchasing drano or another liquid or foam drain cleaner to keep it going.Since getting the TubShroom I haven't had to buy anymore drain cleaner! Granted I due have to clean the hair off of the TubShroom every other day or so, but that only takes a minute. It can feel a little gross peeling the hair off of the TubShroom, so I usually wrap a piece of toilet paper around it and use that to pull the hair off. I've found it's usually a little easier to get the hair off when it is damp, when it is dry the hair "clings" a little more.Overall, I highly recommend this if you have any drain issues resulting from hair.
title: Great Product, no more Drain Cleaner purchases for me!

author: Elizabeth H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2020
review_content: I loose alot of daily on the daily,  I have bought several different drain plug things that claim to stop the hair... well they might but they also prevent the water from draining as well.  The Tubshoom from what I have seen grabs all the hair and the water still flows good.  I do have a tub that has a screw in stopper so the shroom does not fit all the way down in the drain like it is supposed to but I have not had to clear the drain or wait for the water to drain since I started using this.  I love it and will be buying a few more for my kids bathrooms.
title: AMAZING

author: Mary B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2017
review_content: I purchased this after reading many reviews ~ I can add my positive review. I have medium length  dark brown hair and constantly had to try to clean out my shower drain. I put the TubShroom into my shower drain and am somewhat happy (???) to see my hair clustered around it. I certainly don't like losing hair but I certainly don't want it clogging my drains. I will take it out after my shower to allow it to dry and then with a tissue I'll grab onto the hair and throw it away (don't flush it down the toilet though). I think as long as you take it out after each use you'll avoid any slime/mold issues. I love it.
title: Great invention

author: Clay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2020
review_content: As a dad of 3 girls, all under 10yrs-old, they take lots of BATHS. And we have a lot of hair buildup. I *thought* this was the solution to our problems. But, I was woefully wrong. - This CONVERTS a bathtub to a shower-only. There’s no way to use this product for girls who still take baths. - I freely admit it works well for showers. There’s just no way to use it for baths.
title: Converts Bathtub to shower-only.

author: Wallflower
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
review_content: I think this would work best in a shower, not tub and shower combo, at least not when you're taking a bath. It won't stay in the drain during a bath--it just floats up. Then after your bath, when the water is draining, you have to remember to stick it in the drain. It will stay in when water is draining out. Since I have to take it out often, I have to deal with cleaning it often, which I don't enjoy. I think I'll go back to the Drain Wig.
title: Not for bath, not for me

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2020
review_content: This didn't fit properly in our drain, so I cut the top 1/2" off and stuck just the bottom in under the drain. I clean it once a month and am always surprised by how much it catches (my hair is long and curly, my husband's is short and straight). The drain was slow a few days ago so I cleaned the tumb shroom and then snaked the pipe... there was nothing in the pipe! After cleaning the tub shroom, drain worked normally. Glad to avoid any septic issues
title: good preventative measure

author: Jeff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: We've used several types of drain catchers with not much success to the delight of the local plumber. Decided to take a chance on this one and found it incredibly effective. Even after a single shower, it catches stray hairs before they go down the drain. The only thing that I would caution is that it tends to slow down the draining action - probably not unlike other versions. So make sure that you have a well cleaned out drain before you use.
title: Excellent hair catcher

author: SDR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
review_content: Even at its shortest times my hair is still past my shoulders and several years ago I had a clog in my shower drain because of it.  Having to look up Youtube videos to figure out how to get the stopper out and then having to pull the gross, wet, jumble of hair out of the drain was not fun or something I wanted to be doing on a regular basis.  So after that incident, I did the stick the loose hairballs to the wall trick for awhile.  I finally decided to try a Tub Shroom a few months ago and I am glad I did.  Now I don't worry about the hair running down the drain because I know the 'Shroom will catch it.  I clean it out every 5-10 showers, but I'm sure it doesn't have to be cleaned that often.  I've never had it cause a back up from being too full.  I don't know whether it catches every single hair, but I do know that when I take it out to clean it I see no hair trapped in the actual metal drain below.So far, I haven't seen any mold growth on the 'shroom.  I am happy with my purchase.
title: Glad I purchased this

author: Jason S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2017
review_content: [[ASIN:B01BYMTYBS TubShroom The Revolutionary Tub Drain Protector Hair Catcher/Strainer/Snare, White]So If you're a guy living with a girlfriend/fiancee/wife with whom you share a shower, put this in your cart NOW!! I was getting so tired of going into the shower drain with the snake, and finding my fiancees long hair, every few months. So I saw this on launchpad on Amazon and thought I'd try it.It starts to clog quicker, but you just have to pull it right out and throw the hair in the toilet. It has saved me some time and feeling like I was showering in a swimming pool. It works great, so if you have that problem, this is a good option. This product works.
title: This product does EXACTLY what it says it does, so it saves a lot of time

author: BadHobbit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2018
review_content: I have to say I was a bit skeptical about this product when I first heard of it. After several recommendations from friends (and needing to find another solution for the hair clogs) I went ahead and purchased it.We are a household of 3 woman, 2 with short hair and 1 with long hair, not to mention several family member visits a month with multiple people having longer hair. Oh, and a medium haired dog that does get washed in the shower.I tried 3 other drain catchers while i was waiting for this one to arrive. None could hold up and frankly were nasty to clean out.I removed the metal catcher with a screwdriver and placed the Shroom in its place (as directed by the printed instructions on the box), at first it looked funny sticking out a bit (the instructions tell you this is normal) and my mom thought I had dropped a giant button in the shower (top view). The first shower was a grand success. Not only was the water able to properly drain (goodbye standing in a pool of your own dirty bathwater!!!!) but the hair dropped into the catcher without it collecting on the top (so it was not visible to one taking a shower). Once I was done, I didn't think it had worked since all the hair drained, little did i know it was draining into the spool. All the hair that had gone down was indeed caught and very, very simple to remove from the spool. I grabbed tissue and just "peeled" the hair off and threw away the trash. Voila! I don't know why I had ever hesitated. I like it so much and it is so useful, i am including it in all my housewarming gifts. It is the item you never knew you needed nor wanted. But now that i have it I am so much better for it.
title: Don't hesitate! Buy it, you will no regret it!!!

author: Buhren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2017
review_content: Let's cut to the chase. While I like this product and I would recommend it the advertisement is a bunch of bull.I have owned this product for a few weeks. I have a little over shoulder length curly thick hair. (in case you were wondering) I tested it for a week because I wanted to give it a good amount of time to give myself an unbiased opinion.The advertisement shows hair going down the drain and getting caught in the TubShroom BUT doesn't show hair with hair product, soap, or dirt and oils from your body.  The mixture of these things actually does cause a bit of a drainage problem and after about a few days of use water began to collect at the bottom of my tub. My husband actually took it out while he showered at one point so he didn't have to stand in it. So I suggest changing it out every few days and not a week.Cleaning is also a bit difficult. Because most people shower at least once a day the TubShroom is always wet. In the ads they clean it while the hair is completely dry so it just slides right off. Well the hair product and in my case my husbands alternating shower schedule with mine keeps it wet making it a bit harder to "Remove the hair with one effortless move."After cleaning it I rinsed mine off with hot water and a little bit of Dawn dish soap to get off the hair product and all the other grimey stuff off. I've since put it back and have found a good schedule as far as cleaning it goes and haven't had any drainage problems since.It's a good product and I do recommend it but I do suggest considering the things that I've mentioned.
title: Half Truth Advertisement

author: Megan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2017
review_content: Update #2: 2.5 years later and I’ve only had to unclog the drain once, and I believe it was just because of soap scum.Update: more than a year later and I have yet to have to unclog the drain!I am one of those people who clogs the shower drains with my hair. It got to the point where I brushed my hair well before getting in and then kept a brush in the shower to wrap the excess hair in while shampooing, and would STILL clog the drain every 6 weeks or so. I've had this about 2 months now and thought I'd really test it out by no longer brushing my hair before or during the shower. No clogs! It's amazing how much this thing catches considering it's this cheap looking piece of rubber that doesn't even fit well. I will say, it's much easier (and a lot less slimy) to clean when dry. And the loose fit (& lightweight) means sometimes my cat thinks he can play with it again and I'll find it in the bedroom floor. I tell everyone I know about this thing.
title: It's amazing how much this thing catches considering it's this cheap ...

author: The Sugar Fairy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2017
review_content: AMAZING! A must have for families with long shedding hair!!Doesn't fit snug in my tub drain but fits well enough. Once a month I used to have to use chemicals to declog our shower drain as the amount of hair coming from my long hair and my teenage daughters made it so the shower would clog up and provide us with three to four inches of standing water. It was a real pain in the butt, a constant added expense, and made the tub constantly feel and look dirty. I bought this hoping it would catch the hair as advertised causing the drain to not clog. This tiny little device is a true miracle!!! We've been using it for almost 3 months now and I have yet to need to use chemicals 2 declogged pipes as we have ZERO clogs!! I do have to remove the plug everyday to remove the hair that has collected otherwise the tub will not drain. Cleaning the plug is a nasty job as you can imagine hair soap scum Etc. The only true negative that I have found is that the in side of the plug is hard to clean as the soap scum collects to it and using a tissue simply won't clean it. About once a week I have to go in with a pipe cleaner or bottle brush to clean and sanitize the inside of the plug cylinder.***update*** its been about 6 months or so and I just purchased a new poo be. The original got too nasty. These are really hard to clean and clog up with soap scum, body fluids etc quickly. After a while its time to toss and replace. Still even with replacing 2 times a year its a bargain compared to using chemicals 4 + times a year! Product works great and I still give it 5 stars.I just wish it was easier to clean!
title: AMAZING! A must have for families with long shedding hair!!

author: niki
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
review_content: Good lord I am a shedder. This product does a great job of catching my hair. Removing hair from it and putting it in the trash can is easy but not pleasant. Little gross.There are things in a marriage which could be classified as “should dos” and “must dos” if you agree upon them before hand. I love cats. It my husband doesn’t but he agreed we could have 3 cats if I cleaned the litter every day. I agreed to empty tub shroom of hair at least weekly. These are “must dos” since I agreed to them. There are other things that are should dos but you just don’t feel like it. Then, if your husband starts doing those things him self the tub shroom develops a problem. If more than a week goes by of me doing neither the must or the should dos then the tub shroom becomes an impermeable cylinder of hair/soap/man goo that resembles a tiny plaster cast.So, this product, like men, are more functional if serviced at least once a week.
title: Great job demonstrating how much I am shedding.

author: Lawyer For Justice
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2017
review_content: I was skeptical about this little rubber strainer, but I needed something to save my drains from the piles of hair that fall out of my head.  I tried others and they all failed miserably.This thing is amazing!  It fit into my standard drain perfectly, and I don't think a single hair slipped by it.  It was pretty gross to see how much hair I lost in just one shower, but it was comforting to know it wasn't clogging my drain.Clean up is super easy, too.  I just took a tissue and wiped it from top to bottom, grabbing all the hair as the soft rubber strainer released it all easily. Not a hair was caught in it.Best strainer I've ever had.  I strongly recommend it!!!
title: BEST. STRAINER. EVER.

author: Sarah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2018
review_content: I was super excited about this after seeing it on Shark Tank. I have long hair and shed a lot, so this seemed like a great fit for me. I quickly found that it needed to be cleaned out after every single shower (more than my previous drain catcher) which was a bit annoying. And after about a month of use, the thing was so disgustingly moldy that even after attempting to clean it it was so ruined that I threw it out. Swapped it out for a metal one. Would not buy this again.
title: Such a disappointing purchase

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2017
review_content: I used to have to throw out expensive hair traps that sit over top of the drain after only a few weeks because you could never really get them fully clean.  The soap scum and whatnot would accumulate in all the little hair-trap holes and no matter how hard you scrubbed, the thing gets cloudy, gunky, stained, and ugly-looking.Not this thing!  The genius is that the hair and scum get wrapped around the tubular part that sits - invisibly - down inside the drain.  Yes, your drain will get slow after about 10 showers or so and you need to remove the hair, clear away as much of the gunk as possible.  But you don't have to worry about getting it all, just most of it.  Why spend time and elbow grease really cleaning something like this just to avoid having something ugly down in your shower?  This takes care of it; the top stays clean and it's all you ever see.  No offensive soap-scum.  The lower part may get stained, but you only see it when you're cleaning it.I found that this does NOT slow my drain appreciably when it has been recently cleaned.  I love that it's soft and doesn't hurt toes if stepped on or kicked.  I love that I only have to clear away hair and not worry about cleaning the thing for presentation's sake; I can just wipe the hair away and put it back, done.  Buy one for every bathroom and one of the sink ones for every sink in your house.
title: Best hair trap I've ever used, and I've used virtually every style

author: Kenneth Davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2017
review_content: The tubshroom is probably the best product to catch hair in the shower. So much easier than sticking something down the drain to get the hair out or constantly pouring a drain cleaner or whatever. This item works great and is so easy to clean. Definitely recommend cleaning before a shower. Not as easy to clean all the way after a shower than it is before. Recommend for sure!!
title: Works amazingly

author: Kristen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2017
review_content: I have long hair and a ton of it. My husband and I were both hating how often I clogged the drain up so I found this. It works so good. We've been using it for over 2 months now and so far no clogs at all. All you have to do is take it out of the drain and just unwrap the hair from it.*Update: I bought a new one and HATE IT! I should have just kept my old one. My new one doesn't stop any hair at all. NONE! All the hair goes by it somehow but my old one worked great. I tossed my old one as soon as the new one came and I wish I hadn't. The only reason I bought a new one is because the old one had started getting moldy regardless of how much I scrubbed it but I obviously should have just kept it.

author: Zeke
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2019
review_content: Works as advertised.  Caught a lot of hair and clean up was a breeze.  However, we have a high-flow shower head, so the water pooled in the tub as I showered, leaving me standing in a puddle of water.  That is exactly what would happen when hair would partially clog the drain, the reason I wanted something to catch the hair.While the product is good, don't buy if you have a high-flow shower head unless you like standing in dirty water.  I think I'll just stick with snaking out the drain every few weeks.
title: Did what it was supposed to, but...

author: AW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019
review_content: Why?  Because it collects every single thing going down the drain and I have to constantly clean it!  Wait - that's a good thing that it's getting it before it goes down the drain!!  I was astonished at how much it collects.  Kind of a pain since I have to clean it once a wk but also makes me glad that it's not going down there, collecting until it decides to clog up the whole system, necessitating a call to the (very expensive) plumber.
title: I hate this thing!!!  Wait...

author: Techno geek
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2019
review_content: I replaced one of the flat flower shaped strainers that are like 5 inches across.  The tubshroom is so much smaller, yet does a better job catching the hair.  You have to empty it about twice as often, but its quick and easy.  Cleaning the previous design I would find a few hairs 50% or more through the holes, so I know some hair is getting through.  I've never seen any hairs working their way through the tubshroom so I have to believe it's doing a much better job.
title: Don't bathe without a tubshroom.

author: Talya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2016
review_content: Really seems like it should cost $3-5, but they know how frustrated we are with the other options. This does what it says. It really is simple and easy and definitely superior to that stupid wire mesh strainer I was using before it. It doesn't fit in my drain exactly like the picture because my drain is smaller and doesn't have that thing on the bottom for it to sit on, but I make it work.  I just push it down and then pull it up as far as I can without pulling it out and it stays in place just fine and collects all the hair as the water swirls around it.
title: Yes!

author: Samantha Rossi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2018
review_content: For years my sister and I have made my Dad crazy with our hair constantly clogging up the drains. He would always have to snake it and pull out gunked up hair. We have tried multiple kinds of catchers and baskets but nothing ever worked. This product is the only thing that has ever worked and I have not had a clogged drain in months. This is big because my tub usually slows down after a few weeks but I have not had a problem it really catches everything and it simultaneously allows the water to easily drain.
title: It actually works really well!!!

author: Paul Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2019
review_content: I purchased it after reading multiple positive reviews and hoped it will catch all the hair going into drain. I had to remove hair a few time already - quite a problem.The item came new, well packed. It is very easy to insert and remove. When inserted - by its construction it already stops flow of water. Does not matter what position it would not catch hair.Waste of money and plastic.
title: Catches nothing!

author: M. Warner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2020
review_content: Great product! Works very well. It’s my cat’s favorite toy!! No seriously. We now keep it way up high which encourages frequent cleaning. If we leave it in she’s garnered to pull it out and we’ll find it in a bedroom somewhere with new bits chewed off. (She has cat appropriate toys. A whole bucket of them.)Wouldn’t really go more than two showers without cleaning but I have long hair. Doesn’t fit very well in our drain even with the bits removed. But it does the job!
title: Cat’s Favorite Toy!

author: Kaitlyn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020
review_content: This is less gross than the white ring style you're used to seeing. It catches hair well, but does "fill up" pretty quickly. (At least in my house. Maybe 3-4 showers)They only had orange in stock, which in my personal opinion is an eyesore, but who cares really...It's easy to put in, and easy to take out without touching slimy shower hair.If you have a hair problem in your shower, this will definitely help you out.
title: Does the trick

author: pn2000
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
review_content: This little tool worked great for about two months, but then it started accumulating gunk and black mold. Despite cleaning it every 2 weeks, it became impossible to clean after a couple of months. Unless you want to spend 30 minutes deep cleaning this tool every couple of days...not worth it! Wish it was more durable, because it did a great job when we first got it. Not sure if I would recommend.
title: Good While it Works

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2018
review_content: Bought this product for some of the ladies in my family. Without a doubt, this product has almost erased the need for me to snake the drains in the house. I used to have to unclog the drains about once every 6 months to a year, now I'm pretty sure that I wont have to unclog any drains for at least a couple of years. Cleaning this thing gets a little gross, but it's a lot better than having to snake a drain and clean 5 lbs. of hair off of the end of your tools when the job is finished. In the future, I will be buying this product again. For the amount you pay for this, there is no product better.
title: Best product for the money, really works and saves your drains!

author: Amber P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020
review_content: I bought this for our master stand up shower. We have a nice double wide home and I measured the hole (after removing the original strainer grate) and it was 1 3/4 inches. It also has the 'x' type cross bars approximately 2 inches down into the hole so I was concerned about fit but thought it was worth a try. My hair comes out a lot and we have a German Shepherd that sheds immensely all year but "blows her coat" twice a year (even worse). Our drains were always clogging. Anyways, this TubShroom fits PERFECTLY in our stand-up shower and works WONDERFULLY!!! I'm amazed by this simple piece of awesomeness!!! Measure your drain hole and look for the correct size. It's truly a game changer (2 months into usage)!!! Sorry its gross, but this is all the German Shepherd hair it caught during her bath today (& yes, I brushed her prior). For reference, I wear a size US 10 1/2 in womens shoes. It caught a TON of hair!!! SUPER EASY TO CLEAN!!! I bought the gray (well water) in case anyone cares to know that.
title: Tubshroom fits Our Doublewide Stand-up Shower Perfectly (after measuring)

author: Patrick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2019
review_content: This item has save my bathroom pipes. My daughter has very long, curly thick hair.  It was constantly clogging my bathroom pipes. Making the water back up during showers. I would use drano and other products to rid me of the clogged in bath tub, but it didn't fix the problem.  This product has been wonderful purchase. No more hair clogs for more than a year.  Happy daughter and happy dad, that doesn't have to unclog the bathtub with a metal coat hanger:)
title: No more clogs!

author: Moo1966
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: This does exactly what its intended to do, it traps a ton of hair in the shower.  It doesn’t fit all the way into my shower drain, so its not flush with the floor, but that doesn’t seem to be a problem.  It still fits snug in the bottom of the drain and catches all the hair that goes through the drain.  It’s soft and squishy, so it doesn’t matter if you step on it.  It is kinda gross to clean out all the hair, but better than letting it clog up your drain.
title: Why didnt I buy this sooner?

author: diane
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2016
review_content: I need to buy more. My tub was clogged for weeks. I have two daughters and myself so there is a lot of hair that goes down the drain. I cleaned and unclogged the area before I placed the Tubshroom. I put it in and we have gone through 3 showers in less than an hour and the product is amazing. No clog. Amazing. I am glad I replaced Drano with this product. Drano is bad for your pipes per my Plumber. I bought green to match my decor. I am excited for this product.
title: TubShroom. Yes! Buy it!

author: P Deiters
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2019
review_content: I was sick of having to fish out hair from the drain once a week. I saw this product and I thought I would give it a go and it really does work. It does not sit flush with you bath but does stick up a bit but it has caught all the hair and it is easy to remove the hair once caught. I highly recommend this product. Now if they made a smaller once for utility sinks I would be really happy
title: So this really does work

author: Tomorrah H Stallings
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2019
review_content: I’ve taken more than my fair share of showers that ended up being baths and paid countless dollars on liquid drain openers.We finally had to call a plumber because the problem was no longer being resolved w/ the liquid stuff. Our plumber recommended the Tub Shroom and I’ve no longer taken an inadvertent bath.This thing catches most debris that you wouldn’t even think about which is what I’m sure what was causing all of the clogs. I am thoroughly pleased and will be recommending The Tub Shroom.
title: Bye Bye liquid drain opener and plumber fees!

author: E.T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
review_content: Great for catching hairs and has been used for years! I got my comment eliminated for the recent shopping experience for this product, so I come to my old one and comment. Hopefully, it will show it to everyone! Highly recommend this product! I don't have my bathtub cock for years now since I have this product because It catches every piece of hair no matter it is long or short. ( I have hair cuts every year, so THT!!!) Anyways, I don't understand why my voice is eliminated and nobody gave me a response from Amazon. Anyways, all I want to do is to share this product is good and hopefully, you all can see my comment!
title: Deserved for a five-star

author: XMen57
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2019
review_content: Clogs frequently and quickly. After using it less than a month, the inside of the cylinder is NASTY and CLOGGED with gunk. Getting hair off of it is a chore that requires very pointed scissors - trying to unwrap the hair just doesn't work. Honestly, I'd rather just unclog the drain manually once a month or so than deal with this stupid thing. It's so gross now, after less than a month, I wouldn't subject Amazon personnel to handling it if I returned it. In the trash it went. Don't waste your money.
title: Neat idea....it just doesn't work.

author: Madison Tytanic
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020
review_content: I really like this product because not only is it easy to clean but i feel like its better for the environment since I have stopped using drano as much! It really does stop the hair from going down the drain and you can easily tell when it needs to be cleaned because it stops draining as much. It is a little gross to clean, but its worth the price for stopping using drano. Overall, cheap and so far durable product. Traded in all my stoppers for this product
title: Amazing stuff!

author: rottenrog
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2019
review_content: I have a bathtub/shower combo in basement of a house. The drain is barely above the main house drain, and the tub drains very slowly. We have had problems with hair clogs for years, and I have used other types of drain screens before. The Tub-Shroom fits snugly into the drain (you have to remove the drain cover, which I had already done to use other types of screens) and works very well at catching the hair and preventing it from going down the drain. When this one wears out, I'll be buying another.
title: Stops tub from getting clogged.

author: Katelyn S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
review_content: As a girl with long, thick, curly hair that sheds more than Rapunzel, I thought for sure this was not going to work or get clogged after every shower. To my surprise it worked like a dream, I can go a week or so before having to clean it and the water still drains properly. This is also perfect for catching dog and cat hair, after giving my dog a bath the drain would always get clogged and after seeing how much hair this thing collects I understand why. Truly has made my life easier, the only complaint is it sometimes pops out of the drain if stepped on or bumped. And somehow no one else but me seems to know how to put it back in the drain.
title: Great for Collecting All Types of Hair

author: Anne V. Silveira
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2018
review_content: We were worried this item would not work well in the beginning as it did not fit perfectly into our drain. I am so glad we were wrong.I was losing so much hair postpartum that it was literally coming off of my head in ropes. Something I had never experienced before, I was a little concerned because I kept clogging the tub drain repeatedly. I saw an advertisement for the tubshroom and figured for the price, it was better and a less toxic solution than constantly pouring draino down the drain. Let me tell you IT WORKS and catches every hair. You do have to clean it off regularly or the drain gets backed up as if it was clogged.I hope this helps! I know they also have a few more models if you don't have this type of drain!
title: IT WORKS!

author: Brittany Templeton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
review_content: I thought about purchasing this for years and never did lol I've tried multiple drain catchers to help keep my long ass hair from going down the drain and clogging it up in 3 days. This thing works!! I was worried it might not fit into our shower drain, but it's squishy enough, yet has structure to it! Now, I do clean this off after EVERY shower (it takes 3 seconds guys, don't be lazy) and it really helps. It's easy to pull off whatever is caught around it, and not much gets past this thing! I don't expect it to work very well, if you just let hair collect around it for too long, it will defeat the purpose. May not go down the drain, but you'll get a clog, so clean it off! But this thing has saved so much frustration, our shower never gets clogged anymore. Totally worth the purchase, and very affordable.
title: I get the hype now!

author: Kenny
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2017
review_content: I bought one of these to see what the hype was all about (plus an experimental method of defense against the GF's hair going down the drain). It seems to work great! You'll probably need a screwdriver to take off the old style hair catcher and then just drop this in. Every little piece of hair seems to wrap around it. One thing to note though: this will likely do nothing to stop small jewelry and other things from going down the drain. The Tubshroom is a small rubbery drop-in that does not take up all the space in the drain. It just sits where you leave it and doesn't come out on it's own.
title: Awesome invention. Plumber approved.

author: lefteyetwitch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2020
review_content: Does a great job of trapping hair in the shower drain. We don't get clogs as long as we use this product. It mildews quickly, at least it does for us in our subtropical climate. So I recommend having 2 and switch them out between showers so one can dry out completely while the other is in use. They need to be replaced periodically but it's well worth it as it's better than the headaches of drain clogs. Very good product that does what it says it does.
title: It works!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2018
review_content: i have long hair, and it's curly which means I can only brush/comb it in the shower. I used to clog the drain over time every couple of months or so, even while taking precautions to keep it from going down (clarification: I'd do the thing where you stick it to the walls and wipe it off after the shower. Ladies, you know.) But with this thing, it's been so effective that there is no hair in the drain at all, even after a ton of use. I don't even need to worry about the hair that comes out when i comb anymore. Well, except that it's so effective (and apparently my hair is so ridiculous) that the shroom fills up within 1 shower, and I then have to wipe it down with each use. But hey, still so much easier than digging in the shower drain with anything long and grabby i can find.Oh, do note: you'll want to keep paper towels near the shower or generally in your bathroom area, as you won't want to touch the hair that's collected probably.
title: The marketing isn't lying-- it literally does what it says it will, and it does it well.

author: CC from MD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019
review_content: Easy to install, I'll give it that.  When it's totally clean, the water flows through fairly well.  However, after a day or two, I'm standing it a puddle.  It's also hard to clean.  I have short, fine hair, and it takes several minutes of picking and scrubbing to get the hair out of the shroom, in part due to the soapy scum that settles on it and cements everything in place.  I threw it away and went back to Plan A (picking hair out of my drain strainer).
title: Very effective drain stopper, alas

author: IVOR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020
review_content: Was really skeptical. Got this little rubbery thing full of holes and thought, no way this works.Installed it in our shower where the wife washes her hair, which was always causing a problem blocking the drain.Well, was totally SURPRISED at how efficiently this little rubbery thing really works!Easy to install, fits and works well, AND really easy to clean!No more hairs blocking the drain - love it!
title: SURPRISED!

author: Kristen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2016
review_content: UPDATE: I've been using this for several months now and I'm changing my review from 4 stars to 5 stars. I do have to empty it pretty much every other day, but I don't even care. Before we got this, we were using all kinds of products to unclog our drain. We had another hair catcher and still our drain got blocked up every month it seemed. I thought it was because it's an old house. We used every "drain-o" under the sun.However, since we bought the TubShroom, we haven't had a clogged drain once! Worth every penny and I'm buying more for my friends and family!
title: From 4-stars up to 5-stars! Love the TubShroom!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2019
review_content: I was skeptical at first, but WOW does this save our drains! My hair is very long so would come out in the shower and clog the drain, like most women that don’t want to admit to!Well just like my husband, I got tired of having to unclog the drains. Looked for something to help with our “hairy” issues, came across this little gadget and VOILA- problems solved!Easy to clean, just pull it out once you see your tub/sink not draining, wipe the hair off (trash it or repurposed it into some kind of freaky art, like I’m sure someone will think of) then pop it back in your drain. Easy peasy.Definitely recommend
title: Definitely recommend

author: David Bopp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020
review_content: Found this after i missed out on a kickstarter for basically this.  It works as advertised and i no longer feel like i will need the plumbing snake in my review history now that were using this.  Its been over a month and its working as advertised.  I think how often you have to clean it is just a matter of how often you shower and how much you shed.  My wife and i shed a lot so we do it about once a week but if its a heavy shower week it might be 3x for two weeks.
title: Why have i never owned one of these before

author: Derek D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2019
review_content: I am missing my tub drain plug.  This item doesn't fit the tub drain.  So I have been using a plastic holed drain basket and it catches a fair amount of hair but clogs easily.  By combining the two, and inserted the TubShroom into the drain basket, it catches more hair and don't have to clean it every time.So not a great solution.  Cleaning hair off the TubShroom is non-trivial.  I wouldn't buy it again, but using for now.
title: doesn't fit my drain

author: Thosbren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2019
review_content: Often words like "revolutionary" make me suspect, but this really works. I used to have issues frequently, but with the TubShroom they are gone -- and you don't want to use chemical drain cleaners any more often than necessary. You have to clean it about once a week, but that's easy.
title: Totally works

author: Nicole Porter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2019
review_content: This is seriously a long haired girls dream come true! Makes it so much easier to unclog the drain. And my dear husband doesn't have to get down and dirty to clean the drain nearly as often. instead of it being a weekly thing to get that nasty clog from the drain (seriously, I have a TON of hair) its like once every month or two where he needs to take the drain apart. This thing is so easy to clean, just get it wet, grab a wad of toilet paper (because no one wants to touch that) and wipe it off. That easy! I can never live without one now.
title: GREATEST INVENTION EVER

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020
review_content: I needed something that would catch the tons of hair that both I and my younger sister lose in the shower. My husband was not happy having to stand in ankle-deep water to shower because we were clogging the drain. We tried a contraption from Wal-Mart that just didn’t do as good of a job. It held the hair over the opening of the drain so the water couldn’t go through it once you started washing your hair and it started falling out. It also got soap scum and stuff all over it that seemed impossible to get off. I had seen the tub shroom on Buzzfeed lists and decided that I’d give it a go. It was a little more than I wanted to pay for such a contraption, considering the ones at Walmart were like $4, but I really wanted to try it. This thing is AWESOME. I got it in the mail and put it in the tub immediately, and when I took a shower that night, no standing water! It is a miracle! This thing catches all the hair without clogging up the opening to the drain, and it’s super easy to clean also. I would give this 10 stars if I could.
title: AWESOME

author: Jeanne Hoffman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2016
review_content: I've tried so many different drain covers.  I have long hair and the drain gets clogged easily.A lot of drain covers I tried would get clogged while showering and start floating around the bathtub.  Others would get mildew-y and nasty.They never seemed to work right.This specific product works so well.  I clean it out about every other shower, but it doesn't make the bathtub back up while I use it or anything.  I'm so glad I found this product after trying about five other drain covers.
title: Wow!  This works great.

author: kate519
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
review_content: It does a pretty good job of catching hair, but it's not as easy to clean as they claim. It often slips down into our drain and stops water from flowing and I have to pull it back up. I think I clean it off about every other day (there's two people taking daily showers in our house) and it's still often clogging. It's also covered in a really thick, seemingly inpenetrable layer of dark mold. I regret getting this.
title: Moldy and annoying

author: Megan
