date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
review_content: I have long hair, longer than your probably imagining, it went well to my butt when I bought this (It’s only that long because I’m lazy and I hate paying someone to cut my hair, so it just grows unchecked.) I had a lot of issues with clogged drains. A lot of issues. A lot. This little beast has stopped all that. I’m impressed. It catches all the hair. It even catches pet hair, which I was skeptical of since my dogs hair is MUCH shorter than mine. I figured it would wiggle through the holes. Nope. Catches pup hair too. No more clogged drains from my hair or dog hair. 100% satisfied and 100% clog free.
title: Worked as it should!

author: KMJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
review_content: I needed to replace our tub drain hair catcher and considered getting the same basket style that I had. Saw this and all the positive comments, decided to give it a try. I wasn't really sure it would work, but within a day, I was totally convinced I had made the right choice. Easier to clean than the basket style, and the design allows the water to drain more completely (the basket style would fill up and block the draining action). If I could give it 6 stars, I would!
title: From skeptic to convinced in one day!

author: Neel Patel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2016
review_content: Product worked as described but same as other people I was having problem with water not draining properly But this was mainly due to hair being stuck in drain from before I bought the product, Once I cleaned all the gunk up It worked like charm! def worth the price.P.S. If you guys ever maker upgrade to item or make version 2.. please make the height adjustable or make it shaped like accordion/ spring like so the height is not an issue, Right now we use bucket time to time and its a hassle taking it out and putting it back in every time.Thank you!
title: 5/5!! but minor problem STILL 5/5!!

author: adianice correa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2016
review_content: I've used many products for the same purpose. I have a ridiculously ton of curly hair and have been know to clog up my bathtub.  It's simple but does the job ams I even bought one for my tenant to use to avoid any clogs in the future.
title: Must use if you lose a lot of hair in the shower etc.

author: Sarah D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2018
review_content: I had both of my tubs back up and the plumber recommended a drain stopper.  I found this on Amazon and am really impressed. I am shocked how much hair I had in the stopper every week.  It's really easy to clean the hair off.  The only thing I don't like is when I take a bath, I have to take it out and screw the stopper back on.
title: Saves my drain!

author: Karen Beth Martin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2017
review_content: When I first got this, it seemed to work great. Fit easily into the drain, cleaned easily, etc. Well, I've been using this thing for over a year, clean it regularly and have found that it does not work at all. There's no reason that it shouldn't work after a year's use; it's not damaged or corroded and is exactly as it was when I opened the package. My clog is consistently backed up. I looked down into the drain and can SEE hair clogged up right beneath where the shroom should have been catching. There is still hair on the shroom when I clean it after each shower but clearly too much gets past it. I would not at all recommend this contraption. It simply does not work.
title: Does NOT work.

author: jh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
review_content: I was worried about purchasing this when I saw some of the negative reviews on it. I will agree that it can sometimes be difficult to remove the hair from the drain, especially if/when the hair is wet. I find it easiest to remove the hair with a piece of toilet paper/paper towel and this seems to make removal much easier. If it isn't cleaned frequently, it does slow down the drainage of water. I haven't ever found this to be frustrating, but it is worth mentioning. I like the rubber material better as it isn't prone to rust like the stainless steel one probably is.
title: Love this!

author: Joan E. Fuller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2017
review_content: I would give this 5 stars but for one fact, it doesn't fit every tub.  No where in any of the reviews or other information have I come across the fact that this will not fit my standard 21/4" tub drain.  I read all the reviews and I believe them and I would love to utilize this product but before you purchase, just take a moment and see if your tub drain is 2", 21/4", etc because you will need to have a larger drain than that to fit this.  Newer homes may be being built with larger tub pipes/drains, I dunno.  My home is about 60 years old.  I wish this fit, I just know it would cure my drainage problem.
title: I read all the reviews and I believe them and I would love to utilize this product but before you purchase

author: RowNut405
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2019
review_content: I have thick hair and shed a lot. Wait, that makes me sound like a labrodore. Well, I'm a human, but yeah, lots of hair. I was tired of having to snake out my shower drain all the time because...eeeeeewww, so I decided to give this thing a try. It works great. I have to clean it about once a week which... eeeeeewww, but not as gross as snaking a drain. Just grab a kleenex, pull off all the icky hair and move on with your life. It's awesome to see all that hair that isn't ending up in my pipes. This thing is great. I'll be getting another one for my guest bathroom.
title: Works as advertised. Love it.

author: Kaci McCoy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2017
review_content: It does what it says it will and does it well. So well in fact that it becomes annoying to clean it out every few showers cuz the water's not draining. Like, am i going bald? How is there hair still on my head? Where did all this hair go before i bought this? Oh wow do not go down that nasty rabbit hole. Gross. I'd rather be annoyed and throwing away hair loops (you'll see what i mean when you buy it, which you should) than pull some monstrous hairy drain beast outta the pipes once the water REALLY won't drain. So just buy the dang thing.
title: Gross and Now I'm Worried I'm Going Bald

author: Stephstuff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020
review_content: I really don't know why it took my so long to get this. It works so good! Before I would try to catch my hair before it went down the drain, roll it up and stick it to the wall to throw away after I was done. But I couldn't get all the hairs. My poor husband had to regularly clean the drain because of my hair 😬.I'm so happy this works and catches all my hair! Now my husband doesnt have to regularly clean the drain anymore 😅
title: Great Product

author: Xelanys Morales
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
review_content: I bought this after I clogged my bathtub and the men who came to clean it pulled out a huge ball of hair the size of my head! It was so embarrassing. I was using a strainer type of drain cover, but it obviously didn't work as the hair was still getting through. This fit my tub well. The top half of it was out of the drain but it caught so much hair. It's super easy to clean with just a piece of toilet paper. Highly recommend.
title: Love It

author: MK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2019
review_content: I have long, thick hair & have always lost lots in the tub/shower, especially when I wash my hair. This is the first thing that’s ever caught all the hair & not let any go down the drain. This is easiest to clean when it’s dry rather than wet. It’s too slippery right after a bath when it’s wet. Just let it dry out. Pull out of drain, & the dry hair slips right off!!  Love this thing & am thinking of getting one for the sink too 👍
title: Works great!

author: Doc E. C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
review_content: This was a very costly mistake. Did not work at all. My tub clogged from the hair the Mushroom did not catch so I had to call a Plumber.Maybe it's because I have long fine hair but whatever it was there was never but a few strands of hair to clean from this product.
title: Had To Call a Plumber To Remove Hair

author: Megan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2017
review_content: I have hair that almost touches my waist line. Taking just one shower would clog my typical drain cover. The kind that lays flat and has the top bump with holes in it. I saw this product on Shark Tank and thought the idea and concept were great, but I was still skeptical because litteraly nothing else has worked for me. So I went on Amazon as the show was aring and found it! I bought it shortly after. It has been one of my most favorite recent purchases! It works wonderfully and best of all,  it is actually WELL MADE!!!
title: Best invention ever!

author: S. Hill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2016
review_content: It's hard to tell if there's hair or other gunk that gets past this handy little drain stopper, but I'd say based on the gunk that it catches, not much does. My daughter has long hair and we have two cats who like to play in the tub from time to time, so keeping hair out of the drain is always an issue. This handy device does the trick and it easy to remove and clean. I only wish it came in a size that would work for other drains. Still, I'm happy to have it and think it's well worth the money, especially if you have longer hair.
title: Catches lots of hair and gunk to keep your drain clean

author: HibiscusCutie05
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2016
review_content: *UPDATE*  I've had this thing for several years now and I STILL love it! I hate to think about all the hair that it's collected over the years being in my drain!I absolutely love this product! Before I bought this, I was constantly plastering hair on my shower wall so it wouldn't go down my drain and of course, there was still some that would. The first night I used the tubshroom, I decided to test it out and let all my hair go in the drain. I was shocked that it caught it all! I highly recommend it, specially for those with long hair such as myself. It works wonders!
title: BUY IT!!!

author: Dawdle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2017
review_content: Definitely does the job.  But clean it out after every shower, and then rinse off all the conditioner and stuff.  Otherwise, if it's unable to dry out quickly, because so much hair is sitting in it for a long time, mold will grow on it.  Then it will look ugly.  And you'll have this nasty eyesore you have to use all the time.Also, make sure you don't knock it askew while you're taking a shower.  You don't want to end up letting the hair go down the drain.  As long as you pay attention to what you're doing, it'll be fine.  It's not hard to get it right.I can't stand clogged drains, that's why I ordered this.  It totally does the trick!
title: Works.

author: Apoiuwerhpga
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2020
review_content: It is excellent at catching hair.  But it takes a half-hour to clean
title: the task is disgusting
verified: and it will never look like new again.I reverted to more conventional ways to prevent drain stoppage.  I don't use this anymore.  Too much hassle.
votes_helpful: I hate it.  I don't even use mine, anymore. A wasted purchase.

author: A. Supleme
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
review_content: I can see how this works for people. It is too wide for my shower drain so even though I can stuff it in, it just squinches and sometimes clogs. It is easier to clean when dry. Sometimes not able to clean all the way because stuff gets stuck through th tiny holes. Wish they had a smaller size to replace the one I have. Will not be buying again only because my tub is too narrow. If I had a wider tub I'd rebuy in a heartbeat.

author: Beth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2017
review_content: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING!! FINALLY a hair collector that works! I highly recommend this! We have tried many other screens and everything to collect thehair that clogs the shower drain and none of them have ever worked. This is the best invention yet! We have not had to dig out the drain hole at all since we started using the TubShroom. Our shower/tub has a weird drain pipe situation and was always clogged up and had to be cleaned out at least once a month. We have had this for months and not had a single problem since! We love it!
title: Highly recommended

author: Stephanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2017
review_content: This thing is great! I've tried so many other drain covers to catch my hair, but none have worked as well as this one. I have very long, very thick hair that constantly clogs my drains. I've used other types of drain covers, but they wouldn't stay stuck to the tub or didn't catch the hair well, but this one is perfect. Simple, easy installation (just plug it in). Simple, easy cleaning (just take it out and wipe it off, then put it back). And the best part is that it's way less gross than using one of those snake type drain cleaners. I really really love this thing.
title: This is the best

author: R. Nealon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2017
review_content: I've tried many products. This was the only one that worked. And brilliantly!Only caveat: do not push the Tubshroom all the way into the drain. It needs to have the water flow come in under the lip, so that centrifugal forces will wrap the hair around the Tubshroom.If it is all the way in, water has to come in thru the top 5 holes, which will quickly plug up with hair that cannot wrap around the now concealed shaft.I clean my Tubshroom twice a week. I'm always amazed by how much hair the 2 of us shed.
title: Works fantastically when properly used

author: JS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2020
review_content: Hair literally 'wraps around' rubber component on bottom.  Easy to clean.Would have given 5 stars, but wish the apparatus was a bit taller with more holes visible on top as it 'slows' the water  drainage from the shower, but overall, I do like it as it traps the majority of hair.Suggest to increase height with more added holes for drainage and that would be more accommodating, but overall, worth the money.
title: Overall, very good catcher.

author: ILS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2016
review_content: I got this TubSchroom a few weeks ago and the drain protector does what it says it's supposed to do. It keep my long hair from going down the drain and causing a huge block. Who wants to stand in gross water when you are taking a shower. One thing you have to keep in mind, is DO NOT push it down all the way. The holes on the top is NOT sufficient enough to let the shower water drain fast enough. So just keep it raised about 2 cm or so. I would recommend it for anyone that has longish hair. It's better than having to snake your tub when that inevitable clog comes around...
title: Good hair stopper for med to long haired people.

author: Jennifer T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: I wish I had known about this product sooner. It has been a life saver. We recently moved to a new apartment complex with not so great pipes, so our tub is constantly clogged no matter how often we have to use those liquid plumbers to unclog it. This product came up when I was doing my research, and thought why not it couldn't hurt. I am so glad that I made this purchase. It helps catch all of my long hair and super easy to remove and clean. awesome product. definitely a repurchase in the future once ours get worn out.
title: Good product

author: Freyja Hadji
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2018
review_content: I was hesitant to purchase this, as $13 seemed kinda steep, but I am glad that I did.  This sucker catches way more hair than any of the other kinds I have have did.  Wonderful for short hairs, long hairs, pet hair, etc.  It can get a little gunked up with soap residue, but that is a result of it functioning so well with the shorter hairs.  I really like how it doesn't cause water to pool.  Plus, it looks pretty cute and comes in a lot of colors, so you can coordinate.  Great purchase.
title: Works way better and is less gross than others.

author: Keith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2018
review_content: Wife and daughter were constantly clogging the tub with hair. After spending two hours and two containers of drain cleaner to get a good drain flow I hit Amazon for a solution. We’ve had the disc like plastic strainers before, but those have a habit of floating away so I tried this for a change. I was a bit skeptical at first. Since nothing actually covers the drain I was relying on the engineering of the product. After the first week I noticed a slight slow down in drain speed so I pulled the Shroom to see what we had. Sure enough there was a significant bit of hair wrapped around the device. I was able to simply remove the hair and replace the Shroom and my drain was saved.
title: Love it

author: Kelly McCafferty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
review_content: Pros:1. It does catch the great majority of hair.2. Is minimal and simplistic in style, which is convenient for various styles and such.3. Comes in many colors.4. Is made of durable and quality materials and is able to bend while retaining its shape.5. Relatively easy and quick to clean.Cons:1. Has a difficult time drying, especially if in a tub used frequently and by more than one person. This will cause a bit of a mess when cleaning the shroom, because it collects hair with products, such as shampoo and conditioner. But, honestly, it is not that big of a deal. I simply use a paper towel or toilet paper to grab the wet hair, since I rather not touch it directly.2. If you have a frequent shedder or long, especially thick and curly hair (like me), you must clean the shroom every 3-5 days. For me, also not a big deal. Cleaning only takes a moment.
title: Quick Summary After a Month of Use (in a simple list format):

author: L. Albrecht
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2019
review_content: Easy to use, effective at catching hair. Have not had to snake our open style drain since using this. Last one we had used for a couple years, maybe 3?. Had to replace as it wouldn't clean up well anymore. Since we got good use out of the first one, decided to spend the few dollars again, worth it for this little contraption.
title: Effective drain catch

author: Paul Bourget
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018
review_content: It takes a little getting used to, if you get a brightly colored one, but the tubshroom does exactly what it says it will, it's easy to remove and clean because of its shape (I don't have any hand disabilities or anything, but the top is wide, like... well, the top of a mushroom, shocker - so it's really easy to grab). Obviously you will need to clean out the shroom periodically, as draining will slow down as it gets coated in hair over time, but I haven't seen it clog yet, and 2/3 people using this shower have long hair, and 1/3 has a long beard, so we are making it work. No complaints at all.
title: Works and does as advertised.

author: T. Malone
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2018
review_content: This tub shroom works perfectly! It really traps the hair and is a snap to clean. All you do is pop it in the drain. It will sit above the tub surface about a half inch which lets the water drain. When the water starts running slow in about a week or two just pull it out, take off the hair and pop it back in, easy peasy. I am pretty confident that it is catching pretty much all the hair. I would recommend it to friends for sure. As a matter of fact, I plan on giving a couple as gifts.
title: So easy to use and it works!

author: Alyssa Tuttle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2019
review_content: This is the 2nd tub shroom I bought after the first one was so awesome! I do my best to not let my hair go down the drain, but regardless, a lot still goes down the drain which is now caught by the tub shroom! I’d say we have to clean the hair off about every other day to keep the water draining. Only thing I don’t like about the tub shroom is that it gets dirty in the drain holes and it’s hard to get the gunk out.

author: GreenEyedHollie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2017
review_content: Not much to add about the TubShroom that hasn't already been said. I have a massive head of long hair and I clog the tub and sink yearly. I didn't realize how much hair I was losing and how clogging it was to the pipes. Great little product. You can't go wrong and it's fascinating to see what it collects. The only thing wrong with it....it's NOT made in the USA. Bummer. I'd pay 20$ for this if it were made here....easy.
title: Can't go wrong

author: Andrew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
review_content: Works awesome!  from human hair to when we bathe the cats this does an excellent job of catching hair and it's pretty easy to clean too.  I just use some tissue and pull the hair off the bottom and throw it into the trash.It's super-soft silicone so even hitting it with my feet cannot cause any stubbed toes.  in our shower/tub it sticks up a bit which isn't a big deal, still works and fits fine.

author: Christy Morrison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2018
review_content: Moved into the most beautiful mobile home and did not realize how tiny tiny their drains are. This worked! I see a lot of complaints about how it doesn't work because it gets clogged up and um, hello! That is what it does because it keeps the gunk out before it goes down the drain. Now I just pop this baby out and it is easy to clean because of it's material- a very smooth silicone- and even pop it in the dish washing machine when I clean my tub to get it sanitized. Much easier than any other drain filters as well because it sits a bit on top so that the water runs through it more easily. Love this!
title: Moved into the most beautiful mobile home and did not realize how tiny tiny ...

review_content: So far so good, the only reason I do not give it the full 5 stars is it seems to have a draining issue. I will review in the future about the product durability if it gets through 1 year.
title: So far so good.

author: Cait O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2016
review_content: I like the product. I was able to get rid of my old drain cover that always caught a bunch of hair. Why did I give the TubShroom 4 stars, you ask? You have to stay on top of cleaning it. If you don't wipe it down at least every other shower, it gets gunky and gross. If you don't have a problem with that, that's fine, but it's become just one more thing to clean in the bathroom.The product does work as advertised though. It does catch hair and keep it out of sight until you pull it out of the tub to clean it. Again, you have to keep it clean or it won't work as well. If it gets gunky, the water won't flow through the little holes as well.
title: I like the product

author: lfyfain
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
review_content: Best hair catcher ever! We have a border collie that sheds an ungodly amount of hair every shower and this hair catcher can catch it all. author: Jenny Lynn

author: HonestlySuzie

author: Len

author: Ashley McClain

Occasionally, every other week, I throw it in the dishwasher to thoroughly clean it and prevent mildew growth. author: In the Clouds
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019
review_content: I have been using store-bought strainers for years and never had a problem until I moved into a new house. Suddenly, no matter how often I cleaned out the strainer, I would find myself in at least an inch of water by the end of a short shower. I even had a plumber out; he didn't charge me and told me my strainer was a great thing to use, but the ultimate cause of my drainage issue. After my complaints, my dad suggested this tub mushroom thing. Sounded absurd, but it has been an amazing purchase. I don't have to worry about hair clogging the pipes or standing in a pool of water after a short shower. I was so skeptical but WOW what a difference. If you're having the same problem, try this weird thing.I've only had it a few weeks though so longevity is TBD.
title: Exactly what I needed!

author: trsgrl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2017
review_content: This thing is the best ever!! I first came across an ad for the TubShroom on Instagram, and I was immediately interested in buying it because I have long hair that sheds horribly. I was previously looking for a good hair catcher for my shower drain, but I could never find anything that seemed like it would work well. But this hair catcher took two seconds to install and it catches hair without it grossly floating around the water like other hair catchers seem to do. The hair is really easy to remove after a shower, and I'm so grateful for this genius product. Never again will I have to snake my shower drain. If you're considering getting a hair catcher for your shower, then trust me this is the one you need to get!
title: The BEST hair catcher

author: Hank2000
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2019
review_content: This works just as advertised which is rare.  Easy to install and easy to clean.  I don't understand why some of the other reviews were poor and complained about cleaning it. author: Ernest
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2019
review_content: The Tubshroom is living up to its name. It does trap hair from going down shower drain. It stick out a bit of the drain, but not enough to be a nuisance. When you notice the slow draining water just pull out Tubshroom, grab a paper towel and pull the hair out. Replace Tubshroom and it will drain properly. Highly recommended.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2017
review_content: I love it, it works really well. Probably don't want to buy white as it looks really dirty and gross after awhile. author: Jessica Pinkney
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
review_content: I got the TubShroom because I lose a LOT of hair everytime I shower.  I had been using a mesh drain cover that I had to remove and clean after every shower.  And the tub would always start to back up with water before I was done with my shower.  I bought the TubShroom thinking it would eliminate the need to remove and clean the drain every time, and because it had so many holes, it would allow the shower to keep draining.  Unfortunately, that has not been the case for me.  I still have to clean and remove it everytime.  And the drain still backed up and started to fill the tub before my shower was done.  The TubShroom is still worth it to keep the hair from going down the drain and causing bad clogs, but you will have to remove it and clean it after every shower, just like a cheap mesh drain cover.

author: yelllouise
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2016
review_content: Ok I know there is a lot of hype around products like these and then you buy them and they are s*** but not this one!  There are 5 females in my house with LONG hair plus we have 2 guys, 2 dogs and a cat.  This bad boy not only collects all of the hair but taking the hair off of it is a breeze! I'm not kidding you.  Because its silicone you just wipe the hair down and the base kind of folds in on itself so that the hair just slips over it and off.  There is truly no more fighting over who is going to clean the drain or the tub shroom because its so easy and you don't have to really touch it to get it off!  I wish I hadn't spent the last 15 years with out this bad boy! I highly recommend getting one of these and get one for family members too or friends they will love it too!

author: Becky763

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2017
review_content: Saw a promo video for this shared in Facebook and decided to check it out on Amazon.com. I was impressed by the promo video and further impressed by the great reviews on Amazon. It's catching my wife's hair really well while still allowing our shower to drain. The TubShroom fits great, stays in place, is easy to remove and clean, and allows for good draining. I highly recommend!
title: This thing is amazing. Seriously!

author: Kelly Sharp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
review_content: I have VERY long hair and I’m a shedder. I usually have hair all over the shower wall because if I put it down the drain, it gets clogged.  I can’t tell you how many times I’ve had to use chemicals to unclog my bathtub drain because of standing water. This last time, nothing was working. I used FOUR bottles of draino and it didn’t work even a bit. The water was well past my ankles and I couldn’t take it anymore. I thought I was going to have to snake the drain, but turns out, all of my hair was caught on the inside of the drain cover and that’s why nothing would work. I used this today and it was amazing how much hair it caught! The picture attached is just after MY shower. I do anticipate having to clean the tubshroom after each shower, but that’s not a big deal. The hair came off extremely easy. Other reviewers have complained it was hard for them to do it while wet, but I cleaned mine directly after my shower and it came clean perfectly. I’ve only used it once, so time will tell how it holds up. But it’s cheap, so even if you had to replace it every year, it’s honestly not that big of a deal. So far, it does what it’s supposed to and that’s all I wanted.
title: Perfect for long hair!

author: Amber Lehrman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2019
review_content: Our whole family has long hair and we routinely had to dig nasty clumps of hair out of our tub trap for years even with the simple metal grates installed over the drain.  Since installing this several months ago, we haven't had any issues at all.  It is incredible how well it catches the hair and lint.  A couple of other reviewers have said that it didn't fit correctly because it sits higher than the tub, but it is supposed to do that.  That is the genius - by allowing water and debris to flow all the way around the cylinder, it can catch more stuff while still allowing the tub to drain.  It SHOULD sit a quarter inch or so above the tub to work properly.  It is a bit gross to clean it, but its so much easier than digging out the fermented stuff in the drain trap that we really don't mind at all.  I can't recommend this highly enough!
title: This product saved us!

author: Kevin Cawley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
review_content: I absolutely love this hair catcher It's actually really nice that the whole thing is flexible because most people know when hair is put into a clogged drain catcher that the hair just ties itself up and Makes it really hard to get the hair off and you have to use scissors to cut it but because this is flexible you can literally just grab and pull it right off the bottom Love love love this product!!!!
title: Must get does what it's supposed to and is perfect for any shower

author: HANNAH CLINGE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020
review_content: I brush my hair before I shower, pull out all the loose hair. I also try to remove all the loose hair while I shower and still have to clean my drain at least twice a week.I've tried so many different products to catch the hair and nothing works as good as this. Hands down, best product on the market! Easy to use, easy to clean, I love it! I highly recommend this product!
title: Absolutely amazing!

author: x
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020
review_content: It really works! I looked at this for years but figured it wasn't possible to catch as much as it said and it's a little more than I wanted to spend. I have waist length, incredibly thick and textured hair though, and at this point I should probably just buy stock in Draino as much as I use. I finally caved and I'm so glad! It is a little hard to place it just right while staying straight and you may not get it right the first few times (it will be a stopper), but that might also just be my tub, and after awhile I figured it out.
title: It Really Works!

author: PKV
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2019
review_content: This is our 3rd TubShroom.  They work well but grow mold/mildew which plugs the holes and need to be replaced every 6-9 months.  We clean ours often and have tried many cleaners to reduce/remove the mold without any success.  As for the daily hair catching it works great and is easy to clean until it gets clogged with mold.
title: Lasts 6-9 Months

author: Danny
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
review_content: This catches hair, but it doesn’t really fit in my drain well. I have to smash it in so it’s already bent and probably won’t last long. The water drains extra slow, and it sticks out a lot higher than the instructions say it will. Not very impressed, will find one from a different company.
title: Not worth it

author: lena
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
review_content: I was really skeptical about this because my dad is a plumber and he kept saying it was rubbish. I finally decided to just buy one because my husband was tired of cleaning out the drain with my hair in it. I'm a believer y'all! I will never not have one of these in my drain. It collects the hair and is so easy to clean. Just buy it. Don't debate like I did. It'll save everyone in the long run.
title: Game Changer

author: Paperie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2018
review_content: This really works. I kind of wish we could turn it upside down because it is less of a look that way and the water drains faster. Anyway, when you put it correct side up where the overhanging top is above the hold a bit, it definitely catches the hair. Cute color. Seems like a great gift for everyone. I like that it's gentle on my tub floor because my mesh strainer scratched my floor and stabbed me one too many times.
title: Works

author: Michael Higham
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: It does what it is made to do; however, make sure you have the right size drain for the proper fit.  I've got a one pice shower unit, which does not have the drain(s) this is designed for.  Consequently, this strainer sits higher up that it should, but it does do a good job of catching hair, and it is easy to clean.  Just wished it was a bit more suited to my shower's drain.
title: TubShroom the Revolutionary Tub Drain Protector Hair Catcher/Strainer/Snare -  Does the Job

author: Eric Nichols
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2017
review_content: This is pretty awesome. Catches ALL hair. This product is worth more than it costs if you had trouble with a hair clogging a drain even once before.Tip: have the trash can close to the shower so you can throw away the crazy amount of hair it can catch before stopping up and you don't have to just throw it on the sill and not take care of it until you have collected 5 clumps and you ponder how the hell this awesome little plug catches so much hair and you somehow miraculously are not bald from shedding so much.
title: Worth more than it costs

author: Scott Michaels
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2018
review_content: Firstly I wish to say, measure your drains and make sure that this product will fit as advertised and also to make sure it is the right drain design as well.Honestly I bought this for my sister. We were having to poke around the basement every month or so to rip open the lines from the shower and pull a wad of her hair from it because the drain would suddenly back up.We tried so many types of hair-catches, obviously to no avail. Until I found this unique little thing and tried it out.Honestly it's been a game changer. We've not had to rip open the plumbing to pull out hair ever since I bought this thing, it works perfectly and as advertised.Simple plug it in the drain, and (for my family at least) we have to clean it off once a week and will give it a hand wash with dish soap to keep it clean.I couldn't have asked for a better product.
title: Make sure your drain is the correct design and size before you buy!

author: Carol
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
review_content: I had tried a few kinds of hair stoppers before purchasing this product. I thought my last one was working just fine.... until my tub didn't drain and we had to call our the plumber! I always did the good ol "stick-hair-on-the-wall-of-the-shower" trick too... but apparently I was doing a terrible job at keeping all my hair from going down the drain while simultaneously annoying my husband by forgetting to toss it after each shower. (Ladies - you know exactly what I mean).I bought this product and love it. I know it is full of hair when my tub doesn't drain quickly. Cleaning the hair from the shroom is super quick and easy. And I really don't think hair is going down the drain!
title: EASY

author: Stanley Yang
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
review_content: This is an item where it fits the use, but at a price that is way higher than it should be. But hey, it works and it fits my tub so I can't complain too much.The installation is a bit hard since the "one size fits all" really just means that the bottom lid is just larger so it folds up to fix the drainage hole. But you can't really get it perfectly centered. It leans one way or another.
title: Its good, but way overpriced.

author: Kyle Youngblood
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2020
review_content: Wife: no, it gets backed up after one use, I don’t want to be ankle deep in my own paraphernalia, and that’s what happens after 1 shower. It captures hair and weird shower suds - the suds team up with the hair to clog the shroom. I’d rather die than clean this daily (or hire a plumber to snake the drain for $180/year).Husband: yes. $180 is $179 too many. I don’t mind cleaning it. I don’t mind being ankle deep in my own paraphernalia - it is my own paraphernalia after all. My wife is crazy.
title: So much hair

author: Darcy Osheim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2017
review_content: This has saved me so much time unclogging the bathtub.  I used to have to use a hanger to dig around and try and get all the hair from 4 people from down the drain.  While this gets a little gross, it's and easy wipe with toilet paper and a soak in bleach to clean it.Only downside is that because it's not a stopper and I have kids, we have to keep the stopper on hand for when the kids want to take a bath.  However that's such a small issue, and definitely doesn't stop us from using it.We've been using it for a while, and I would definitely buy again
title: No more clogged tubs!

author: Colin Murphy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
review_content: They work. They actually work. I have long, thick hair. Husband has thick hair and a luscious beard. My drains no longer get clogged or nasty. Just make sure you clean the discarded hair out regularly. Just grab two tissues/ t.p. and wipe the shrooms off. I like to wipe with Clorox wipe & rinse with hot water once a week. So much easier than futzing with clogged hairy drains!!
title: No gimmicks, they just work

author: L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020
review_content: I'm not sure why this is marketed as revolutionary, because it really isn't. Sure, the top kind of prevents you from seeing the hair at the bottom, but you weren't going to closely stare at it anyway.I don't know how she does it, but my roommate keeps stepping on/dropping things on the elevated top so that the snare falls down and blocks the drain, resulting in a back build of water... You need to put it in so the top is elevated, otherwise it really slows down the water drainage. This actually seems to me like a 'revolutionary' design flaw, because it makes it too easy (for her) to push down so the top rests on the sides of the drain :)
title: not revolutionary but it works!

author: Kona
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
review_content: The product came on time, no damage to the product, I ordered blue. We all have the hair going down the drain & the omg/gross/gag/throwing up, dont wanna yank it outta the drain. Monster! Yeah that makes me gag lol. Ive been using mine for about 2 weeks and it does work, after a shower I take it out, wash it & yup take off the hair & it goes back into the tub. Makes it WAY easier then the other way. My only negative is the 12+$ price.. Other then that it works lol
title: It works!!

author: Sarah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2018
review_content: I am in LOVE with the TubShroom! It works perfectly with my drains. I was a little cautious with purchasing, as I figured it would end up being just another wasted product to get thrown away, but I was pleasantly surprised! It truly does trap all hair, very easy to clean off, and fits into every drain I have in my home! Mine did stick out more than the packaging claims it should, but it definitely doesn’t seem to have any effect as to how well the product works.
title: Great for preventing clogged drains!

author: Shirley J Power
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
review_content: This hasn't yet been used (just not yet in the habit of remembering!), but the SinkShroom works VERY WELL, so there is not reason to believe the TubShroom would be any different.  If it does, it will likely save a lot of plumbing headaches later, and all for just a teeny bit of prevention.  Based on the experience with the SinkShroom, it would be advisable to clean it after each use - it's less disgusting and much easier.  Someone had a great idea that really works.
title: Expect it to work as well as the SinkShroom

author: HearMeOut
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020
review_content: I love the TubShroom but don't cheap out like I did, buy the metal one. The plastic one works perfectly, but for more durability, a nicer professional look in your tub, spend the few extra dollars and get the metal one. I used this plastic one to see if it would "do the job" and then upgraded to metal. Should have just bought metal to begin with. I am a huge fan of the TubShroom.
title: Love it but buy the metal version...

author: Alice [unblocked]
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2017
review_content: Around our home, the cat and I are in an unspoken competition to see who can shed the most. Unfortunately, the long haired human tends to clog up the tub, while the cat greets her father with the occasional hairball.Enter the TubShroom, which has nimbly resolved one of these two issues for these past few months. Provided it gets emptied every other day or so, water is able to flow freely down the drain where it belongs. The only real drawback is having to reinstall the drain plug whenever we want to take a bath instead of a shower.If you do put off cleaning the device, it can start to grow mildew and mold. In such cases, get rid of the hair, and run the TubShroom through a regular cycle in your dishwasher. Voilà, good as new!
title: Cleaner drains and a happier husband

author: Surfrider0414
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
review_content: Honestly, I kind of thought this would be a gimmick. Maybe its the name and the packaging, but it looked like an "as seen on TV" item that you end up getting suckered into buying and it is not nearly as effective as you expect. However, this product does EXACTLY what it promises. It does an excellent job of trapping all the hair going through the drain. The cleanup porton isn't so fun, but its a testament to its effectiveness. I would recommend this to anyone who needs an effective drain to catch any debris traveling through the drains!
title: The real deal

author: Autumn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
review_content: Been using this forever! Forgot to review it when I first got it, so now is the best time to use it! Had this for about a year and still using it!! Not sure why I had to rate for a suction power because it has no suction. You just stick it in your drain and it collects hair. Which is does an AMAZING job at!!! Well worth the money!!! Our drain used to constantly be clogged but once we got tub shroom it hasn’t been clogged since! You just pick it up, wipe the hair off and use again!! Love this product!!
title: EXCELLENT!

author: Customer MSH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2017
review_content: If I could give this item more then 5 stars, I would. I love it!! I have had it for a month now and will say that I can see a very significant difference. The hair trap is very easy to clean as well. And I don't have to touch the hair. I can lift the trap out of the drain and pull the hair off with a napkin. It takes less then a minute to clean. And I am no longer clogging the shower up with my long hair!! If you're cleaning your drains more then once every 2 weeks or so because the shower won't drain, I recommend this product. It is work the $13!!
title: Get this now!

author: Polymath
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2016
review_content: It does the job of keeping hair from going down the drain very well.  Three people in our house have long hair.  We had our tub unclogged last week and it was due to hair.  A few days later, the TubShroom arrived and it's already catching all the hair that would otherwise go down the drain.  You'll be surprised how much it catches in just a week.  If it's not catching it all, then it's catching 99% of it.  I don't see any hair in the drain hole at all.  This product is far superior to any other drain catcher we've had.  As claimed in the video, it's very easy to clean.
title: Best Drain Catcher I've Ever Bought

author: FizzySmile
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2017
review_content: I was very skeptical of this product.  It seemed to be too good to be true.  However, I'm impressed. Not only does it catch the hair--even very short hair-- it is very easy to clean.  It also doesn't get clogged up with soap residue or conditioner like other drain catchers, so the water drains out of the tub easily.  My only concern is how long it will stay "white."  Anything that is a plastic material that I've used in the shower eventually yellows with age.  Other than that one concern, I'm very pleased with the performance of this product.
title: I was skeptical...

author: SamiKat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020
review_content: This drain protector is AMAZING. Seriously, amazing. Earlier this year I was having hair thinning issues from an autoimmune disease I have, and since my hair was about 8-10" long, it was miserable washing my hair, both for me and my tub drain. I got this just to see if it would work a little bit, and omg, it worked way more than a little bit. It caught every single loose hair that fell off of my scalp. I also have an old tub with a weird drain size, so it was a relief that it fit so well.The only non-issue that I have is that I had to unscrew my tub stopper to use this, which means I have to screw it back in if I want to plug the tub to fill it, but with how well this tub shroom works, I have zero problems with that. Seriously, I cannot recommend this thing enough.
title: Works better than expected!

author: Elle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2019
review_content: I have really long hair and it took me a while to realize that it was the cause of my drain getting clogged in my tub. This little device is PERFECT. All my stray hair gets caught and wraps around the middle part. There are openings that allow water to flow through and doesn’t cause any backup. Hair stays nicely wrapped around the middle so it’s super easy to remove! The only thing is sudsy shampoos and body washes will get caught in your hair but you just have to rinse it to get it out so it’s not a problem!
title: Catches all my long hair
